column1: 4260409286,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-scalapay-4260409286?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=Kb90JdxJdNHl%2FL38b3zTQQ%3D%3D&trackingId=xYhNmOmdr%2BUwNzPTh3mqQQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Scalapay,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","At Scalapay, we‚Äôre shaping a culture with high standards, independent and critical thought, innovation, ownership, and continuous learning. We operate in a fast-moving, tech-driven environment, and we‚Äôre looking for people who thrive in change, think boldly, and take initiative.

If you‚Äôre ready to put your potential to the test in a hiring process designed to spotlight exceptional talent, this is your chance to stand out and grow with one of Europe‚Äôs most ambitious fintech teams.

Our data team seeks a Data Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with Scalapay‚Äôs key Business Units such as Product, Marketing and Sales, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.
Serve as the data point of reference for our key Business Units, providing them with necessary support
Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement
Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making
Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights
Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data
Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes
Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation
Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay
Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling.
You‚Äôll be great for this role if:
You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with a background in startups or fintech
You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus
You are proficient in data visualisation tools and data storytelling
You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses
You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way
You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas
You‚Äôre more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!
Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary we have for this position is up to 40'000‚Ç¨ (Gross Annual Base)
International environment with significant challenges to be met every day
Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences
Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.
Initial Chat: A brief conversation with our Talent Acquisition team
Hiring Manager Interview: A deep dive into your experience and motivation for the role
Case Study: A skills-based test with a debriefing session involving key stakeholders
Final Chat with Simone (CEO): An opportunity to discuss Scalapay‚Äôs values and assess cultural alignment.
Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.
Pro tip: send your CV in English üòâ
Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but‚Ä¶ we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.
We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

Do Work That Matters - Your Role and Responsibilities

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and your colleagues tackle and solve the most current and complex challenges.

The Digital Assurance Team is KPMG‚Äôs innovative team which brings together different skill sets to shape the digitalization of the future for assurance and audit services. You will have the opportunity to work alongside expert auditors ‚Äì through in-house courses and especially on-the-job training ‚Äì developing the ability to critically analyse the company processes used in financial reporting and the information processed by the companies‚Äô IT systems, identifying errors and interpreting the dynamics underlying financial performance.
Specifically, you will be tasked with:
The development of analytics solutions for audit teams (transactional analytics, dashboards for the analysis of accounting data, process mining, process KPIs, etc.)
The development of audit techniques based on the use of innovative technological solutions
Assistance to the audit teams in using the new solutions
The organization of communication initiatives to raise awareness of the project/solutions.
Come As You Are - Your Skills and Characteristics
This is the perfect opportunity for you if:
You have a business/accounting background with a degree in business subject
You have a strong interest in financial reporting and data analytics
You have a desire to learn and challenge yourself
You want to grow within an International Network
Your Future With Us - What You Will Find at KPMG
An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages, and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork. [NL1]
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programs to stay current.
Initiatives focused on physical and mental well-being.
Together for Better ‚Äì Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for individuality, continuous learning, transparency, community engagement, integrity: these are the values of KPMG that create an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, allowing our professionals to express their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality.

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG‚Äôs privacy policy .

  • Sviluppo di soluzioni di analytics a supporto dei team di audit (transactional analytics, dashboard di analisi di dati contabili, process mining, KPI di processo, ecc)
  • Sviluppo di tecniche di revisione basate sull‚Äôutilizzo di soluzioni tecnologiche innovative
  • Supporto ai team nell‚Äôutilizzo delle soluzioni proposte
  • Cura di eventi di comunicazione volti a far conoscere il progetto / le soluzioni

Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:

  • Hai una formazione di base economico-contabile
  • Hai spiccato interesse per l‚Äôarea del reporting finanziario e per i data analytics
  • Hai voglia di imparare e metterti in gioco
  • Vuoi crescere all‚Äôinterno di un Network Internazionale

Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG

  • Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
  • Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
  • Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
  • Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
  • Mindset internazionale e progettualit√† innovative
  • Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico

Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parit√† di genere.

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG .

KPMG S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.

The chance to build a better future is right in front of you

Responsibilities

 Do Work That Matters - Your Role and Responsibilities

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and your colleagues tackle and solve the most current and complex challenges.

The Digital Assurance Team is KPMG‚Äôs innovative team which brings together different skill sets to shape the digitalization of the future for assurance and audit services. You will have the opportunity to work alongside expert auditors ‚Äì through in-house courses and especially on-the-job training ‚Äì developing the ability to critically analyse the company processes used in financial reporting and the information processed by the companies‚Äô IT systems, identifying errors and interpreting the dynamics underlying financial performance.

Starting date: September 2025

Type of contract : Apprenticeship

Office: Milan

Specifically, you will be tasked with:

  • The development of analytics solutions for audit teams (transactional analytics, dashboards for the analysis of accounting data, process mining, process KPIs, etc.)
  • The development of audit techniques based on the use of innovative technological solutions
  • Assistance to the audit teams in using the new solutions
  • The organization of communication initiatives to raise awareness of the project/solutions.

Skills

 Come As You Are - Your Skills and Characteristics

This is the perfect opportunity for you if:

  • You have a business/accounting background with a degree in business subject
  • You have a strong interest in financial reporting and data analytics
  • You have a desire to learn and challenge yourself
  • You want to grow within an International Network

Your Future With Us - What You Will Find at KPMG

  • An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages, and values diversity.
  • A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork. [NL1]
  • Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
  • Advanced training and development programs to stay current.
  • International mindset and innovative projects.
  • Initiatives focused on physical and mental well-being.

Together for Better ‚Äì Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for individuality, continuous learning, transparency, community engagement, integrity: these are the values of KPMG that create an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, allowing our professionals to express their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG‚Äôs privacy policy .

KPMG S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments ‚Äì making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money.

We're a movement empowering millions of people, driven by a shared purpose to tackle big challenges. And we're just getting started. We move quickly, think boldly, and trust each other to challenge the norm, learning and growing as we go.
If you're looking for more than just your next job ‚Äì if you want to build something impactful with a talented team ‚Äì you're in the right place.

As a Data Analyst, you‚Äôll play a key role in enhancing our data-driven decision-making and optimizing product and business processes by researching, analyzing, and visualizing data to drive impactful solutions. Here‚Äôs what your day-to-day will look like:
Drive impact ‚Äì By researching and implementing rigorous data-driven solutions that bring concrete value to product and business lines.
Analyze data ‚Äì To interpret datasets, derive actionable insights, and support critical decision-making processes across various teams.
Design experiments ‚Äì To develop and manage A/B tests that optimize and guide product and process enhancements based on measurable results.
Create visualisations ‚Äì To track key metrics and assist in the creation of visual representations (dashboards, maps) for effective communication of analytical insights to stakeholders.
Manage analytic solutions ‚Äì By modernizing, standardizing, troubleshooting, and maintaining existing tools to ensure accuracy and reliability of our data infrastructure.
Expect challenges, collaboration, and the freedom to bring your ideas to life. Things change quickly here, so be ready to adapt, take initiative, and shape your role as we grow.

We need a problem-solver with a strong analytical mindset who thrives in a collaborative environment. If you‚Äôre detail-oriented and ready to take ownership in a dynamic setting, you‚Äôll fit right in! Does this sound like you?
Relevant experience ‚Äì 3+ years of experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics, demonstrating a strong understanding of data analysis principles.
Strong analytical skills ‚Äì With proven analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to tackle complex data challenges.
Technical proficiency ‚Äì Advanced knowledge of SQL, including query optimization techniques for efficient data retrieval and manipulation.
Programming skills ‚Äì Extensive knowledge of Python or R for statistical analysis, data manipulation, and automation of analytical tasks.
Data visualization skills ‚Äì Experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar visualization tools to create insightful and easily understandable data representations.

Don't worry if you don't tick every box. We believe in the power of different viewpoints and strengths. Your unique perspective is important as we build something special. If you're passionate and can make a difference, we truly encourage you to apply.

We believe high commitment, effort, and impact deserve to be highly rewarded and supported. That‚Äôs why we created Satispay CareAbout, our way of making sure you‚Äôre supported in your well-being, growth, and finances:
Psychological support & mental health webinars with Serenis
Stock Option Plan (with additional grants often provided based on performance)

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, colour, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

About Satispay

Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments ‚Äì making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money.

We're a movement empowering millions of people, driven by a shared purpose to tackle big challenges. And we're just getting started. We move quickly, think boldly, and trust each other to challenge the norm, learning and growing as we go.

If you're looking for more than just your next job ‚Äì if you want to build something impactful with a talented team ‚Äì you're in the right place.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

As a Data Analyst, you‚Äôll play a key role in enhancing our data-driven decision-making and optimizing product and business processes by researching, analyzing, and visualizing data to drive impactful solutions. Here‚Äôs what your day-to-day will look like:

  • Drive impact ‚Äì By researching and implementing rigorous data-driven solutions that bring concrete value to product and business lines.
  • Analyze data ‚Äì To interpret datasets, derive actionable insights, and support critical decision-making processes across various teams.
  • Design experiments ‚Äì To develop and manage A/B tests that optimize and guide product and process enhancements based on measurable results.
  • Create visualisations ‚Äì To track key metrics and assist in the creation of visual representations (dashboards, maps) for effective communication of analytical insights to stakeholders.
  • Manage analytic solutions ‚Äì By modernizing, standardizing, troubleshooting, and maintaining existing tools to ensure accuracy and reliability of our data infrastructure.

Expect challenges, collaboration, and the freedom to bring your ideas to life. Things change quickly here, so be ready to adapt, take initiative, and shape your role as we grow.

Who We‚Äôre Looking For

We need a problem-solver with a strong analytical mindset who thrives in a collaborative environment. If you‚Äôre detail-oriented and ready to take ownership in a dynamic setting, you‚Äôll fit right in! Does this sound like you?

  • Relevant experience ‚Äì 3+ years of experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics, demonstrating a strong understanding of data analysis principles.
  • Strong analytical skills ‚Äì With proven analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to tackle complex data challenges.
  • Technical proficiency ‚Äì Advanced knowledge of SQL, including query optimization techniques for efficient data retrieval and manipulation.
  • Programming skills ‚Äì Extensive knowledge of Python or R for statistical analysis, data manipulation, and automation of analytical tasks.
  • Data visualization skills ‚Äì Experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar visualization tools to create insightful and easily understandable data representations.

Don't worry if you don't tick every box. We believe in the power of different viewpoints and strengths. Your unique perspective is important as we build something special. If you're passionate and can make a difference, we truly encourage you to apply.

  • Esperienza internazionale e ottima conoscenza dell‚Äôinglese.
  • Conoscenza di almeno un tool di Business Intelligence (es. Tableau) e programmazione in Python (o R) con librerie per l‚Äôanalisi dati.
  • Basi solide in statistica, probabilit√†, modellizzazione matematica e tecniche di machine learning

esperienza in data analysis o consulenza √® un plus.

We are seeking a motivated and curious Data Analyst Intern to join our Operations team and help us build and enhance reporting, dashboards, and analytical tools across our logistics and supply chain operations. You‚Äôll work closely with regional leaders in Commercial, Sales and Logistics to support visibility, identify inefficiencies, and enable data-driven decisions in a dynamic, multinational environment.
Support the design, development, and automation of operational reports and KPIs across countries
Analyze logistics performance data (e.g., transportation, warehousing, order fulfillment)
Create dashboards (Power BI or Excel-based) that provide actionable insights for the operations team
Partner with supply chain, planning, and logistics stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver solutions
Support ad hoc analysis and deep dives into operational bottlenecks or cost drivers
Identify opportunities to streamline data processes and improve data accuracy
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs student in Engineering, Business Analytics, Statistics, Data Science, or related field
Solid skills in Excel (advanced functions, pivot tables, etc.)
Familiarity with Power BI or other dashboarding tools will help a lot
Basic knowledge of SQL is a big plus
Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate in an international team
Proactive attitude, willingness to learn, and ability to work independently

Seniority Level:

Role Overview

We are seeking a motivated and curious Data Analyst Intern to join our Operations team and help us build and enhance reporting, dashboards, and analytical tools across our logistics and supply chain operations. You‚Äôll work closely with regional leaders in Commercial, Sales and Logistics to support visibility, identify inefficiencies, and enable data-driven decisions in a dynamic, multinational environment.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support the design, development, and automation of operational reports and KPIs across countries
  • Analyze logistics performance data (e.g., transportation, warehousing, order fulfillment)
  • Create dashboards (Power BI or Excel-based) that provide actionable insights for the operations team
  • Partner with supply chain, planning, and logistics stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver solutions
  • Support ad hoc analysis and deep dives into operational bottlenecks or cost drivers
  • Identify opportunities to streamline data processes and improve data accuracy

What We‚Äôre Looking For

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs student in Engineering, Business Analytics, Statistics, Data Science, or related field
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset
  • Solid skills in Excel (advanced functions, pivot tables, etc.)
  • Familiarity with Power BI or other dashboarding tools will help a lot
  • Basic knowledge of SQL is a big plus
  • Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate in an international team
  • Proactive attitude, willingness to learn, and ability to work independently

At FrieslandCampina, we‚Äôre more than a global dairy company ‚Äî we‚Äôre a purpose-driven organization committed to nourishing the world with high-quality, nutritious products. With over 18,000 employees across 100+ countries, we are united by a passion for innovation, sustainability, and excellence.

We‚Äôre currently looking for a Business Intelligence Specialist to join our team in Agrate. If you're passionate about turning data into actionable insights that make a real impact across departments, this is your opportunity to be a strategic partner in a business that values smart decisions and data-led growth.
To succeed in this role, you‚Äôll bring both technical depth and business acumen. We‚Äôre looking for someone who has:
A Master‚Äôs degree in Applied Sciences, Economics, Statistics, or a related field.
Three to Five years of proven experience in a Business Intelligence or Data Analytics role.
Advanced Excel skills and hands-on experience with SQL and Python.
Expertise in building and maintaining data models.
Strong communication skills in English ‚Äî able to simplify complex data for various stakeholders.
A proactive, detail-oriented mindset and a collaborative approach to problem-solving.
We believe in supporting our people to do their best work. Here‚Äôs what you can expect:
A competitive salary based on your experience and skills .
A hybrid working model that supports work-life balance.
Lunch vouchers and practical benefits that make a difference in your day-to-day.
Access to in-house training and continuous learning opportunities.
A collaborative, inclusive culture rooted in respect, diversity, and sustainability.

In this dynamic role, you‚Äôll collaborate closely with teams across Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain, and Finance, using your expertise to transform complex datasets into clear, decision-driving insights.
Collect, clean, and analyze data from multiple sources to identify trends and opportunities.
Build intuitive dashboards and visualizations using tools like Power BI or Tableau.
Design and maintain data models that support strategic planning and operational excellence.
Provide actionable recommendations that guide business decisions across the organization.
Champion data quality, governance, and standardization across systems and teams.
Stay ahead of the curve by identifying new BI tools, trends, and best practices.

Staying true to who you really are, that is your starting point at FrieslandCampina. Because it is precisely by embracing our differences that we can grow together. We want to create a working environment that allows all employees to bring their best and authentic selves. If who we are suits you, but you're not sure if you're the best fit for the role, we still encourage you to apply so we can help you find the role that fits you best.

FrieslandCampina is a unique employer ‚Äî our farmer-owned cooperative model empowers us to prioritize people, planet, and profit equally. We foster a culture of equality and inclusion, where every voice matters and every individual can thrive. We are constantly evolving, embracing innovation, and working toward a sustainable future ‚Äî together.

Join FrieslandCampina as a Business Intelligence Specialist ‚Äì Agrate Office

At FrieslandCampina, we‚Äôre more than a global dairy company ‚Äî we‚Äôre a purpose-driven organization committed to nourishing the world with high-quality, nutritious products. With over 18,000 employees across 100+ countries, we are united by a passion for innovation, sustainability, and excellence.

We‚Äôre currently looking for a Business Intelligence Specialist to join our team in Agrate. If you're passionate about turning data into actionable insights that make a real impact across departments, this is your opportunity to be a strategic partner in a business that values smart decisions and data-led growth.

What We Ask

What You Bring

To succeed in this role, you‚Äôll bring both technical depth and business acumen. We‚Äôre looking for someone who has:

  • A Master‚Äôs degree in Applied Sciences, Economics, Statistics, or a related field.
  • Three to Five years of proven experience in a Business Intelligence or Data Analytics role.
  • Advanced Excel skills and hands-on experience with SQL and Python.
  • Expertise in building and maintaining data models.
  • Strong communication skills in English ‚Äî able to simplify complex data for various stakeholders.
  • A proactive, detail-oriented mindset and a collaborative approach to problem-solving.


What We Offer

We believe in supporting our people to do their best work. Here‚Äôs what you can expect:

  • A competitive salary based on your experience and skills .
  • A hybrid working model that supports work-life balance.
  • Lunch vouchers and practical benefits that make a difference in your day-to-day.
  • Access to in-house training and continuous learning opportunities.
  • A collaborative, inclusive culture rooted in respect, diversity, and sustainability.


Vacancy Description

In this dynamic role, you‚Äôll collaborate closely with teams across Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain, and Finance, using your expertise to transform complex datasets into clear, decision-driving insights.

You will:

  • Collect, clean, and analyze data from multiple sources to identify trends and opportunities.
  • Build intuitive dashboards and visualizations using tools like Power BI or Tableau.
  • Design and maintain data models that support strategic planning and operational excellence.
  • Provide actionable recommendations that guide business decisions across the organization.
  • Champion data quality, governance, and standardization across systems and teams.
  • Stay ahead of the curve by identifying new BI tools, trends, and best practices.


Staying true to who you really are, that is your starting point at FrieslandCampina. Because it is precisely by embracing our differences that we can grow together. We want to create a working environment that allows all employees to bring their best and authentic selves. If who we are suits you, but you're not sure if you're the best fit for the role, we still encourage you to apply so we can help you find the role that fits you best.

Team Details

Why FrieslandCampina?

FrieslandCampina is a unique employer ‚Äî our farmer-owned cooperative model empowers us to prioritize people, planet, and profit equally. We foster a culture of equality and inclusion, where every voice matters and every individual can thrive. We are constantly evolving, embracing innovation, and working toward a sustainable future ‚Äî together.

4283017931,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/graduate-data-analyst-at-bending-spoons-4283017931?position=23&pageNum=0&refId=Kb90JdxJdNHl%2FL38b3zTQQ%3D%3D&trackingId=WbpfT%2FV64mwpWk2p8oWq0w%3D%3D,Graduate Data Analyst,Bending Spoons,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.
A few examples of your responsibilities
Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.

Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.

Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.

Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.

An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.

Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ¬£66,779 in the UK and ‚Ç¨63,965 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.

All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time or part-time.

If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They‚Äôre challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.
We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities‚Äîjust let us know through this form.
If you‚Äôve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves‚Äîand one another‚Äîto a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.

To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It‚Äôs the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We‚Äôll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you‚Äôre welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries‚Äîdepending on what we agree at the offer stage.
If the role speaks to you and you‚Äôre excited to give your best, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply now‚Äîwe can‚Äôt wait to meet you.

At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
  • Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
  • Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
  • Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
  • Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
  • Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.

What we look for
  • Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
  • Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
  • Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
  • Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.

What we offer
  • Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
  • An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
  • Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ¬£66,779 in the UK and ‚Ç¨63,965 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
  • All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

contract

Location

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They‚Äôre challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Before you apply
If you‚Äôve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves‚Äîand one another‚Äîto a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.

To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It‚Äôs the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We‚Äôll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you‚Äôre welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries‚Äîdepending on what we agree at the offer stage.

4274631119,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/marketing-data-analyst-intern-at-haier-europe-4274631119?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=Kb90JdxJdNHl%2FL38b3zTQQ%3D%3D&trackingId=VaUVIza1WQ%2BFvh4R7FOk%2BQ%3D%3D,Marketing Data Analyst Intern,Haier Europe,"Vimercate, Lombardy, Italy","The Challenge

An exciting opportunity has arisen at Haier Europe. The Company is on a journey to achieve ambitious business growth and leadership objectives in the region, and we need someone who is passionate, proactive, self-driven and motivated to join a team of open-minded individuals.

We are looking for an individual who demonstrates the core values of the Haier‚Äôs attitude: entrepreneurship and innovation, zero distance to consumers and IoT & Ecosystem thinking. A true change agent with an agile approach thriving for idea contamination and with a hyper-collaborative approach that breaks silos and creates an open ecosystem.

We are looking for a Marketing Data Analyst Intern to join our team and support the analysis of sales and market performance data. In this role, you will help transform data into actionable insights that support commercial and marketing decision-making. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to work on a wide range of business-relevant topics, from market share trends to pricing and distribution dynamics, across all Product Lines and European markets.
You may also contribute to strategic projects aimed at evaluating marketing effectiveness, including advanced analytical methods and performance tracking.
Analyze market share evolution and sales performance (sell-in/sell-out tracking)
Support distribution and pricing analysis across different markets
Conduct competitor benchmarking and performance comparisons
Assist in the preparation of dashboards and reports for internal stakeholders
Contribute to marketing effectiveness initiatives, such as: Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM), Media performance analysis, KPI tracking across paid, owned, and earned media channels
- Neolaureate or student in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Economics, or related field.
- Good knowledge of Microsoft Office proficient user of Excel
We offer a six-month paid internship
800 euro, smart working, free company shuttle, ticket meals
Are you ready to join us?

The Challenge

An exciting opportunity has arisen at Haier Europe. The Company is on a journey to achieve ambitious business growth and leadership objectives in the region, and we need someone who is passionate, proactive, self-driven and motivated to join a team of open-minded individuals.

We are looking for an individual who demonstrates the core values of the Haier‚Äôs attitude: entrepreneurship and innovation, zero distance to consumers and IoT &
column2:
Ecosystem thinking. A true change agent with an agile approach thriving for idea contamination and with a hyper-collaborative approach that breaks silos and creates an open ecosystem.

What you will do

We are looking for a Marketing Data Analyst Intern to join our team and support the analysis of sales and market performance data. In this role, you will help transform data into actionable insights that support commercial and marketing decision-making. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to work on a wide range of business-relevant topics, from market share trends to pricing and distribution dynamics, across all Product Lines and European markets.

You may also contribute to strategic projects aimed at evaluating marketing effectiveness, including advanced analytical methods and performance tracking.

Key responsibilities:

  • Analyze market share evolution and sales performance (sell-in/sell-out tracking)
  • Support distribution and pricing analysis across different markets
  • Conduct competitor benchmarking and performance comparisons
  • Assist in the preparation of dashboards and reports for internal stakeholders
  • Contribute to marketing effectiveness initiatives, such as: Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM), Media performance analysis, KPI tracking across paid, owned, and earned media channels

What you need to succeed

- Neolaureate or student in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Economics, or related field.

- Good knowledge of Microsoft Office proficient user of Excel

- Fluent in Italian and English

We offer a six-month paid internship

800 euro, smart working, free company shuttle, ticket meals

Place of work: Vimercate (MB)

Are you ready to join us?

  • Collaborare con il management per implementare le modifiche necessarie a raggiungere la riduzione dei costi e il miglioramento del servizio desiderati

  • Attitudine proattiva e orientata al risultato.
  • Conoscenza della lingua inglese, almeno B2.

Cosa Offriamo

  • Ambiente dinamico e in crescita nel settore della logistica.

Hi, we're Treatwell. Nice to meet you.

Join Treatwell's Global Analytics function as an Analyst for Marketplace, where you'll support data-driven decision making across Marketing, Product, and Finance domains. Working within our two-sided marketplace connecting over 50,000 salon partners with millions of customers across 13 European markets, you'll help translate business questions into insights that contribute to our growth trajectory.

This is an exciting opportunity to develop your analytical skills while working closely with cross-functional teams to measure performance, support campaign optimisation, and uncover growth opportunities across our marketplace ecosystem. You'll be part of a collaborative analytics team with guidance from senior analysts while building expertise in marketplace analytics.

You Will Be Responsible For

Analytics &
column2:
Insights

  • Conduct customer segmentation analysis to support targeting strategies and personalisation efforts
  • Support the development of customer lifetime value (LTV) models and behavioural analysis
  • Analyse user behaviour patterns across the marketplace to identify optimisation opportunities
  • Assist with A/B testing analysis for product and marketing initiatives
  • Help identify key trends and support the transformation of data into business insights


Reporting &
column3:
Visualisation

  • Build and maintain dashboards in Looker covering Marketing, Product, and Finance metrics
  • Create clear data visualisations that support business decision-making
  • Develop reporting solutions to meet stakeholder needs
  • Present analytical findings to team members and cross-functional partners


Business Partnership

  • Support Marketing teams with campaign performance measurement and creative analysis
  • Assist Product teams with feature performance tracking and user behaviour insights
  • Collaborate with Finance on marketplace metrics and revenue analysis


Technical Excellence

  • Write SQL queries for data extraction and analysis in our Redshift environment
  • Work with analytical tools including Mixpanel and Customer Data Platforms
  • Maintain data quality standards and follow analytical best practices
  • Contribute to analytics processes and documentation


About You

Technical Skills

  • Strong SQL skills with experience working with large datasets
  • Understanding of statistical analysis techniques and modeling approaches
  • Experience with data visualisation tools (Looker preferred)
  • Familiarity with A/B testing concepts and experimental analysis
  • Knowledge of customer data platforms and analytics tools


Experience &
column4:
Background

  • 2+ years of experience in an analyst role, ideally within marketplace, e-commerce, or digital environments
  • Experience with marketing analytics including campaign measurement and audience analysis
  • Background in customer analytics and behavioural analysis
  • Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams and supporting business stakeholders
  • Ability to work effectively in fast-paced environments across multiple business areas


Preferred

  • Experience in the beauty, wellness, or consumer services industry
  • Background in two-sided marketplace analytics


About Treatwell

Hi, we're Treatwell. Nice to meet you.

We're a team of 700 passionate and brilliantly talented people across Europe. We're the industry's smartest salon management software, all connected to Europe's leading bookings platform, working with over 50,000 salon partners across 13 countries, processing over 8 million bookings every month. And....breathe.

But we're not done yet. We're on an exciting journey to digitally revolutionise the hair and beauty community.

If this excites you, we might just have the role for you.

We'll treat you with

  • 28-days holiday, plus bank holidays
  • Monthly 40EUR Treatwell vouchers so you can treat yourself too
  • Benefits platform offering cycle to work scheme, high street discounts and other perks
  • Growth funds for you to develop and grow with your team
  • Mental health support through our partnership with Plumm


Equal Ops

Treatwell is an ‚ÄòOpen to All' employer and warmly welcomes everybody to the team. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process as required. Please add any adjustment requests to your application

4265237859,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-marketing-growth-italy-they-she-he-at-glovo-4265237859?position=48&pageNum=0&refId=Kb90JdxJdNHl%2FL38b3zTQQ%3D%3D&trackingId=aN93ne0ZPsiDQmzuwnWb9Q%3D%3D,Data Analyst Marketing & Growth - Italy (They/She/He),Glovo,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.
A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.
We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.
ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.
We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.
Understand business needs and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisions to boost Glovo presence and orders

Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base focusing on traffic, conversion and retention rates and leveraging on levers such as pricing, promotions, events, CRM and other marketing levers etc
Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitability
Take ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available ones
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Assist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data, and communicate and simplify concepts to the audience's needs
Drive clarity and solve ambiguity using data-driven approaches

Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products, identify growth opportunities, and execute projects to drive growth and engagement
What You Will Bring To The Ride
1-3 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actions
Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Business, Stats, Quantitative field or Business
SQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plus
Ninja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a must
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau and Looker
Business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation)
A hands-on attitude is a must. You‚Äôll have to roll up your sleeves!

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.
Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?
Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

  • Understand business needs and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisions to boost Glovo presence and orders
  • Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base focusing on traffic, conversion and retention rates and leveraging on levers such as pricing, promotions, events, CRM and other marketing levers etc
  • Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
  • Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitability
  • Take ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available ones
  • Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
  • Assist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data, and communicate and simplify concepts to the audience's needs
  • Drive clarity and solve ambiguity using data-driven approaches
  • Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products, identify growth opportunities, and execute projects to drive growth and engagement

What You Will Bring To The Ride

  • 1-3 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actions
  • Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Business, Stats, Quantitative field or Business
  • SQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plus
  • Ninja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a must
  • Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau and Looker
  • Business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation)
  • A hands-on attitude is a must. You‚Äôll have to roll up your sleeves!
  • Proficiency in English
  • Strong consumer understanding skills

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

  • üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
  • üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • üë™ Enhanced parental leave.
  • üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

4267251565,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-ai-expert-at-gruppo-fervo-4267251565?position=57&pageNum=0&refId=Kb90JdxJdNHl%2FL38b3zTQQ%3D%3D&trackingId=9aWVIWc4K%2BFA87nKgL86yw%3D%3D,Data analyst - AI Expert,Gruppo Fervo,"Nova Milanese, Lombardy, Italy","Siamo un gruppo di aziende specializzato nel settore Technical & Energy Management Services, con una presenza consolidata in Italia e sedi operative anche in Arabia Saudita.

Grazie alla nostra esperienza, abbiamo sviluppato un modello integrato che copre l‚Äôintero ciclo di vita degli asset immobiliari: dalla progettazione MEP alla costruzione, manutenzione, ottimizzazione energetica e gestione digitale.
Promuoviamo la decarbonizzazione del Real Estate, attraverso lo sviluppo e l'implementazione di piani di riduzione della carbon footprint.

Siamo alla ricerca di un* Data Analyst con competenze in AI per unirsi alla nostra divisione ""AI"", un'unit√† dinamica e strategica dedicata allo sviluppo di soluzioni intelligenti per l'efficientamento energetico e la manutenzione predittiva.
Analisi di grandi volumi di dati provenienti da sistemi di monitoraggio energetico e ambientale.
Progettazione e sviluppo di modelli predittivi (ML/AI) per l‚Äôidentificazione di anomalie e il forecasting di malfunzionamenti (failure prediction).
Collaborazione con data scientist, ingegneri e team di prodotto per trasformare insight analitici in soluzioni operative.
Contributo nella creazione di dashboard e report intelligenti per il supporto decisionale.
Validazione e miglioramento continuo dei modelli, adottando un approccio data-driven e iterativo.
Laurea in Ingegneria, Statistica, Data Science, Matematica o discipline affini.
Almeno 2 anni di esperienza come data analyst o data scientist.
Conoscenza dei principali linguaggi per l‚Äôanalisi e la modellazione (Python, SQL, R).
Esperienza concreta con librerie di machine learning (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Familiarit√† con tecniche di anomaly detection e predizione del guasto (failure prediction).
Conoscenza di strumenti di visualizzazione (Tableau, Power BI o simili).

column2:
Energy Management Services, con una presenza consolidata in Italia e sedi operative anche in Arabia Saudita.

Grazie alla nostra esperienza, abbiamo sviluppato un modello integrato che copre l‚Äôintero ciclo di vita degli asset immobiliari: dalla progettazione MEP alla costruzione, manutenzione, ottimizzazione energetica e gestione digitale.

Promuoviamo la decarbonizzazione del Real Estate, attraverso lo sviluppo e l'implementazione di piani di riduzione della carbon footprint.

Posizione:

Siamo alla ricerca di un* Data Analyst con competenze in AI per unirsi alla nostra divisione ""AI"", un'unit√† dinamica e strategica dedicata allo sviluppo di soluzioni intelligenti per l'efficientamento energetico e la manutenzione predittiva.

Ruolo e responsabilit√†:

  • Analisi di grandi volumi di dati provenienti da sistemi di monitoraggio energetico e ambientale.
  • Progettazione e sviluppo di modelli predittivi (ML/AI) per l‚Äôidentificazione di anomalie e il forecasting di malfunzionamenti (failure prediction).
  • Collaborazione con data scientist, ingegneri e team di prodotto per trasformare insight analitici in soluzioni operative.
  • Contributo nella creazione di dashboard e report intelligenti per il supporto decisionale.
  • Validazione e miglioramento continuo dei modelli, adottando un approccio data-driven e iterativo.

Requisiti:

Requisiti:

  • Laurea in Ingegneria, Statistica, Data Science, Matematica o discipline affini.
  • Almeno 2 anni di esperienza come data analyst o data scientist.
  • Conoscenza dei principali linguaggi per l‚Äôanalisi e la modellazione (Python, SQL, R).
  • Esperienza concreta con librerie di machine learning (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
  • Familiarit√† con tecniche di anomaly detection e predizione del guasto (failure prediction).
  • Conoscenza di strumenti di visualizzazione (Tableau, Power BI o simili).
  • Ti piace sperimentare, ma sempre con un occhio alla robustezza del risultato.
  • Lavori bene in team multidisciplinari e comunichi in modo chiaro.

Altri requisiti:

As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.
So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!
Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Italy.
Must be living in Italy for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.
Work From Home - WFH - Remote - Freelance - Telecommuting - Flexible

4253118300,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-mollie-4253118300?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=gvcHtygM%2FEN8pB%2F0YgjX3A%3D%3D&trackingId=gLVL88UU1Hg0YI4yA406iw%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Mollie,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","At Mollie, we‚Äôre on a mission to make payments and money management effortless for every business in Europe. We started 20 years ago when we launched a more direct, affordable way for companies to get paid. That provided an alternative to the frustrating, overpriced solutions that banks offered at the time.

Today, we serve more than 250,000 businesses across Europe with an all-in-one solution that simplifies payments and money management. And we‚Äôre a 850-strong team of product, finance, support, commerce, and engineering specialists working across Europe ‚Äì from Lisbon to London.
We're looking for an experienced and motivated Data Analyst to lead the analytical efforts of our Real-time Fraud Monitoring Team.

Working within one of Mollie's newest verticals, our team is dedicated to protecting our account holders from financial crimes. We're on the front lines, developing scalable, automated risk decision-making tools that operate in milliseconds. Here, real-time data meets real-world security.
This role isn't just about technical expertise
column2: it's about addressing critical business challenges. You'll use your technical skills to design, build, and optimise intricate data pipelines and analytical solutions for fraud detection. You'll work with Mollie's complex, real-time data flows, transforming raw data into actionable insights that directly combat financial crime and enable swift risk decisions.

column1: You'll play a key role in driving impactful solutions from concept to deployment, partnering closely with our engineering, product, and operations teams to ensure our analytical capabilities are seamlessly integrated. Your efforts will directly contribute to protecting our account holders, turning data into the shield that safeguards our business.
Data product development: Build and maintain robust, performant, easy-to-use data products and dashboards to monitor key fraud metrics and help us make decisions
Data analysis & interpretation: Analyse merchant behaviour and transaction data to detect patterns, anomalies, and potential fraud indicators to inform Mollie's risk strategy.

Data visualisation & storytelling: Create compelling data visualisations and narratives to effectively communicate your findings to technical and non-technical audiences using various mediums, e.g. presentations, reports, memos, etc.
Documentation & knowledge sharing: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for data products, processes, and analyses to facilitate knowledge sharing and onboarding of new team members.
Data quality assurance: Implement data quality checks and processes to ensure the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data used for analysis and decision-making.
Experimentation & prototyping: Develop and test new analytical approaches and models through experimentation and prototyping to improve fraud detection and risk assessment.
Proven experience in analytics within a complex risk, fintech, or payments environment
Strong technical foundation in SQL and Python
column2: experience with data modelling and automation

column1: Deep understanding of one or more risk areas: fraud, AML/CFT, credit risk
Experience leading analysts or analytics engineers, with a track record of raising the bar
Ability to zoom out and to zoom in to support implementation, often on the same day
Skilled at stakeholder management, especially across technical and non-technical teams

At Mollie, we‚Äôre on a mission to make payments and money management effortless for every business in Europe. We started 20 years ago when we launched a more direct, affordable way for companies to get paid. That provided an alternative to the frustrating, overpriced solutions that banks offered at the time.

Today, we serve more than 250,000 businesses across Europe with an all-in-one solution that simplifies payments and money management. And we‚Äôre a 850-strong team of product, finance, support, commerce, and engineering specialists working across Europe ‚Äì from Lisbon to London.

Your Opportunity

We're looking for an experienced and motivated Data Analyst to lead the analytical efforts of our Real-time Fraud Monitoring Team.

Working within one of Mollie's newest verticals, our team is dedicated to protecting our account holders from financial crimes. We're on the front lines, developing scalable, automated risk decision-making tools that operate in milliseconds. Here, real-time data meets real-world security.

This role isn't just about technical expertise

it's about addressing critical business challenges. You'll use your technical skills to design, build, and optimise intricate data pipelines and analytical solutions for fraud detection. You'll work with Mollie's complex, real-time data flows, transforming raw data into actionable insights that directly combat financial crime and enable swift risk decisions.

You'll play a key role in driving impactful solutions from concept to deployment, partnering closely with our engineering, product, and operations teams to ensure our analytical capabilities are seamlessly integrated. Your efforts will directly contribute to protecting our account holders, turning data into the shield that safeguards our business.

What You‚Äôll Do

  • Data product development: Build and maintain robust, performant, easy-to-use data products and dashboards to monitor key fraud metrics and help us make decisions
  • Data analysis &
column3:
interpretation: Analyse merchant behaviour and transaction data to detect patterns, anomalies, and potential fraud indicators to inform Mollie's risk strategy.
  • Data visualisation &
column4:
storytelling: Create compelling data visualisations and narratives to effectively communicate your findings to technical and non-technical audiences using various mediums, e.g. presentations, reports, memos, etc.
  • Documentation &
column5:
knowledge sharing: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for data products, processes, and analyses to facilitate knowledge sharing and onboarding of new team members.
  • Data quality assurance: Implement data quality checks and processes to ensure the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data used for analysis and decision-making.
  • Experimentation &
column6:
prototyping: Develop and test new analytical approaches and models through experimentation and prototyping to improve fraud detection and risk assessment.

What You Bring

  • Proven experience in analytics within a complex risk, fintech, or payments environment
  • Strong technical foundation in SQL and Python
column7:
experience with data modelling and automation
  • Deep understanding of one or more risk areas: fraud, AML/CFT, credit risk
  • Experience leading analysts or analytics engineers, with a track record of raising the bar
  • Ability to zoom out and to zoom in to support implementation, often on the same day
  • Skilled at stakeholder management, especially across technical and non-technical teams
  • Business-aware, impact-driven, and curious

Il sito produttivo ospita oltre oltre 340 dipendenti, organizzati in otto reparti dedicati a produzione farmaceutica, essiccamento, finitura e purificazione. Comprende inoltre un vasto impianto pilota e laboratori per lo sviluppo personalizzato e di analisi dei Principi Attivi, oltre ad uffici amministrativi, commerciali e di coordinamento delle Operations.

Unisciti a Noi!

4274631119,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/marketing-data-analyst-intern-at-haier-europe-4274631119?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=gvcHtygM%2FEN8pB%2F0YgjX3A%3D%3D&trackingId=5P%2BcAHUpqhFnr8ZaYKuNRw%3D%3D,Marketing Data Analyst Intern,Haier Europe,"Vimercate, Lombardy, Italy","The Challenge

An exciting opportunity has arisen at Haier Europe. The Company is on a journey to achieve ambitious business growth and leadership objectives in the region, and we need someone who is passionate, proactive, self-driven and motivated to join a team of open-minded individuals.

We are looking for an individual who demonstrates the core values of the Haier‚Äôs attitude: entrepreneurship and innovation, zero distance to consumers and IoT & Ecosystem thinking. A true change agent with an agile approach thriving for idea contamination and with a hyper-collaborative approach that breaks silos and creates an open ecosystem.

We are looking for a Marketing Data Analyst Intern to join our team and support the analysis of sales and market performance data. In this role, you will help transform data into actionable insights that support commercial and marketing decision-making. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to work on a wide range of business-relevant topics, from market share trends to pricing and distribution dynamics, across all Product Lines and European markets.
You may also contribute to strategic projects aimed at evaluating marketing effectiveness, including advanced analytical methods and performance tracking.
Analyze market share evolution and sales performance (sell-in/sell-out tracking)
Support distribution and pricing analysis across different markets
Conduct competitor benchmarking and performance comparisons
Assist in the preparation of dashboards and reports for internal stakeholders
Contribute to marketing effectiveness initiatives, such as: Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM), Media performance analysis, KPI tracking across paid, owned, and earned media channels
- Neolaureate or student in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Economics, or related field.
- Good knowledge of Microsoft Office proficient user of Excel
We offer a six-month paid internship
800 euro, smart working, free company shuttle, ticket meals
Are you ready to join us?

I contesti che ci vedono protagonisti sul mercato sono caratterizzati da una forte componente innovativa, come ad esempio l‚Äôuso di metodologie quali DevOps, Agile e tecnologie Microservizi, front-end web innovativi, Big Data, Machine Learning, Intelligenza Artificiale e Cyber Security.

4266426331,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/financial-planning-and-analysis-junior-at-naba-nuova-accademia-di-belle-arti-4266426331?position=4&pageNum=5&refId=nHjILgruERVpFNv1pXWqag%3D%3D&trackingId=omjtZ%2B1yQuhjJ%2BbUjWmF8w%3D%3D,"Financial, Planning and Analysis Junior",NABA Nuova Accademia di Belle Arti,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","NABA is currently seeking motivated individuals for the role of

The successful candidate will join the FP&A team in Milan. Reporting directly to the Financial Planning & Analysis Manager, he/she will support the team in providing financial and analytical insights to enhance business operations. In this role, the candidate will assist in ensuring easy access to financial data, tracking key projects, setting budgets, developing financial forecasts, and monitoring key performance indicators. Under the supervision of the FP&A Manager, she/ he will also contribute to the optimization and automation of financial processes, playing an active role in driving efficiency and accuracy within the department.
The selected candidate will carry out the following activities:
Supporting the preparation of monthly management reports by analyzing key variances and trends against forecasts.
Identifying the nature of variances (fixed/phasing) and promptly updating forecasts.
Assisting in revenue, cost, and CAPEX forecasting, collaborating with department heads.
Reconciling the latest forecast with budget values.
Supporting budget preparation for all entities by creating the Masterfile and consolidated NABA overview.
Uploading actual and budget data from SAP into the Group reporting tool Tagetik.
Monitoring FTE and student numbers via Tagetik, ensuring monthly updates.
Ensuring monthly reconciliation of intercompany transactions with Group entities.
The ideal candidate possesses the following qualifications and skills:
2-3years of experience in FP&A, Controlling, or Business Analysis, preferably in structured environments.
Strong skills in financial reporting, budgeting, forecasting, and management control.
Excellent knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint, and preferably SAP and Tagetik.
Analytical mindset, attention to detail, and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills and ability to work in a team.
Degree in Economics, Finance, or related fields.
Good knowledge of English for reporting and group interactions.
If you meet these requirements and are motivated to contribute to business growth with strategic financial insights, we look forward to receiving your application!
Please, send your application and authorizing the treatment of personal data in compliance with the GDPR 679/16.

According to the GDPR 679/16 we inform you that the treatment of Personal Data contained in your resume, will respect the principles of legality, fairness and transparency and protection of your privacy and your rights. We only use the personal data we collect for the recruiting activities, such as your name, surname, address, email address, educational and employment background and job qualifications.
