4263961196,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-rode-kruis-vlaanderen-4263961196?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=p%2F6uFCBzf7qZQmlGd1a1CA%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analyst,Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen,"Mechelen, Flemish Region, Belgium","Intro

Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen zorgt ervoor dat ziekenhuizen in Vlaanderen altijd beschikken over voldoende veilig en kwalitatief bloed. Een belangrijke opdracht waarin we elke dag slagen dankzij de enthousiaste inzet van talloze medewerkers.

Onze humanitaire diensten zijn dan weer actief in binnen- en buitenland. Samen met onze vrijwilligers staan we in voor de meest diverse opdrachten: jeugdwerking, preventie, hulp bij rampen en events, sociale hulpverlening, internationale hulp, opvang van verzoekers om internationale bescherming, eerstehulpopleidingen, enzovoort.

Onze experts ICT, Finance, Aankoop, Logistiek, HR en Communicatie vind je in onze Centraal Ondersteunende Diensten. Zij zorgen er elke dag voor dat alle medewerkers, donoren en vrijwilligers hun missie kunnen opnemen: ‚Äòhelpen helpen'.

Als Business Intelligence Analist draag je je steentje bij in het optimaliseren van uiteenlopende activiteiten van onze organisatie (van preventieve eerste hulp tot voldoende veilig bloed). Omwille van deze uiteenlopende activiteiten beschikt Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen over een grote hoeveelheid aan data die heel divers is. Op basis van de noden van de business, zorg je er mee voor dat de juiste data beschikbaar zijn en gevisualiseerd kunnen worden om hen nieuwe inzichten te verschaffen.
Een veelzijdige en complexe datapool als fundament voor analyses en data gedreven beslissingen.
Een positieve bijdrage leveren aan de maatschappij als grote doel.

Als Business Intelligence Analist breng je de noden in kaart, analyseer je de data en zet je deze op een creatieve manier om in systemen en tools die de operationele processen, risico's en strategie√´n visualiseren
Je gaat intern en extern proactief op zoek naar informatie en geeft de business nieuwe inzichten waarmee ze verder aan de slag kan gaan
Je weet de behoeften van business te vertalen naar betekenisvolle en overzichtelijke visualisaties en rapporteringsvormen en formuleert advies m.b.t. deze duidelijk interpreteerbare datavoorstelling
Je werkt nauw samen met andere technische analisten, ontwikkelaars, proces ingenieurs en dienstverantwoordelijken
Je formuleert verbetervoorstellen en onderhoudt en bewaakt de best practices m.b.t. het gebruik van de tools en rapportontwikkelingen
Je staat in voor de opleiding van anderen in deze rapporteringstools
Je communiceert op regelmatige basis met je interne klanten omtrent hun verwachtingen en gaat op zoek naar het juiste cijfermateriaal
Als data-expert adviseer je diensten en collega's in een veelzijdige werkomgeving.
Je werkt zowel voor de centrale diensten als voor de Humanitaire Diensten en de afdelingen die zich met Bloed bezighouden. Zo draag je bij aan de maatschappelijke missie van Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen.

Je hebt kennis van Business Intelligence tools en methodologie√´n en bovendien ben je sterk ge√Ønteresseerd in IT. Kennis van PowerBI en Microsoft Azure (Data Factory, Synapse) is vereist. SQL kennis en kennis van data modellering is wenselijk.
Je genoot een master opleiding of gelijkwaardig door ervaring
Je bent ge√Ønteresseerd in een (bio)medische context of humanitaire dienstverlening
Je beschikt over een aantal jaar relevante ervaring
Je bent sterk in het capteren van noden en het analyseren van data
Je hebt oog voor detail. Details kunnen in een wetenschappelijke omgeving immers van groot belang zijn
Je bent een sterke communicator, weet prioriteiten naar voren te brengen en anderen te overtuigen van je inzichten
Je hebt zin voor initiatief en je bent ondernemend.
Je wil je engageren voor een organisatie met maatschappelijke impact.

Je draait mee in een veelzijdige, boeiende organisatie met maatschappelijke meerwaarde waarbij jouw expertise er mee voor zorgt dat Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen die meerwaarde evidence-based en data-driven kan bieden
Een marktconform salaris in functie van je ervaring
On the job training en coaching is een continu proces. Er is blijvende ondersteuning van consultants om bij te leren
Een voltijdse functie met een contract van onbepaalde duur.

Intro

Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen zorgt ervoor dat ziekenhuizen in Vlaanderen altijd beschikken over voldoende veilig en kwalitatief bloed. Een belangrijke opdracht waarin we elke dag slagen dankzij de enthousiaste inzet van talloze medewerkers.


Onze humanitaire diensten zijn dan weer actief in binnen- en buitenland. Samen met onze vrijwilligers staan we in voor de meest diverse opdrachten: jeugdwerking, preventie, hulp bij rampen en events, sociale hulpverlening, internationale hulp, opvang van verzoekers om internationale bescherming, eerstehulpopleidingen, enzovoort.


Onze experts ICT, Finance, Aankoop, Logistiek, HR en Communicatie vind je in onze Centraal Ondersteunende Diensten. Zij zorgen er elke dag voor dat alle medewerkers, donoren en vrijwilligers hun missie kunnen opnemen: ‚Äòhelpen helpen'.


Als Business Intelligence Analist draag je je steentje bij in het optimaliseren van uiteenlopende activiteiten van onze organisatie (van preventieve eerste hulp tot voldoende veilig bloed). Omwille van deze uiteenlopende activiteiten beschikt Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen over een grote hoeveelheid aan data die heel divers is. Op basis van de noden van de business, zorg je er mee voor dat de juiste data beschikbaar zijn en gevisualiseerd kunnen worden om hen nieuwe inzichten te verschaffen.


Functiebeschrijving


Microsoft Azure als dataplatform.

Een veelzijdige en complexe datapool als fundament voor analyses en data gedreven beslissingen.

Een positieve bijdrage leveren aan de maatschappij als grote doel.



Concreet:

  • Als Business Intelligence Analist breng je de noden in kaart, analyseer je de data en zet je deze op een creatieve manier om in systemen en tools die de operationele processen, risico's en strategie√´n visualiseren
column2: • Je gaat intern en extern proactief op zoek naar informatie en geeft de business nieuwe inzichten waarmee ze verder aan de slag kan gaan
column3:
• Je weet de behoeften van business te vertalen naar betekenisvolle en overzichtelijke visualisaties en rapporteringsvormen en formuleert advies m.b.t. deze duidelijk interpreteerbare datavoorstelling
  • Je werkt nauw samen met andere technische analisten, ontwikkelaars, proces ingenieurs en dienstverantwoordelijken
column4: • Je formuleert verbetervoorstellen en onderhoudt en bewaakt de best practices m.b.t. het gebruik van de tools en rapportontwikkelingen
column5:
.
  • Je staat in voor de opleiding van anderen in deze rapporteringstools
column6: • Je communiceert op regelmatige basis met je interne klanten omtrent hun verwachtingen en gaat op zoek naar het juiste cijfermateriaal
column7:
• Als data-expert adviseer je diensten en collega's in een veelzijdige werkomgeving.
  • Je werkt zowel voor de centrale diensten als voor de Humanitaire Diensten en de afdelingen die zich met Bloed bezighouden. Zo draag je bij aan de maatschappelijke missie van Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen.

    • Je genoot een master opleiding of gelijkwaardig door ervaring
    • Je bent ge√Ønteresseerd in een (bio)medische context of humanitaire dienstverlening

column10: • Je hebt oog voor detail. Details kunnen in een wetenschappelijke omgeving immers van groot belang zijn

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (‚Äúraison d‚Äô√™tre‚Äù) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 100,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress

BU Supply & Energy Management provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients (businesses and retail) through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

15000 employees around the world develop our solutions, through international business platforms and B2C entities. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors, industrials and retail. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.
At S&EM we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation

Context: The Expertise Center (EC) Quantitative Research and Modeling (QRM) within GEMS is a team of around 115 quantitative analysts. It‚Äôs mission is to provide advanced quantitative expertise to all Business Platforms (BP) of GEMS and to Engie worldwide. The quantitative analyst will be part of the ‚ÄúPricing‚Äù team (approximately 15 people) and will be fully dedicated to the Business Platform Power Trading & Commercial.
The quantitative analyst should design and provide robust quantitative tools that have a concrete impact on the power business:

Work very closely with the BP Power Trading & Commercial, mainly with the Renewable and Batteries Trading team and the Asset Backed Power Trading team. He / She needs to understand their business needs, and needs to provide them with high-quality quantitative support in their day to day activities.
Participate in enhancing the existing pricing and managing framework.
Deliver ad hoc tactical solutions as well as develop new pricers in the official pricing library.
Play a key role for developing new products, linked for example to the renewable and battery business (pricing, managing strategies, various risk indicators, ‚Ä¶).
Promote best coding practices that comply with general rules and standards.
Document and share knowledge across GEMS on the different models used within GEMS.
Strong Financial Mathematical background (probability, stochastic calculus, various numerical methods such as Monte Carlo, finite differences, ‚Ä¶)
Coding experience (preferably C# and python), object oriented programming skills
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues
Engineering or university degree (Master of PhD) in Computer Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Financial Engineering.
0 to 3 years of experience in a similar role.
Travels: Occasional travels (for example conferences) are possible, but limited.
If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!
Apply by attaching your updated CV.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

  • Support testing and validation activities (e.g. defect analysis, UAT follow-up)

  • Actively participate in Agile ceremonies (e.g. sprint planning, retrospectives)
  • Identify data-related risks and ensure compliance with internal governance and security standards


Profile:

  • Minimum 3 years of experience as a data analyst, business analyst, or functional analyst in a complex environment
  • Deep knowledge of data modelling techniques: 3NF, Kimball/star schema (facts/dimensions)
  • Strong SQL skills and solid experience with ETL tools
  • Experience with Oracle and Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) is a strong asset
  • Knowledge of Data Vault modelling is a plus

4270751599,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/job-data-analyst-risk-finance-brussel-at-belfius-4270751599?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=YZuctj79wzwxIOuPgZbdwQ%3D%3D,Job | Data Analyst Risk & Finance | Brussel,Belfius,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Omschrijving

De belangrijkste focus van het team is het tijdig en kwalitatief aanleveren van data uit het Risk & Finance domein. Dit domein omvat onder meer data over klantenrentabiliteit, risico-positie en het balansbeheer van de bank. Met onze recurrente rapportering en ad-hoc analyses zorgen we ervoor dat onze stakeholders op het juiste moment over de juiste data beschikken om hun beslissingen te kunnen nemen.

In deze rol bouw je mee aan een breed spectrum van dataoplossingen. Enerzijds zet je je schouders onder het ontwikkelen van data-flows, nieuwe rapporten of automatisering van bestaande rapporten. Hiervoor ga je rechtstreeks in gesprek met de eindgebruikers om hun noden te begrijpen en tot de meest ideale oplossing te komen. Anderzijds ben je ook in staat om zelfstandig specifieke ad-hoc analyses uit te voeren binnen het domein.

Je komt terecht in uitdagende en transversale omgeving waar je in aanraking komt met veel verschillende aspecten van de bank. Je krijgt een hoge mate van autonomie en houdt ervan om hierbinnen end-to-end verantwoordelijkheid te nemen over je projecten.
Je analyseert de informatienoden van verschillende stakeholders en vertaalt die naar dataoplossingen.
Je neemt verantwoordelijkheid over de verschillende elementen bij het ontwikkelen van de dataproducten.
Je werkt aan nieuwe rapportering of uitbreiding van bestaande rapporten.
Je bouwt herbruikbare datasets of ontwikkelt programma‚Äôs voor data-integratie, -transformatie en -preparatie.
Je maakt ad-hoc analyses om specifieke vragen te beantwoorden.
Je waakt over de kwaliteit van onze data, maar ook over de veiligheid en confidentialiteit van de gegevens.
Jij hoeft geen witte raaf te zijn
Al kan je er bij ons wel √©√©n worden. Bij ons mag je volop je vleugels uitslaan indien je voldoet aan de volgende voorwaarden:
Een masterdiploma Informatica, Ingenieur of Economie met informatica-ori√´ntatie of een aantal jaren relevante ervaring in dit domein.
Een autonome, proactieve, planmatige, flexibele en resultaatgerichte aanpak.
Een analytische en synthetische geest: in staat om complexe situaties te analyseren en te structureren.
Je hebt een sterke interesse voor technologie en alle evoluties op technologisch vlak.
Goede communicatievaardigheden: je begrijpt het functionele aspect en bent in staat om dit naar een technische oplossing te vertalen
Je hebt een basiskennis en ervating met data en data-transformaties met bijvoorbeeld SQL, Hadoop, (Py)Spark, Python,... en bent bereid om je hier verder in te ontwikkelen
Je hebt kennis van Finance en/of Risk Managment, bij voorkeur in een bancaire context.
Ervaring met een BI-tool (bijvoorbeeld QlikSense, PowerBI, SAP BO,...) en data visualisatie.
Ervaring met Microsoft Azure cloud services (Azure Synapse, devops).
Behalve de kans om elke dag te shinen, bieden wij jou een fulltime contract van onbepaalde duur met:

Een mooi loon aangevuld met een innovatief aanbod om een persoonlijk budget samen te stellen dat je kan besteden volgens je voorkeuren (bv. wagen, fiets, pc, smartphone, tablet, huisvesting onder bepaalde voorwaarden) en extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, personeelsvoordeel op eigen producten en diensten, en een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Mogelijkheden te over om je te ontwikkelen door een brede waaier aan opleidingen en carri√®rekansen in de hele Belfius-groep
Een goede werk-priv√© balans dankzij flexibele uren, de combinatie kantoor- en thuiswerk en een aantrekkelijk aantal vakantiedagen

Een moderne werkplek in het hart van Brussel met een coole fitness, een lekker gezond restaurant en gezellige ontmoetingsruimtes, dit alles op wandelafstand van de winkelstraat, het treinstation Brussel-Noord en de metrohalte Rogier

Omschrijving

De belangrijkste focus van het team is het tijdig en kwalitatief aanleveren van data uit het Risk &
column2:
Finance domein. Dit domein omvat onder meer data over klantenrentabiliteit, risico-positie en het balansbeheer van de bank. Met onze recurrente rapportering en ad-hoc analyses zorgen we ervoor dat onze stakeholders op het juiste moment over de juiste data beschikken om hun beslissingen te kunnen nemen.

In deze rol bouw je mee aan een breed spectrum van dataoplossingen. Enerzijds zet je je schouders onder het ontwikkelen van data-flows, nieuwe rapporten of automatisering van bestaande rapporten. Hiervoor ga je rechtstreeks in gesprek met de eindgebruikers om hun noden te begrijpen en tot de meest ideale oplossing te komen. Anderzijds ben je ook in staat om zelfstandig specifieke ad-hoc analyses uit te voeren binnen het domein.

Je komt terecht in uitdagende en transversale omgeving waar je in aanraking komt met veel verschillende aspecten van de bank. Je krijgt een hoge mate van autonomie en houdt ervan om hierbinnen end-to-end verantwoordelijkheid te nemen over je projecten.

De job in een notendop

  • Je analyseert de informatienoden van verschillende stakeholders en vertaalt die naar dataoplossingen.
  • Je neemt verantwoordelijkheid over de verschillende elementen bij het ontwikkelen van de dataproducten.
  • Je werkt aan nieuwe rapportering of uitbreiding van bestaande rapporten.
  • Je bouwt herbruikbare datasets of ontwikkelt programma‚Äôs voor data-integratie, -transformatie en -preparatie.
  • Je maakt ad-hoc analyses om specifieke vragen te beantwoorden.
  • Je waakt over de kwaliteit van onze data, maar ook over de veiligheid en confidentialiteit van de gegevens.


Jij hoeft geen witte raaf te zijn

Al kan je er bij ons wel √©√©n worden. Bij ons mag je volop je vleugels uitslaan indien je voldoet aan de volgende voorwaarden:

  • Een masterdiploma Informatica, Ingenieur of Economie met informatica-ori√´ntatie of een aantal jaren relevante ervaring in dit domein.
  • Een autonome, proactieve, planmatige, flexibele en resultaatgerichte aanpak.
  • Sterk gericht op samenwerking.
  • Een analytische en synthetische geest: in staat om complexe situaties te analyseren en te structureren.
  • Je hebt een sterke interesse voor technologie en alle evoluties op technologisch vlak.
  • Goede communicatievaardigheden: je begrijpt het functionele aspect en bent in staat om dit naar een technische oplossing te vertalen
  • Je hebt een basiskennis en ervating met data en data-transformaties met bijvoorbeeld SQL, Hadoop, (Py)Spark, Python,... en bent bereid om je hier verder in te ontwikkelen


Je scoort extra met:

  • Tweetaligheid (Nederlands/Frans).
  • Je hebt kennis van Finance en/of Risk Managment, bij voorkeur in een bancaire context.
  • Ervaring met een BI-tool (bijvoorbeeld QlikSense, PowerBI, SAP BO,...) en data visualisatie.
  • Ervaring met Microsoft Azure cloud services (Azure Synapse, devops).


Belfius koestert zijn talenten

Behalve de kans om elke dag te shinen, bieden wij jou een fulltime contract van onbepaalde duur met:

  • Een mooi loon aangevuld met een innovatief aanbod om een persoonlijk budget samen te stellen dat je kan besteden volgens je voorkeuren (bv. wagen, fiets, pc, smartphone, tablet, huisvesting onder bepaalde voorwaarden) en extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, personeelsvoordeel op eigen producten en diensten, en een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
  • Mogelijkheden te over om je te ontwikkelen door een brede waaier aan opleidingen en carri√®rekansen in de hele Belfius-groep
  • Een goede werk-priv√© balans dankzij flexibele uren, de combinatie kantoor- en thuiswerk en een aantrekkelijk aantal vakantiedagen
  • Een moderne werkplek in het hart van Brussel met een coole fitness, een lekker gezond restaurant en gezellige ontmoetingsruimtes, dit alles op wandelafstand van de winkelstraat, het treinstation Brussel-Noord en de metrohalte Rogier

4279473357,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-data-analyst-at-in4matic-4279473357?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=GUps7oyYYFsNF89kw205bg%3D%3D,Senior Data Analyst,In4Matic,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","We're looking for a skilled consultant to join our client's dynamic team focused on enhancing health data integration. This role emphasizes ensuring high-quality data services, contributing to a system that enables all insured individuals access to effective medical services while supporting individuals in maintaining their employment capability post-disability.

The ideal candidate will engage regularly with diverse business stakeholders, including data teams and subject matter experts, to gather and understand their specific data needs. Responsibilities include:
Identifying and assessing business processes, as well as operational and analytics data flows (both incoming and outgoing).
Translating client needs into clear data and technical requirements.
Collaborating with Data Architects to design data architecture and validate data models.
Establishing functional designs in collaboration with the Data Governance team and Technical Leads.
Working alongside the Data Protection Officer to ensure compliance with GDPR and security standards.
Participating in testing and validating developed data products and serving as a user liaison for ongoing training and improvements post-delivery.
The successful candidate will possess a strong foundation in data functional analysis, demonstrated through extensive experience and technical capabilities:
A Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or comparable experience.
A minimum of 10 years in data functional analysis.
Proficient in data modeling, especially conceptual and logical modeling within a data warehouse framework (preferably using the Kimball methodology).
Experience in designing and analyzing diverse data flows.
Prior experience as a data engineer is advantageous.
The candidate should excel in communication and collaboration, with a solid understanding of both business and technical aspects. Key traits include:
Fluency in both Dutch and French, with excellent communication skills in speaking, reading, and writing.
Strong presentation skills and an ability to translate business needs into technical solutions.
A proactive attitude, coupled with a sense of ownership and autonomy.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities and a pragmatic, results-oriented mindset.
Exceptional relationship-building skills with the capacity to establish trust and rapport with stakeholders.
Demonstrated flexibility, perseverance, and a willingness to learn.

We're looking for a skilled consultant to join our client's dynamic team focused on enhancing health data integration. This role emphasizes ensuring high-quality data services, contributing to a system that enables all insured individuals access to effective medical services while supporting individuals in maintaining their employment capability post-disability.

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate will engage regularly with diverse business stakeholders, including data teams and subject matter experts, to gather and understand their specific data needs. Responsibilities include:

  • Identifying and assessing business processes, as well as operational and analytics data flows (both incoming and outgoing).

Technical Skills

The successful candidate will possess a strong foundation in data functional analysis, demonstrated through extensive experience and technical capabilities:

  • A Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or comparable experience.
  • A minimum of 10 years in data functional analysis.
  • Proficient in data modeling, especially conceptual and logical modeling within a data warehouse framework (preferably using the Kimball methodology).
  • Experience in designing and analyzing diverse data flows.
  • Prior experience as a data engineer is advantageous.


Profile of the Ideal Candidate

The candidate should excel in communication and collaboration, with a solid understanding of both business and technical aspects. Key traits include:

  • Fluency in both Dutch and French, with excellent communication skills in speaking, reading, and writing.
  • Strong presentation skills and an ability to translate business needs into technical solutions.
  • A proactive attitude, coupled with a sense of ownership and autonomy.
  • Excellent problem-solving capabilities and a pragmatic, results-oriented mindset.
  • Exceptional relationship-building skills with the capacity to establish trust and rapport with stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated flexibility, perseverance, and a willingness to learn.

Analyzing and interpreting complex data sets from various sources (e.g., blockchain transactions, financial markets, and customer data), using statistical techniques and data visualization tools to identify patterns, trends, and insights

Working with key stakeholders to identify needs and report outputs to answer questions and drive decisions
Staying current with industry trends and best practices in data analysis, blockchain, and finance, and identifying opportunities for improving our data infrastructure and analytical capabilities
English B2+ and experience of verbal communication in international teams
Strong experience with Tableau data visualization
Internally-motivated, self-starter mindset with an analytical thinking and curiousity to help find insights and show the value of data-driven decision making
Ability to work cross-functionally and communicate with technical and non-technical teams
Detail-oriented approach with a passion for analytics and problem-solving
Proficiency in English and Russian, written and verbal
Experience with Vertica or similar columnar database
Demonstrable experience in the blockchain or finance domain
Experience or familiarity with forecasting data (Python, R)

Senior Data Analyst ‚Äì Brussels (Hybrid)


Location: Brussels, Belgium ‚Äì Hybrid

Start: ASAP

About the Role

A leading financial client is looking for a Data Analyst to help turn complex financial data into actionable insights. You‚Äôll work within an internal team to build analytics models, improve reporting, and drive data-driven decision-making across the organisation.


This role blends technical expertise with training and knowledge sharing, you‚Äôll deliver high-quality analysis while helping business users get the most from analytics tools.


Key Skills &

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (‚Äúraison d‚Äô√™tre‚Äù) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 100,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress

BU Supply & Energy Management provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients (businesses and retail) through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

15000 employees around the world develop our solutions, through international business platforms and B2C entities. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors, industrials and retail. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.
At S&EM we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation

Context: The Expertise Center (EC) Quantitative Research and Modeling (QRM) within GEMS is a team of around 115 quantitative analysts. It‚Äôs mission is to provide advanced quantitative expertise to all Business Platforms (BP) of GEMS and to Engie worldwide. The quantitative analyst will be part of the ‚ÄúPricing‚Äù team (approximately 15 people) and will be fully dedicated to the Business Platform Power Trading & Commercial.
The quantitative analyst should design and provide robust quantitative tools that have a concrete impact on the power business:

Work very closely with the BP Power Trading & Commercial, mainly with the Renewable and Batteries Trading team and the Asset Backed Power Trading team. He / She needs to understand their business needs, and needs to provide them with high-quality quantitative support in their day to day activities.
Participate in enhancing the existing pricing and managing framework.
Deliver ad hoc tactical solutions as well as develop new pricers in the official pricing library.
Play a key role for developing new products, linked for example to the renewable and battery business (pricing, managing strategies, various risk indicators, ‚Ä¶).
Promote best coding practices that comply with general rules and standards.
Document and share knowledge across GEMS on the different models used within GEMS.
Strong Financial Mathematical background (probability, stochastic calculus, various numerical methods such as Monte Carlo, finite differences, ‚Ä¶)
Coding experience (preferably C# and python), object oriented programming skills
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues
Engineering or university degree (Master of PhD) in Computer Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Financial Engineering.
0 to 3 years of experience in a similar role.
Travels: Occasional travels (for example conferences) are possible, but limited.
If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!
Apply by attaching your updated CV.
ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

4249634815,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-consultant-v-m-x-at-amaris-consulting-4249634815?position=12&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=pY7rY%2FC1M7oYG%2B50QClxdw%3D%3D,Data Consultant V/M/X,Amaris Consulting,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Who are we?
Amaris Consulting is een onafhankelijke technologie consultancy bedrijf dat ondersteuning en oplossingen biedt aan bedrijven.
Met meer dan 1 000 klanten over de wereld hebben we veel oplossingen uitgerold voor grote projecten voor meer dan een decennium.

Dit is mogelijk gemaakt door ons internationale team met meer dan 7 600 professionals verspreidt over 5 continenten in meer dan 60 landen. Onze oplossingen richten zich op vier business lijnen: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering.

We zijn gefocussed op het bouwen en behouden van een top talent gemeenschap waarin al onze team leden hun volle potentie kunnen behalen. Amaris is je ‚Äòsteppingstone‚Äô om een rivier van veranderingen over te steken, uitdagingen aan te gaan en om je projecten met succes af te ronden.

Bij Amaris Consulting zijn we op zoek naar veelzijdige en ambitieuze professionals om ons Data & AI Center of Excellence te versterken als Data Consultant. Of je nu gespecialiseerd bent in analytics, engineering of machine learning: jouw ervaring doet ertoe bij ons.
Wat doet een Data Consultant bij Amaris?

Als Data Consultant werk je aan strategische en technische projecten die jouw expertise combineren met de behoeften van toonaangevende organisaties. Jouw missie? Klanten helpen om waarde te halen uit hun data ‚Äì of dat nu betekent: robuuste datapijplijnen bouwen, businessinzichten leveren, ML-modellen implementeren of datagovernance verbeteren.
Wij verwelkomen professionals met ervaring in een of meerdere van de volgende profielen:

Je past machine learning en statistische technieken toe om zakelijke problemen op te lossen, van voorspellende modellen tot aanbevelingssystemen. Je bent vertrouwd met Python, scikit-learn en experimentatie-frameworks, en je weet hoe je inzichten omzet in tastbare bedrijfswaarde.

Je ontwerpt, bouwt en onderhoudt schaalbare datapijplijnen en -platformen. Je werkt met cloudtools (Azure, AWS, GCP), orkestratietools (Airflow, dbt) en big data-frameworks (Spark, Databricks) om schone, betrouwbare en toegankelijke data te garanderen.

Je operationaliseert machine learning-modellen en overbrugt de kloof tussen data science en productie. Je hebt ervaring met CI/CD, containerisatie (Docker, Kubernetes), MLOps-pijplijnen en de implementatie van modellen in real-time- of batchomgevingen.

Je onderzoekt en visualiseert data om bruikbare inzichten te bieden. Je bent vertrouwd met SQL, BI-tools (Power BI, Tableau), Excel en basiskennis van Python. Je weet hoe je KPI‚Äôs structureert, dashboards bouwt en overtuigende dataverhalen vertelt aan stakeholders.
üî• Wat je doet als Data Consultant:
Samenwerken in multidisciplinaire teams met engineers, wetenschappers, analisten en projectmanagers
Bijdragen aan volledige dataprojectlevenscycli: van verkenning en ontwerp tot ontwikkeling, testen en implementatie
Analyseren en beoordelen van datasystemen, -architectuur of -kwaliteit van de klant en aanbevelingen doen ter verbetering
Technische oplossingen vormgeven en implementeren in cloud-, hybride of on-premises omgevingen
Klantbehoeften vertalen naar datastrategie√´n en oplossingen die tastbare impact genereren
Deelnemen aan interne R&D-initiatieven en bijdragen aan accelerators en assets van ons Center of Excellence
Wij zijn technologie-agnostisch en pragmatisch: we passen onze stack aan op de behoeften van de klant. Veelgebruikte technologie√´n zijn o.a.:
Cloudplatforms: Azure (Data Factory, Synapse, Purview), AWS, GCP
Orkestratie & Transformatie: dbt, Airflow, Kedro, Dataform
Analytics & BI: Power BI, Tableau, Looker
MLOps & DevOps: MLflow, Docker, Git, CI/CD pipelines
Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist, Engineer, Analyst of ML Engineer
Ervaring met consultancy of een sterke interesse in klantgerichte rollen
Zowel technisch onderlegd als nieuwsgierig naar businessinzichten

column2: kennis van Frans of Nederlands is een plus

Sur ce dernier point une pr√©cision d‚Äôimportance : le bien-√™tre au travail est un luxe qu‚Äôil faut pouvoir s‚Äôoffrir en √©tant une entreprise ‚Äúsolide‚Äù. Ceci induit pour les Davidsonien(ne)s d‚Äôallier prises d‚Äôinitiative, engagement et professionnalisme. Car ‚Äúsans travail, le talent n‚Äôest qu‚Äôune sale manie‚Äù. 4282450023,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-equans-belux-4282450023?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=euxeDjGyd4wd%2FHPx3iFzCA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Equans BeLux,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","What if you could shape the future of HR decision-making?
With us, your expertise won‚Äôt just sit in dashboards ‚Äì it will actively support HR innovation across the entire organization.
To strengthen our HR IS team, we‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who thrives in a dynamic, agile environment and is eager to turn complex HR data into powerful insights.

You‚Äôll get to work on varied, business-critical HR projects with real impact ‚Äì all while collaborating with a supportive and passionate team. If you love working at the intersection of data, people, and technology, this job was made for you.
Your work location: our Equans-site in Brussels
As our HR Data Analyst, you will:
translate business needs into clear analysis and reporting actions
collaborate closely with analysts with different expertise within HR
act as the bridge between business and the developers
collect, clean and prepare data from multiple sources (databases, systems‚Ä¶)
evaluate results and help steer improvements
document processes, solutions and user guides
support the business during testing phases and guide them through test scenarios
What You Bring To The Table
5+ years of experience in data analysis,
2+ years of experience working in agile teams
hands-on knowledge of Power BI and MS Office
experience with Azure DevOps, MS Visio, DAX or SAP BI is a plus
strong communication & social skills and a proactive mindset
analytical, independent and focused on solutions
customer-oriented and eager to keep learning
fluent in Dutch, French and English
Ready to shape the way data drives HR?
Want to tackle tomorrow‚Äôs multi-technical challenges with us?

At Equans, you find an exciting career within a stable and financially sound company. You work on challenging, diverse projects and assist our clients with today‚Äôs three major transitions: the energy transition, the industrial transition, and the digital transition.
You have the opportunity to discover cutting-edge technologies and further develop your skills.
Joining Equans is more than that! You also get:
a competitive salary in line with your education and experience
eco & meal vouchers, 13th month, holiday pay
concessionary travel, lease car (with fuel/charging card), parking, bicycle lease plan
additional paid leave, seniority leave, homeworking
discounts through Benefits@Work (culture, sports, travel, and more)
Add to that the contagious warm atmosphere at Equans, and what are you waiting for?
We look forward to welcoming you!

Does this description fit you and would you like more information? Contact our HR colleague Erwin Verniers ‚Äì 02 370 30 62 ‚Äì erwin.verniers@external.equans.com ‚Äì https://www.linkedin.com/in/erwin-verniers

4268621585,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/e-bi-insights-monitoring-partner-at-ucb-4268621585?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=9K5KYinSMjZuj6AQMreV4w%3D%3D,E&BI Insights Monitoring Partner,UCB,"Anderlecht, Brussels Region, Belgium","We are looking for a E&BI Insights Monitoring Partner who is detail-oriented, collaborative, and proactive to join our Ethics & Business Integrity team, based at our HQ office, in Brussels, Belgium.

You will be working in a team that ensures ethical business practices as the owner of the E&BI global monitoring program. Your work will help identify process gaps, mitigate risks, support transparency, and strengthen compliance across the organization.

You will be part of the Ethics & Business Integrity team, collaborating closely with local leads and external monitoring vendors. You‚Äôll also engage with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making and continuous improvement.
Manage external vendors conducting monitoring activities, including sample selection, quality checks, and regular reviews
Share monitoring results and insights with local leads to support compliance and transparency
Conduct centralized monitoring and analytics aligned with the annual monitoring plan
Support decentralized monitoring in collaboration with local teams
Collect and analyze data to generate dashboards and insights on monitoring results
Contribute to the development of analytics methodologies and implementation of tools
Interested? For this role we‚Äôre looking for the following education, experience and skills
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field
3+ years of experience in compliance, risk management, or a related function
Strong knowledge of global healthcare regulatory standards and compliance monitoring
Excellent organizational and project management skills, including vendor coordination
Strong communication skills and ability to work independently with discretion
Experience in data analytics and tools such as Qlik or Power BI
Are you ready to ‚Äògo beyond‚Äô to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!
UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.

At UCB, we don‚Äôt just complete tasks, we create value. We aren‚Äôt afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected, and has equal opportunities to do their best work. We ‚Äògo beyond‚Äô to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that‚Äôs on our patients, our employees, or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.
UCB is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions will be made without regard to any characteristic protected by applicable laws.

Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on EMEA-Reasonable_Accommodation@ucb.com . Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments

4178648730,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-data-analytics-academic-year-2025-2026-at-deloitte-4178648730?position=18&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=oygTLZZEdeOsWY6OCjxkCw%3D%3D,Internship Data & Analytics - Academic Year 2025-2026,Deloitte,"Zaventem, Flemish Region, Belgium","Can‚Äôt wait to make an impact on the world? You‚Äôre not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond. Your journey with us
Join us and you‚Äôll be immersed in a dynamic company where you‚Äôll work with a diverse group of talented colleagues on a variety of exciting projects.

You‚Äôll be inspired and learn every day, exploring many different industries and collaborating with our clients, ranging from large national to multinational companies to non-profit and public sector organisations.
This is the field of interest for you, if you want to conduct in-depth analyses of business and technology issues, but also make recommendations to improve or transform our clients' businesses.
Depending on the team you join, you will have different kinds of tasks:
You'll work on interesting and challenging assignments that inspire you daily with their diversity
You‚Äôll assist in analysing data, helping our clients to unlock their data solutions and to drive analytical needs
You‚Äôll put your analytical skills into practice, improving your strong analytical mind.
You‚Äôll capture and translate requirements from the business as well as new existing environments.
You‚Äôll extract, collect, and organise data to find correlations and patterns that produce meaningful conclusions relevant to businesses.
You‚Äôll work with different kinds of software, data tools, and ERP systems.
You'll structure and leverage our clients‚Äô data to improve their businesses.
The list above is a general overview. You'll receive more information during the interviews.
You are in the final year of your bachelor or master‚Äôs degree or your pre-final master year.
You are highly motivated, and a reliable team player with a sense of initiative.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and have a good knowledge of English.
You have a critical mindset and good analytical skills.
You have the ability to conceptualise and articulate ideas and solutions.
You are able to use MS Office tools (Excel, Word and PowerPoint).
You are rigorous in your daily routine, but also in your working tools and methods.

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.

Be the true you!¬†We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.¬†We practice what we preach!¬†As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and¬†unifying values.
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by¬†Energise@Deloitte
Real impact: interns at Deloitte contribute to real client projects, making tangible business impacts from day one.
Mentorship: access to a structured support system, including a mentor and buddy.
Lunch & Transport allowance: interns receive an amount for meals and commuting, adding to overall comfort and convenience.
Network opportunities: building a strong professional network through firmwide events, team activities and leadership exposure.
Interns Ignite event: a signature experience designed to connect interns across the firm, foster innovation and putting our interns in the spotlight.
Career perspective: as we highly value & believe in the potential of our interns, we offer our final year interns the opportunity to start working within our company after graduation.
Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Can‚Äôt wait to make an impact on the world? You‚Äôre not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond. Your journey with us


Join us and you‚Äôll be immersed in a dynamic company where you‚Äôll work with a diverse group of talented colleagues on a variety of exciting projects.

You‚Äôll be inspired and learn every day, exploring many different industries and collaborating with our clients, ranging from large national to multinational companies to non-profit and public sector organisations.

This is the field of interest for you, if you want to conduct in-depth analyses of business and technology issues, but also make recommendations to improve or transform our clients' businesses.

Depending on the team you join, you will have different kinds of tasks:

  • You'll work on interesting and challenging assignments that inspire you daily with their diversity
  • You‚Äôll assist in analysing data, helping our clients to unlock their data solutions and to drive analytical needs
  • You‚Äôll put your analytical skills into practice, improving your strong analytical mind.
  • You‚Äôll capture and translate requirements from the business as well as new existing environments.
  • You‚Äôll extract, collect, and organise data to find correlations and patterns that produce meaningful conclusions relevant to businesses.
  • You‚Äôll work with different kinds of software, data tools, and ERP systems.
  • You'll structure and leverage our clients‚Äô data to improve their businesses.
The list above is a general overview. You'll receive more information during the interviews.







Let‚Äôs talk about you
  • You are in the final year of your bachelor or master‚Äôs degree or your pre-final master year.
  • You are highly motivated, and a reliable team player with a sense of initiative.
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and have a good knowledge of English.
  • You have a critical mindset and good analytical skills.
  • You have the ability to conceptualise and articulate ideas and solutions.
  • You are results oriented.
  • You are able to use MS Office tools (Excel, Word and PowerPoint).
  • You work methodically and conscientiously.
  • You are rigorous in your daily routine, but also in your working tools and methods.











Who is Deloitte?

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.


Why Deloitte?

4267760499,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/marketing-data-analyst-f-m-x-at-jcdecaux-4267760499?position=19&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=9TJkJS%2BAh9xAjpWOWaypbQ%3D%3D,Marketing Data Analyst (f/m/x),JCDecaux,"Brussels Region, Belgium","Ready to shape the urban landscape of tomorrow?
Join JCDecaux, the world's leading company in outdoor advertising!
Imagine having a daily impact on the lives of more than 850 million people worldwide.
At JCDecaux, this is our reality!
For over 60 years, we have been reinventing cities by designing innovative and aesthetic communication solutions, from intelligent street furniture to spectacular digital screens in airports.

Present in more than 80 countries with a team of 13,000 talents (including 300 passionate individuals in Belgium and Luxembourg), we are on the brink of a new urban era: smarter, connected, and sustainable.
Driven by our values ""Stronger Together"" and an ambitious climate strategy, we are looking for brilliant and committed minds to innovate with us.
Choosing JCDecaux means joining a strong company, a leader in its market, where kindness, continuous training, and retention (10 years average seniority!) are realities.
Make data actionable throughout all our commercial systems and turn data into actionable insights.

Be our marketing data hero : You manage available marketing data, you modelize them where necessary and prepare them for integration in our tools, such as our planning and allocation system, and our data management platform.
Drive data & insights innovation: You are the first to pick up new research and data projects in the market and you follow up with our international data team on JCDecaux‚Äô advanced data tools.
Drive market research projects: You develop new groundbreaking market research to respond to commercial needs. You follow-up and analyze existing market research.
Respond brilliantly to challenges: You analyze client briefings in an efficient way and provide clear information and strategic advice on our available data and insights.
Optimize efficiency: You find or create new tools to optimize the way of working.
Juggle with numbers: You easily turn numbers into useful and easily understandable information to support our go to market team.
You have a bachelor's or master‚Äôs degree in business management, data science, operational research or marketing.
You have at least 2 years' professional experience in market research, market intelligence, preferably in a market research agency, a media agency or a marketing department.
You exhibit precision and efficiency in all tasks.
You are passionate about advertising and its influence.
You possess a unique blend of analytical skills, precision, commercial acumen, and effective communication abilities, with an eagerness to explore new data and AI developments.
You are proficient in Microsoft Office applications and adept with big data tools like Power BI, with a talent for quickly mastering new software.
You communicate in a clear and effective way.
You are organized and able to navigate between various tools and applications.
You're a proactive team player who enjoys collaborative work with marketing and sales.
More than anything else, you are driven by a strong desire to learn and the ambition to grow within JCDecaux BeLux organization.
You have a perfect command of French and Dutch (essential for meetings) and know English (for creating presentations and to communicate with international teams).
As part of the bigger marketing department, you will work closely with the data and insights team
In addition to statutory holidays, you have 12 extra leave per year
Possibility of teleworking two days a week
Central working location in Brussels (Quartier du Sablon)
In-depth training from day one, enabling you to gradually familiarise yourself with all the
IT tools and applications used at JCDecaux
Join the JCDecaux adventure and help shape the city of tomorrow! Apply now.

Klaar om je vast te bijten in data en √©cht impact te maken als Data Analist?

Heb je 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!

Bij darwind verwelkomen we gemotiveerde professionals die willen groeien en hun vaardigheden verder willen ontwikkelen. Je komt terecht in een omgeving waar mensen, leren en impact centraal staan.


Wat ga je doen?

Wie zoeken we?

  • Je bent vlot met Python, SQL en Excel, ervaring met R of Azure is een plus

This role sits within the data engineering function, focused on building internal data products and supporting large-scale analytics across trading and research.
Design and maintain scalable, distributed data pipelines
Build monitoring tools to ensure integrity and completeness of data

For further details, please contact xander@durlstonpartners.com. Stay informed about all our live roles by following Durlston Partners.

Senior Data Engineer ‚Äì Systematic Trading ‚Äì Remote (UK/EU) ‚Äì ¬£200k‚Äì¬£300k


Overview:

A technology-driven trading firm operating globally across digital asset markets. The team applies systematic strategies and cutting-edge infrastructure to provide liquidity and execute at scale. This role sits within the data engineering function, focused on building internal data products and supporting large-scale analytics across trading and research.


Responsibilities:

  • Design and maintain scalable, distributed data pipelines
  • Build monitoring tools to ensure integrity and completeness of data
  • Develop APIs and internal interfaces to query historical trading data
  • Collaborate with researchers and developers to optimise analytics workflows
  • Contribute to the evolution of data infrastructure in a latency-sensitive environment


Requirements:

  • Python, with experience in tick databases such as Clickhouse or Vertica
  • Strong background in real-time, high-volume data processing
  • AWS-based compute cluster experience
  • Experience handling large-scale time series datasets
  • Familiarity with tooling for quant research and trading system integration


Location: Remote ‚Äì UK or Europe

Compensation: ¬£150k‚Äì¬£200k + Equity (depending on experience)


For further details, please contact xander@durlstonpartners.com. Stay informed about all our live roles by following Durlston Partners.

Senior Machine Learning / Deep Learning Researcher - Remote - $400k


My brand new client is on the hunt for a skilled Senior Machine Learning Researcher to drive cutting-edge AI and ML research in high-frequency trading.


This full-time role in Europe / US / APAC is paying up to $400,000 USD + bonus (x2 per year).


Key Responsibilities:


- Conduct AI/ML research and refine deep learning architectures.

- Analyze large, unstructured datasets to extract insights.

- Stay updated on emerging methodologies and technologies.


Requirements:


- PhD/MD or equivalent research experience in AI, ML, or quantitative fields.

- Strong foundation in ML, mathematical statistics, and deep learning.

- Proficiency in Python or other programming languages.

- Hands-on experience with high-quality research and data analysis.


What They Offer:


- Competitive salary, bonuses, and profit-sharing.

- Cutting-edge tech and expert team collaboration.

- Ownership of impactful projects in a flexible, results-driven environment.

- Professional development support.


If this sounds like something you would like to be doing, please do apply with an up to date resume.


I look forward to speaking.


Thanks,

Ed

4284440318,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/be-data-engineer-at-biztory-4284440318?position=26&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=fyfOYzQSa8hysm%2BOUst7Nw%3D%3D,BE Data Engineer,Biztory,"Kontich, Flemish Region, Belgium","Data Engineer (BE)
What Does The Party Look Like?

At Biztory, we accelerate the Data + AI Journey at our clients and achieve higher levels of data + AI maturity. As a leading strategic data consultancy in Europe, Biztory helps you to be at the forefront of data & AI-driven innovation - and stay there.
Biztory can help you solve any data & analytical challenge, whether technical or business.
We have the most skilled and certified Tableau, Snowflake, dbt & Fivetran consultants, and our specialists bring significant expertise to our client portfolio.

We're a ‚Ç¨1bn start-up ... the best of both worlds. Biztory is a small, agile company with the flexibility to react to the changing winds of the market. We enjoy the backing and strength of a large company, with entrepreneurship in its DNA. We're one of more than 400 companies in the Cronos Group.

We get stuff done! We have offices across Europe in Belgium, Netherlands, Germany + the UK and we won numerous technology awards across our regions. Our customers span industries and their use cases are as interesting as they are diverse but we enjoy fixing their data, informing their people and enriching their customer experiences.

We love our people. We love helping people find answers in their data. Easier. Faster. Some of us have tattoos, some play video games and some cook amazing BBQ. We guide, inform, and train! We're nothing without trust so we maintain a flat management structure, talk to anyone about anything.
What Do You Bring To The Party?

Are you driven? Do you like to help people? Do you like puzzles? We're looking for someone to fill a brand new role at Biztory delivering world class data engineering and architecture to our customers.

You will be responsible for helping our clients design and implement modern data solutions to drive analytics and Data & AI usage. We help organisations to build data pipelines, data lakes and data warehouses to power their analytics.
You'll be part of our diverse and enthusiastic team of technical experts who take great pride in gaining knowledge and sharing this with our clients and the people in our team.
Passionate about data - seriously, that's really important
A clear, confident, and concise communicator (verbal and written)
Fluent in English (and NL or FR is a big plus)
Working with a solution-oriented and customer-first mindset
A very good understanding and working knowledge of SQL and Git
A strong understanding of Data Engineering best practices
Experience designing and implementing data marts, data lakes or data warehouses
Ability to design and apply relevant data modeling techniques (Kimball, data vault, etc...)
Experience designing and implementing robust data pipelines
Hands-on experience in the cloud data eco-systems (Snowflake, AWS, Azure GCP, etc)
You might even have (which is a big plus)
Experience in building and improving end-to-end data platforms
Experience with dbt, Docker, Terraform or Python
To be highly involved in our Data Domain competence center
To share your experience and knowledge with our growing team
To find your place as part of our team of committed and passionate data people
If you're still reading, we want you!
We are looking for people with all backgrounds with all levels of experience and a passion to further develop.
Competitive salaries with development opportunities and incentives
Laptop and help with home set-up
Annual education budget to help you explore and expand your skill set
You can send your CV to careers@biztory.com

4242021272,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-data-wizards-4242021272?position=27&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=PF9XNXVJJxXLjVYl245NWQ%3D%3D,Data Engineer,Data Wizards,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"Don‚Äôt settle for just any consulting company‚Äîchoose the one that‚Äôs right for you!
We‚Äôre on the lookout for a Data Engineer to join our rapidly expanding AI & Data start-up.

As Data Wizards, we are a team of experts in AI & Data who advocate for human-centered AI development and usage. We partner with innovative companies from strategy to implementation to help them achieve their goals by unlocking the full potential of their data assets respecting cultural and ethical norms.
You're making the right choice to apply if you're eager to be part of an ambitious, high-energy team filled with curious, proactive minds who are passionate about AI and driven by integrity.

However, this isn‚Äôt the job for you if you‚Äôre looking for a routine, copy-paste kind of role. Here, every day is different, and we love people who take initiative, embrace challenges, and think outside the box. üöÄ
As a Data Engineer, your mission would include:
Designing, building, and maintaining robust data pipelines to support AI and analytics initiatives.
Collaborating with stakeholders to understand business needs and ensure data is structured effectively for AI applications.
Developing and optimizing SQL queries (especially T-SQL) and Python scripts for efficient data processing.
Implementing data modeling techniques to ensure scalable and maintainable data architectures.
Working with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS, leveraging tools like Databricks, Data Factory, and Synapse Analytics.
Ensuring best practices in DevOps, version control, and data governance.
Managing orchestration workflows using Airflow or similar tools.
Supporting AI teams by preparing high-quality, structured data for machine learning applications.
Communicating technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and making data solutions accessible to broader audiences.
You‚Äôre a step closer to joining our team if you bring:
Master‚Äôs degree in a technical field.
At least 3 year of experience in Data Engineering.
Experience in client-facing roles, in consulting companies.
Strong expertise in SQL (especially T-SQL) and Python.
Experience in Azure with tools like Databricks, Data Factory, and Synapse Analytics.
Familiarity with DevOps and version control best practices.
Experience with Airflow or other orchestration tools is a plus.
Expertise in Machine Learning, especially NLP, is a plus.
Certifications such as Azure DP-203 are a plus.
Ability to manage stakeholders and communicate effectively across technical and non-technical teams.
A problem-solver with a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù attitude and a hacker mentality.
Highly curious and always eager to improve and learn.
Strong ability to work independently and drive projects from intake to delivery.
Languages: Fluent in English. Native in either French or Dutch.
We know that finding the right job isn‚Äôt just about the role‚Äîit‚Äôs about what‚Äôs in it for you, too. While we‚Äôre a start-up, we‚Äôre big on taking care of our people right from day one.
Here‚Äôs a sneak peek at what we offer:
üí∞ A compensation package that keeps you motivated:
Mobility budget or company car with a fuel card
A top-tier laptop & smartphone with a subscription
Opportunity to earn company stock over time
üéØ A place to be your best self, grow, and thrive:
Work with the most innovative technologies in Data & AI
Work in an agile, collaborative environment
Monthly team-building events (plus one epic annual celebration)
Tailored training programs to fuel your career growth
A cool, ergonomic office with creative meeting spaces
A Nintendo Switch for spontaneous Mario Kart battles üéÆ
A massage chair for those deep-thinking moments üßò
Fresh coffee & drinks to keep you energized ‚òï
‚ú® And most importantly, a fast-growing company where opportunities are limitless!
Quick intro call with our HR team
You can apply right here on LinkedIn

If you‚Äôre passionate about what we do but aren‚Äôt sure you meet every single requirement‚Äîdon‚Äôt hesitate to apply. We value potential, mindset, and growth as much as experience. At Data Wizards, we believe diversity is our strength. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and experiences because different viewpoints help us grow and evolve.
Let‚Äôs build the future of AI & Data, together ü§ù

Please note: As a consulting company, our recruitment process can be either project-driven or based on strong profiles we believe in. The consultancy world moves fast, and while we always aim to match great talent with the right opportunity, there might not always be an immediate fit. With your permission, we‚Äôll gladly keep your profile in mind for future missions ‚Äî and hope to collaborate with you soon on an exciting project at Data Wizards!

Don‚Äôt settle for just any consulting company‚Äîchoose the one that‚Äôs right for you!

4279892269,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-forecasting-nl-at-brussels-airport-4279892269?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=dADSL3ox88d8f2z2urGoxA%3D%3D,Data Analyst (Forecasting) -NL,Brussels Airport,"Zaventem, Flemish Region, Belgium","Be part of our beating heart

Brussels Airport wil bekend staan als een van de beste luchthavens ter wereld, een volledig verbonden economische hub voor mensen en bedrijven, het kloppende hart van Europa, waar klanten, innovatie en duurzaamheid centraal staan. Wil jij de luchthaven van vandaag en morgen helpen vormgeven?
Stop met dromen en kom ons team versterken!
Om ons departement Technology & Infrastructure te versterken, zijn we op zoek naar een Data Analyst (Forecasting) .

Als Data Analyst (Forecasting) speel je een sleutelrol in het analyseren en voorspellen van toekomstige trends. Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende afdelingen en vertaalt data naar waardevolle inzichten voor operationele besluitvorming.
Wat Je Bij Ons Zal Realiseren
Uitvoeren, analyseren en optimaliseren van forecast runs en de impact ervan op processen zoals screening, border en check-in.
Voorbereiden en presenteren van forecastresultaten en analyses aan stakeholders.
Ontwikkelen van datagestuurde adviezen voor procesmanagers bij capaciteitsplanning.
Functionele analyses en testen ter ondersteuning van nieuwe ontwikkelingen binnen forecasting & optimization.
Opleiding: Master in een business-technische richting (zoals handelsingenieur, industrieel ingenieur, management information systems, TEW)

column2: operationeel onderzoek, statistiek en bijbehorende tools (Python, R, SQL, BI-tools).

column1: Vaardigheden: Sterke analytisch, data-interpretatie, en heel sterke communicatievaardigheden
Talen: Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands of Frans, hebt een goede kennis van de tweede taal en kunt je goed uitdrukken in het Engels.
Gaat je hart al sneller slaan?
Bij Brussels Airport werk je in een wereld op zich, vol nieuwe kansen en spannende uitdagingen. Je komt terecht in een unieke en inspirerende omgeving die je talenten vleugels geeft.

Wat je ervaring helemaal bijzonder maakt? Ons nieuwe Compass-gebouw met zijn prachtige panorama, ideaal uitgerust om op een hybride en flexibele manier samen te werken, waar je kan rekenen op een aantrekkelijk aanbod van extralegale voordelen voor werknemers. Daarnaast bouwen we aan een duurzame omgeving waar we met de fiets, bus of elektrische auto naartoe komen en waar we zelfs een eigen treinstation hebben. Wat wil je nog meer?
Volg het ritme van ons hart

Kan je niet wachten om jezelf te overstijgen bij Brussels Airport Company? Stuur snel jouw CV en motivatiebrief via de daarvoor bestemde link. En wie weet, misschien verwelkomen we jou heel binnenkort op onze bruisende luchthaven in het hart van Europa!
Heb je nog vragen? Contacteer gerust Sofie.Bruynooghe@brusselsairport.be

Datashift is a fast-growing consultancy team with a focus on delivering solutions that answer business questions with data and facts. For one of our fastest growing practices, we are looking for a skilled Data Engineer.

Do you have at least 3 to 6 years of experience? Do you love to work on projects and look at them from an end-to-end data perspective. Then we are delighted to receive your personal application and we‚Äôll contact you for an interview and a (virtual) cup of coffee.
Translate client needs into maintainable data solution (ETL/Infrastructure as a code/Interfaces/pipelines, ...)
Design data solutions, making the trade-off between cost and maintainability
Work together with Data Scientists, BI specialists and Business Consultants to deliver value to our customers
Stay up to date with the latest developments in data technology and actively participate in sharing your knowledge with your colleagues
Monitor the quality and stability of data solutions
You feel energized when writing and observing well-structured code
Strong background in development, with knowledge in languages such as Java and/or PHP
Experience with Linux is a plus

Datashift is a firm believer in growing through its people. We will guide and support you providing many opportunities to develop and grow in the direction you want. However, we equally believe that it is you who takes ownership of your growth. That is why we give you the tools and the driving seat, it's up to you to do seize the opportunity.
One thing is for sure, surrounded by an entrepreneurial team, many opportunities will present themselves to deepen your expertise knowledge or broaden your Horizon in Data.

In this role, you are on the track to become a master in leading Data Engineering solutions for our clients. Whilst collaborating within Datashift on existing competence centers or helping to establish new practices. Making sure you and we keep up with the advancements in Data engineering.
A no-nonsense working environment with a focus on high quality
Excellent terms of employment (including company car, fuel card, meal vouchers & bonus)
Fringe benefits including continuous training that builds and extends professional, technical and management skills in all areas
The opportunity to grow together with Datashift in terms of capabilities as well as financial benefits.
Are you looking for a data engineering opportunity that allows you to progress towards greater architectural responsibilities? Feel free to reach out to +32 488 34 27 19 or jobs@datashift.eu.

4280259986,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-energy-at-clearsource-4280259986?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=QPd974C81Wr4OwShEpps6A%3D%3D,Data Analyst Energy,ClearSource,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Freelance Data Analyst Energy
Hybrid Brussels, start asap, long term
Our client is looking for a Data Advisor with an Agile Mindset Service

Side-by-side with other Contingent Workers and internal staff, you will play a part in building a sustainable, green and reliable energy infrastructure that stimulates economic growth and reduces our ecological footprint.

Our client is moving towards Data-centricity, i.e. Data becomes a masterpiece in its strategy execution, and a Data-driven company. Our mission consists in facilitating and driving the entire organisation to leverage data as an enabler to achieve its targets:
Unlock transversal Data fit for purpose

One key role of a Data Advisor is to close the gap between Business and Data. Together with subject matter experts, you define and design solid foundations for the Data in terms of Metadata, Responsibilities and Discoverability to leverage the Data Platform.
As part of a product team, you will move rocks to improve Data Management practices and to ease them.
You contribute to improving the Data Governance methodology by providing feedback from the field.
You work with a Business Purpose, while breathing Data, Organisation & People, Processes, and Technology.
You understand and analyse the Business needs.
You are looking for solutions that can quickly bring benefits and keep an eye on more-long terms solutions to ensure sustainability on mid-terms.
You leverage advising and training (i.e. Data Owners, Data Stewards, Business and IT teams) by on-the-job coaching.

You continuously review and ensure transversality of the Business Glossary that defines the common and universal language within client, by formalising the Business definitions of data and their purpose.
You manage expectations from, and intensely collaborate and align with, multi-disciplinary stakeholders, departments and product teams.
You excel at bringing people with various backgrounds together to converge.
You are the ambassador of One Team for the Customer.
What you will NOT be doing
You shall not act from an Ivory Tower.
You shall not define Data Governance methodology but will influence its evolution by providing retrospective feedback from the field.
You don‚Äôt make decisions for the Business but rather advise them with careful logic or showing your reasoning.
You don‚Äôt manage the data community, nor engineering, nor development teams.
You don‚Äôt define the details of the solutions architecture, nor the technical architecture, nor will you implement technical solutions.
You are able to speak, read and write fluently English and French or Dutch.
You can demonstrate proven experience with similar projects, missions or employments, with an experience of minimum 4 years with:
Data Classification, Data Privacy, Data Security, CIA Measures ‚Äì Optional
If this sound like you, please send me your CV, day rate and availability to gregor@clearsource.eu

Freelance Data Analyst Energy

Hybrid Brussels, start asap, long term


Context

Our client is looking for a Data Advisor with an Agile Mindset Service

Side-by-side with other Contingent Workers and internal staff, you will play a part in building a sustainable, green and reliable energy infrastructure that stimulates economic growth and reduces our ecological footprint.


Service description

Our client is moving towards Data-centricity, i.e. Data becomes a masterpiece in its strategy execution, and a Data-driven company. Our mission consists in facilitating and driving the entire organisation to leverage data as an enabler to achieve its targets:

  1. Creating business value through Data
  2. Think Data intuitively
  3. Unlock transversal Data fit for purpose

One key role of a Data Advisor is to close the gap between Business and Data. Together with subject matter experts, you define and design solid foundations for the Data in terms of Metadata, Responsibilities and Discoverability to leverage the Data Platform.

As part of a product team, you will move rocks to improve Data Management practices and to ease them.


What you will be doing

  • You contribute to improving the Data Governance methodology by providing feedback from the field.
  • You work with a Business Purpose, while breathing Data, Organisation &
column2:
People, Processes, and Technology.
  • You understand and analyse the Business needs.
  • You are looking for solutions that can quickly bring benefits and keep an eye on more-long terms solutions to ensure sustainability on mid-terms.
  • You leverage advising and training (i.e. Data Owners, Data Stewards, Business and IT teams) by on-the-job coaching.
  • You continuously review and ensure transversality of the Business Glossary that defines the common and universal language within client, by formalising the Business definitions of data and their purpose.
  • You manage expectations from, and intensely collaborate and align with, multi-disciplinary stakeholders, departments and product teams.
  • You excel at bringing people with various backgrounds together to converge.
  • You are the ambassador of One Team for the Customer.
  • You always generate business value.


    • What you will NOT be doing

    • You shall not act from an Ivory Tower.
    • You shall not define Data Governance methodology but will influence its evolution by providing retrospective feedback from the field.
    • You don‚Äôt make decisions for the Business but rather advise them with careful logic or showing your reasoning.
    • You don‚Äôt manage the data community, nor engineering, nor development teams.
    • You don‚Äôt define the details of the solutions architecture, nor the technical architecture, nor will you implement technical solutions.
    • You don‚Äôt develop systems.


    Requirements

    • You are able to speak, read and write fluently English and French or Dutch.


    Technical Skills (required)

    You can demonstrate proven experience with similar projects, missions or employments, with an experience of minimum 4 years with:

    • Data Governance ‚Äì Mandatory
    • Data Quality Management ‚Äì Mandatory
    • Metadata Management ‚Äì Mandatory
    • Master Data Management ‚Äì Mandatory
    • Data Classification, Data Privacy, Data Security, CIA Measures ‚Äì Optional
    • Business Intelligence &
column3:
Analytics ‚Äì Optional
  • Big data ‚Äì Optional
  • Data Modeling ‚Äì Optional
  • Data Integration &
column4:
API ‚Äì Optional


If this sound like you, please send me your CV, day rate and availability to gregor@clearsource.eu
