4267165497,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-tekever-4267165497?position=32&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=Ahu0ef2YDnUbRXWyCANZ%2FA%3D%3D,Data Engineer,TEKEVER,European Union,"Are you ready to revolutionise the world with TEKEVER? üöÄüåç
At TEKEVER, we lead innovation in Europe as the European leader in unmanned technology, where cutting-edge advancements meet unparalleled innovation.

We operate across four strategic areas, combining artificial intelligence, systems engineering, data science, and aerospace technology to tackle global challenges ‚Äî from protecting people and critical infrastructure to exploring space.

We offer a unique surveillance-as-a-service solution that delivers real-time intelligence, enhancing maritime safety and saving lives. Our products and services support strategic and operational decisions in the most demanding environments ‚Äî whether at sea, on land, in space, or in cyberspace.
üåê Become part of a dynamic, multidisciplinary, and mission-driven team that is transforming maritime surveillance and redefining global safety standards.
At TEKEVER, our mission is to provide limitless support through mission-oriented game-changers, delivering the right information at the right time to empower critical decision-making.
If you're passionate about technology and eager to shape the future ‚Äî TEKEVER is the place for you. üëáüèªüéØ

As a Data Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing, building and maintaining the data pipelines and systems that support our data-driven initiatives, as well as supporting the evolution of our Data & Analytics Platform. You will work closely with data scientists, analysts and other stakeholders to ensure that our data & AI infrastructure is robust, scalable and efficient. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, with experience in data integration, ETL processes, database management and Data & Analytics Platform development.
Data Pipeline Development: Design, develop and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines to collect, process and store large volumes of data from various sources.
ETL Processes: Implement ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data is accurately and efficiently transformed and loaded into data storage systems.
Database Management: Manage and optimize databases and data warehouses to ensure data integrity, performance and availability.
Data Integration: Integrate data from multiple sources, including APIs, databases and external data providers, to create unified datasets for analysis.
Data & Analytics Platform development & expansion: support the expansion of our Data & Analytics Platform.
Data Quality Assurance: Implement data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure the accuracy and consistency of data.
Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide the necessary data infrastructure and support.
Performance Optimization: Monitor and optimize the performance of data pipelines and databases to ensure efficient data processing and retrieval.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data pipelines, ETL processes and database schemas.
Education: Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field.
Preferred location of working: UK, Portugal , France and/or Spain
Experience: 3+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar role.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Experience with SQL and database management systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server).
Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data warehousing solutions (e.g., Redshift, Snowflake).
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their data services, with a focus on Google Cloud. Google Cloud certification is preferred.
Knowledge of data integration tools and frameworks (e.g., Apache Nifi, Talend, Informatica).
Experience with data modeling and schema design.

Experience with Iaac (e.g. Ansible, Terraform), data pipeline orchestration (e.g. Airflow), log exploration tools (e.g. Streamlit, Dash), data extraction (e.g. PostGIS, Kafka, Airflow, FastAPI), pandas, scikit-learn, Docker.
Basic understanding of DevOps best practices and tools: GIT, CI/CD, telemetry and monitoring, etc.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering scalable and efficient data solutions.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Language Requirements: Advanced proficiency in Portuguese and English, with proven fluency at the C2 level in both languages.
Attention to Detail: High attention to detail and a commitment to ensuring data quality and accuracy.
Adaptability: Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.
What We Have To Offer You
An excellent work environment and an opportunity to create a real impact in the world
A truly high-tech, state-of-the-art engineering company with flat structure and no politics
Working with the very latest technologies in Data & AI, including Edge AI, Swarming - both within our software platforms and within our embedded on-board systems
Salary compatible with the level of proven experience.
Do you want to know more about us ?
Visit our LinkedIn page at https://www.linkedin.com/company/tekever/

4182799797,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/esg-quantitative-analyst-at-candriam-4182799797?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=%2FcG9M%2FL4OuVqmUYnOADtDQ%3D%3D,ESG Quantitative Analyst,Candriam,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Position description

Candriam is a global multi-specialist asset manager and a recognized pioneer and leader in sustainable investment. For more than 25 years, Candriam has offered innovative and diversified investment solutions across many asset classes including fixed income, equities, absolute return, asset allocation and illiquid assets.

As a Responsible Employer, Equal Employment Opportunity is crucial to Candriam. We are committed to building the best global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We provide an inclusive work environment and support wellbeing and work-life balance.

Within Candriam, the ESG Quantitative Analytics and Research team is a Front Office team that copes with various transversal projects linked to ESG. Its main objective is to provide innovative, state-of-the-art ESG analysis frameworks and market leading ESG investment solutions.

We are hiring an ESG Quantitative Analyst who will support and enhance the ESG universe that incorporates all the internal ESG analysis. This person will act as the liaison between Investment Engineering team, ESG analysts and Investment Managers.
Based in Brussels, he/she will contribute to the following missions:
ESG universe production, support and enhancements:
Produce the internal ESG scorings/ratings and eligibilities for portfolios.
Performs controls on ESG universe updates and coordination within the whole ESG team.
Analyze variations in the eligibility decisions of issuers and provide clear explanations.
Enhance of the ESG universe and participate in the new target architecture around ESG data.
Link with Managers, IT and ESG referential data team.
Enhance internal ESG models to be more in line with evolving client‚Äôs demand and regulations:
Develop ESG algorithm solution in Python.
Improve models and documentation linked to controversial activities
Simulate and implement new models linked to clients demands, regulations and labels.
Build tools for the team and other departments:
In particular specific tools via Power BI.
Master's degree in fields such as Quantitative Finance, Data Analysis, Mathematics, Environmental Science or Engineering.
Minimum 2 years' experience in similar role, within the Financial Services sector.
Strong IT knowledge, programming skills and working knowledge in Python are required.
Solid understanding of financial maths and instruments.
Azure synapse and Factset are a plus.
Analytical, synthetical mind and strong eye for details
Ability to explain analysis and/or models to non-technical audience.
English fluent. French or Dutch would be a plus.

Position description

Business unit

Investment Management - ESG Investments &
column2:
Research

Job title

ESG Quantitative Analyst

Contract type

Permanent

Candriam Group Presentation

Candriam is a global multi-specialist asset manager and a recognized pioneer and leader in sustainable investment. For more than 25 years, Candriam has offered innovative and diversified investment solutions across many asset classes including fixed income, equities, absolute return, asset allocation and illiquid assets.

As a Responsible Employer, Equal Employment Opportunity is crucial to Candriam. We are committed to building the best global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We provide an inclusive work environment and support wellbeing and work-life balance.

Mission

Within Candriam, the ESG Quantitative Analytics and Research team is a Front Office team that copes with various transversal projects linked to ESG. Its main objective is to provide innovative, state-of-the-art ESG analysis frameworks and market leading ESG investment solutions.

We are hiring an ESG Quantitative Analyst who will support and enhance the ESG universe that incorporates all the internal ESG analysis. This person will act as the liaison between Investment Engineering team, ESG analysts and Investment Managers.

Responsabilities

Based in Brussels, he/she will contribute to the following missions:

  • ESG universe production, support and enhancements:


Produce the internal ESG scorings/ratings and eligibilities for portfolios.

Performs controls on ESG universe updates and coordination within the whole ESG team.

Analyze variations in the eligibility decisions of issuers and provide clear explanations.

Enhance of the ESG universe and participate in the new target architecture around ESG data.

Link with Managers, IT and ESG referential data team.

  • Enhance internal ESG models to be more in line with evolving client‚Äôs demand and regulations:


Develop ESG algorithm solution in Python.

Improve models and documentation linked to controversial activities

Simulate and implement new models linked to clients demands, regulations and labels.

  • Build tools for the team and other departments:


In particular specific tools via Power BI.

Profile

Master's degree in fields such as Quantitative Finance, Data Analysis, Mathematics, Environmental Science or Engineering.

Minimum 2 years' experience in similar role, within the Financial Services sector.

Strong interest in ESG.

Skills :

Good communication skills.

Strong IT knowledge, programming skills and working knowledge in Python are required.

Solid understanding of financial maths and instruments.

Proficient in PowerBI and Excel

Azure synapse and Factset are a plus.

Experience with ESG data providers

Pro-active and stress resistant

Analytical, synthetical mind and strong eye for details

Team player.

Ability to explain analysis and/or models to non-technical audience.

English fluent. French or Dutch would be a plus.

Job location


Candidate criteria

Education

  • Master's Degree I / Bac+4


Minimum Level Of Experience Required

2-5 years

4273792790,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-healthcare-at-belgie-vacature-4273792790?position=38&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=Ql6NDFY8V5GJdaoTTR3JjQ%3D%3D,Business & Data Analyst Healthcare,Belgie Vacature,"Uccle, Brussels Region, Belgium","Taken en verantwoordelijkheden
HR Rail zoekt nieuwe collega's, Wil jij onze teams versterken? Ontdek de vacature hieronder en solliciteer.
Bedankt om te solliciteren via deze link.
Wat is jouw rol bij HR Rail?

Het team Project & IT Management (PIT) van de KGV is op zoek naar een Business & Data Analyst Healthcare om het team te versterken. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de implementatie en het beheer van diverse projecten op het gebied van digitalisering van de geneeskundige verzorging.

Als Business & Data Analist Healthcare werk je mee aan de digitalisering van de sector geneeskundige verzorging door deel te nemen aan verschillende werkgroepen en commissies. Je stelt business requirements op voor de IT-afdeling en analyseert de impact en behoeften voor de back-office.
Je houdt toezicht op tests die worden uitgevoerd met softwarepakketten van prestatieverleners.
Je identificeert en test de door IT voorgestelde oplossingen en aanpassingen en stelt na akkoord het programma in productie. Nadien verzorg je de follow-up.

Je volgt voortdurend de ontwikkeling op het gebied van regelgeving op die binnen de KGV ge√Ømplementeerd moet worden en je analyseert de impact van deze wijzigingen in regelgeving op lopende projecten.
Je beheert individueel een breed scala aan projecten en bent specialist in je domein in samenwerking met de expert en co√∂rdinator van het team.
Je analyseert vragen en problemen , zoekt antwoorden en identificeert het onderliggend probleem met het oog op het implementeren van een oplossing op korte, middellange en lange termijn.
Je bent back-up voor je directe collega's in geval van afwezigheid (opvolging FMB‚Äôs, projectopvolging, deelname aan vergaderingen en feedback aan collega‚Äôs).
Waarom is deze job iets voor jou ?
Je bent in het bezit van een masterdiploma of gelijkwaardig door ervaring als Business & Data Analyst (minstens 3 jaar ervaring in de materie)
Je hebt een eerste relevante ervaring als Business & Data Analyst
Professionele ervaring binnen een verzekeringsinstelling (mutualiteit) of het domein gezondheidszorg is een plus.
Je kan vlot werken met de MS-Office toepassingen, voornamelijk met Word en Excel.

Een treinabonnement 1ste klas op het volledige Belgische netwerk.
HR Rail, een naamloze vennootschap van publiek recht, is de
HR-dienstverlener en juridische werkgever van alle medewerkers van de Belgische spoorwegen.

HR Rail is een samenwerkingsplek waar de klant altijd op de eerste plaats komt, waar we verantwoordelijkheid nemen en waar we bij elke procedure en elk project voortdurend de mogelijke effici√´ntie verbeteren. Dit zijn onze waarden en ons DNA, onze CORE: samenwerking, klantgerichtheid, verantwoordelijkheid en effici√´ntie.

Binnen HR Rail is de dienst Care4Rail verantwoordelijk voor het medisch-maatschappelijk beleid van de Belgische spoorwegen. Het omvat de Kas der geneeskundige verzorging (KGV), de verzekeringsinstelling van het statutaire personeel van de Belgische Spoorwegen, voor wat betreft de verplichte verzekering voor geneeskundige verzorging.
Het managementteam en het team voor project- en IT-management van de KGV zijn gevestigd in Brussel.

De regionale teams staan in voor het rechtstreeks contact met de aangeslotenen en zorgen voor de praktische uitvoering van de regelgeving rond geneeskundige verzorging, zoals het toekennen van rechten, terugbetalingen en toelatingen.
De facturatie en de contacten met zorgverleners worden centraal opgevolgd door een gespecialiseerd team in Brussel.
Jouw werkplek is gelegen vlakbij het station in Brussel (station Brussel-Zuid).

At RELYzIT Talent, we don‚Äôt recruit ‚Äî we build. We place elite engineers and product minds into mission-critical roles across Infrastructure, Security, Data, Applied AI, and Product Development ‚Äî in the EU and GCC. Every placement is tied to real outcomes, and every candidate is vetted through our AI-driven, multi-layered 7-Signals Talent Engine‚Ñ¢. When we back you, it‚Äôs with confidence ‚Äî and when you join, it‚Äôs with purpose. If you‚Äôre a builder, not a clock-puncher, you‚Äôre in the right place.


About the Role


We‚Äôre seeking a Senior Data Specialist (BI Consultant) to join our client‚Äôs high-impact team in Brussels on a freelance basis for a 7-month engagement. You‚Äôll be part of a tight-knit development team, driving the design, build, and optimization of data solutions that power business intelligence and real-world decision-making. This is a hybrid role, blending on-site collaboration with remote flexibility.


Why This Role Matters

Your work will directly shape how our client leverages data to deliver actionable insights and measurable outcomes. You‚Äôll architect and deliver robust data pipelines, ensure data quality, and enable the creation of performance indicators that drive strategic decisions. In this role, your expertise will help transform complex business needs into technical solutions that make a tangible impact.


What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Lead functional and technical analyses to capture and translate client needs into actionable data solutions
  • Design and document technical architectures for data valorization and analytics
  • Develop, maintain, and optimize secure data pipelines and data warehouse solutions
  • Connect to diverse data sources, transform and enrich data, and deliver ready-to-use datasets for dashboards and KPIs
  • Guarantee compliance and quality of all developments, ensuring robust documentation at every step
  • Execute database queries, perform data profiling, filtering, and critical assessments to identify and resolve issues
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate heterogeneous systems into a unified data architecture
  • Continuously expand business intelligence knowledge to refine processes and improve operations
  • Support and maintain data analytics platforms, ensuring reliability and scalability in production environments


What We‚Äôre Looking For

  • Proven experience as a Senior BI Analyst or Data Specialist within the last 1‚Äì3 years
  • Builder mindset: you take ownership, solve problems, and deliver impact
  • Ability to translate business requirements into technical specifications and actionable solutions
  • Strong documentation skills and attention to detail
  • Experience in the public sector is a plus
  • Comfortable working in a hybrid (on-site/remote) environment in Brussels


Technical Skills

  • Azure Data Factory (Advanced)
  • Azure DevOps (Advanced)
  • Business Intelligence (Advanced)
  • Datalake (Advanced)
  • Datawarehouse (Advanced)
  • ETL (Expert)
  • GIT (Intermediate)
  • MySQL (Advanced)
  • Open API (Advanced)
  • Power BI (Intermediate)
  • Python (Advanced)


Language Proficiency

  • English: Full professional proficiency (required)
  • French: Native or bilingual proficiency (required)
  • Dutch: Nice to have


Other Requirements

  • Experience with documentation tools such as Confluence, SharePoint, or Notion
  • Proven ability to set up and maintain automated data pipelines
  • Strong understanding of data quality and data profiling concepts
  • Experience delivering datasets for dashboards or KPIs
  • Ability to integrate heterogeneous systems into data architectures
  • Familiarity with methodologies for ensuring data quality, testing, and validation

Je analyseert de businessbehoeften en vertaalt ze naar datagedreven oplossingen.
Je verzamelt, verwerkt en optimaliseert data uit verschillende bronnen.

Minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Power BI Developer of vergelijkbaar.

Je beheerst SQL, DAX en Power BI tot in de puntjes.

Je weet hoe je complexe data omzet naar heldere visualisaties.
Ervaring hebt met Azure Synapse, Data Factory of Databricks.
Comfortabel bent met verschillende soorten datastorage.
Zowel in het Nederlands als Engels vlot communiceert.

Je wordt een sleutelfiguur in het realiseren van end-to-end data-oplossingen:

column4:

4281601697,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analist-at-rode-kruis-vlaanderen-4281601697?position=44&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=vF8ErSgofpbyFmVIMUPxkw%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analist,Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen,"Mechelen, Flemish Region, Belgium","Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen is d√© werkgever voor gemotiveerde kandidaten die alles uit hun job willen halen met het oog op een bloeiende carri√®re. Van jobs in verpleegkunde en labo's, sociale hulpverlening, IT- HR- en managementfuncties, help ons helpen en maak er je job van!

Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen zorgt ervoor dat ziekenhuizen in Vlaanderen altijd beschikken over voldoende veilig en kwalitatief bloed. Een belangrijke opdracht waarin we elke dag slagen dankzij de enthousiaste inzet van talloze medewerkers.

Onze humanitaire diensten zijn dan weer actief in binnen- en buitenland. Samen met onze vrijwilligers staan we in voor de meest diverse opdrachten: jeugdwerking, preventie, hulp bij rampen en events, sociale hulpverlening, internationale hulp, opvang van verzoekers om internationale bescherming, eerstehulpopleidingen, enzovoort.

Onze experts ICT, Finance, Aankoop, Logistiek, HR en Communicatie vind je in onze Centraal Ondersteunende Diensten. Zij zorgen er elke dag voor dat alle medewerkers, donoren en vrijwilligers hun missie kunnen opnemen: ‚Äòhelpen helpen'.

Als Business Intelligence Analist draag je je steentje bij in het optimaliseren van uiteenlopende activiteiten van onze organisatie (van preventieve eerste hulp tot voldoende veilig bloed). Omwille van deze uiteenlopende activiteiten beschikt Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen over een grote hoeveelheid aan data die heel divers is. Op basis van de noden van de business, zorg je er mee voor dat de juiste data beschikbaar zijn en gevisualiseerd kunnen worden om hen nieuwe inzichten te verschaffen.
Microsoft Azure als dataplatform. Een veelzijdige en complexe datapool als fundament voor analyses en data gedreven beslissingen.
Een positieve bijdrage leveren aan de maatschappij als grote doel.

Als Business Intelligence Analist breng je de noden in kaart, analyseer je de data en zet je deze op een creatieve manier om in systemen en tools die de operationele processen, risico's en strategie√´n visualiseren
Je gaat intern en extern proactief op zoek naar informatie en geeft de business nieuwe inzichten waarmee ze verder aan de slag kan gaan
Je weet de behoeften van business te vertalen naar betekenisvolle en overzichtelijke visualisaties en rapporteringsvormen en formuleert advies m.b.t. deze duidelijk interpreteerbare datavoorstelling
Je werkt nauw samen met andere technische analisten, ontwikkelaars, proces ingenieurs en dienstverantwoordelijken
Je formuleert verbetervoorstellen en onderhoudt en bewaakt de best practices m.b.t. het gebruik van de tools en rapportontwikkelingen
Je staat in voor de opleiding van anderen in deze rapporteringstools
Je communiceert op regelmatige basis met je interne klanten omtrent hun verwachtingen en gaat op zoek naar het juiste cijfermateriaal
Als data-expert adviseer je diensten en collega's in een veelzijdige werkomgeving.
Je werkt zowel voor de centrale diensten als voor de Humanitaire Diensten en de afdelingen die zich met Bloed bezighouden. Zo draag je bij aan de maatschappelijke missie van Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen.

Je hebt kennis van Business Intelligence tools en methodologie√´n en bovendien ben je sterk ge√Ønteresseerd in IT. Kennis van PowerBI en Microsoft Azure (Data Factory, Synapse) is vereist. SQL kennis en kennis van data modellering is wenselijk.
Je genoot een master opleiding of gelijkwaardig door ervaring
Je bent ge√Ønteresseerd in een (bio)medische context of humanitaire dienstverlening
Je beschikt over een aantal jaar relevante ervaring
Je bent sterk in het capteren van noden en het analyseren van data
Je hebt oog voor detail. Details kunnen in een wetenschappelijke omgeving immers van groot belang zijn
Je bent een sterke communicator, weet prioriteiten naar voren te brengen en anderen te overtuigen van je inzichten
Je hebt zin voor initiatief en je bent ondernemend.
Je wil je engageren voor een organisatie met maatschappelijke impact.

Je draait mee in een veelzijdige, boeiende organisatie met maatschappelijke meerwaarde waarbij jouw expertise er mee voor zorgt dat Rode Kruis-Vlaanderen die meerwaarde evidence-based en data-driven kan bieden
Een marktconform salaris in functie van je ervaring
On the job training en coaching is een continu proces. Er is blijvende ondersteuning van consultants om bij te leren
Een voltijdse functie met een contract van onbepaalde duur.

4275918889,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-data-analyst-at-avertim-4275918889?position=45&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=93akvanbtAECkZmL6p5sww%3D%3D,Senior Data Analyst,Avertim,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"Being an Avertimer means that you will act as a trusted partner to help our customers successfully achieve their transformation programs.

How? By translating their strategy into actionable projects and enable Business, Technology and Management alignment through Avertim‚Äôs three key service lines: increase performance, drive innovation and leverage compliance.
As a Senior Data Analyst, you will support one of our major clients in the context of various Business Intelligence initiatives. Your role will be to:
Analyze data using statistical and analytical techniques to generate insights and support data-driven decision-making.
Design and maintain sustainable, understandable, and usable data models.
Present insights clearly through data visualization and storytelling techniques.
Set up data modeling governance, including related processes and procedures.
As an Avertimer, you will get the opportunity to:
Develop yourself in a place where individuals and ideas matter.
Engage in a career path providing you with the ability to continuously enhance your skills and knowledge.
Immerse yourself into a vibrant, fast-growing team and nurturing work environment.
Be part of an experienced international community of Avertimers and enjoy a network of cross-industry expertise.
Keep on learning from your peers and develop your skills.
You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to understand and translate business needs into functional requirements.
You have proven experience in functional analysis, requirements gathering, process modeling, or solution design.
You are comfortable acting as a bridge between business stakeholders and technical teams.
You are structured, detail-oriented, and focused on delivering value.
You have at least 3 years of experience in a similar role, either in consulting or within an organization.
Power BI or equivalent visualization tools
MS SQL Server and/or MS Fabric DWH
Governance and process setup for data modeling
You are familiar with modeling and documentation tools (UML, BPMN, Visio, Sparx, ARIS‚Ä¶).
You have knowledge of project management methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Prince2, PMI‚Ä¶) and related tools (Jira, Confluence, Bizagi‚Ä¶).
You have an interest in or experience with the energy, transport, or public services sectors.
You are passionate about digital transformation, process optimization, and business innovation.

Avertim is a uniquely positioned Management Consulting Group that bridges the gap between Strategy and Operations. Our mission is to translate the strategy of our clients into actionable projects and enable the alignment between Business, Technology and Management.

Founded in 2007, and headquartered on Brussels‚Äô famous Louise Avenue, Avertim has grown into a European consultancy group with more than 350 consultants and offices in Belgium, France, Germany, and the Netherlands.

To accelerate the growth of our consulting activities in the Belgian market, we are currently looking for Senior Consultants able to support the development of Avertim‚Äôs consulting activities in the Energy & Transport sector.

We take pride in holding the EcoVadis Platinium certification, a testament to our commitment to sustainable and ethical business practices. This commitment extends to every individual within our organization, and we encourage all our stakeholders to contribute to our collective efforts behind our 3 causes: health, education and environment
Besides our vibrant work environment, we offer a competitive compensation package including:
20 + 9 days of paid holidays + possibility to buy 5 additional days via the cafetarian plan
Company car or green mobility package
Full hospitalization insurance and extensive group insurance package
Have a look at our Life Page to get to know us more!

At Avertim, we value talent and mindset. No difference will be made during the recruitment process and applicants will receive consideration for employment whatever their gender, marital status, religion, age, color, sexual orientation, nationality or disability, ‚Ä¶
For more information, visit Avertim's official website.

Being an Avertimer means that you will act as a trusted partner to help our customers successfully achieve their transformation programs.


How? By translating their strategy into actionable projects and enable Business, Technology and Management alignment through Avertim‚Äôs three key service lines: increase performance, drive innovation and leverage compliance.



Your Job


As a Senior Data Analyst, you will support one of our major clients in the context of various Business Intelligence initiatives. Your role will be to:

  • Analyze data using statistical and analytical techniques to generate insights and support data-driven decision-making.
  • Design and maintain sustainable, understandable, and usable data models.
  • Present insights clearly through data visualization and storytelling techniques.
  • Set up data modeling governance, including related processes and procedures.


As an Avertimer, you will get the opportunity to:


  • Develop yourself in a place where individuals and ideas matter.
  • Engage in a career path providing you with the ability to continuously enhance your skills and knowledge.
  • Immerse yourself into a vibrant, fast-growing team and nurturing work environment.
  • Be part of an experienced international community of Avertimers and enjoy a network of cross-industry expertise.
  • Keep on learning from your peers and develop your skills.


Your Background


  • You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to understand and translate business needs into functional requirements.
  • You have proven experience in functional analysis, requirements gathering, process modeling, or solution design.
  • You are comfortable acting as a bridge between business stakeholders and technical teams.
  • You are structured, detail-oriented, and focused on delivering value.
  • You have at least 3 years of experience in a similar role, either in consulting or within an organization.
  • Power BI or equivalent visualization tools
  • MS SQL Server and/or MS Fabric DWH
  • SQL for data modeling purposes
  • Governance and process setup for data modeling


Nice to Have


  • You are familiar with modeling and documentation tools (UML, BPMN, Visio, Sparx, ARIS‚Ä¶).
  • You have knowledge of project management methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Prince2, PMI‚Ä¶) and related tools (Jira, Confluence, Bizagi‚Ä¶).
  • You have an interest in or experience with the energy, transport, or public services sectors.
  • You are passionate about digital transformation, process optimization, and business innovation.



About us


Avertim is a uniquely positioned Management Consulting Group that bridges the gap between Strategy and Operations. Our mission is to translate the strategy of our clients into actionable projects and enable the alignment between Business, Technology and Management.


Founded in 2007, and headquartered on Brussels‚Äô famous Louise Avenue, Avertim has grown into a European consultancy group with more than 350 consultants and offices in Belgium, France, Germany, and the Netherlands.


To accelerate the growth of our consulting activities in the Belgian market, we are currently looking for Senior Consultants able to support the development of Avertim‚Äôs consulting activities in the Energy &
column2:

In this role, you will be responsible of developing Data pipelines, use your ETL skills and make our clients data accessible and usable for analysts and scientists. You will be at the cornerstone of Data processes from large clients, helping them value tremendous amount of Data.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a great workplace.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

SII Belgium is seeking a proficient and ambitious Data Engineer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible of developing Data pipelines, use your ETL skills and make our clients data accessible and usable for analysts and scientists. You will be at the cornerstone of Data processes from large clients, helping them value tremendous amount of Data.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a great workplace.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Key Responsibilities:‚ÄØ

  • You are able to integrate new professional contexts rapidly, in order to apply your Data skills to any new sector
  • You identify improvements in existing Data models, ensuring an increase of useable Data in the Data Warehouse.
  • Maintaining close contact with your Team mates and stakeholders to ensure the compliance of the processes with the context's regulations.
  • You are capable of using Python extensively and you are able to propose innovative ways to upgrade the Data pipelines and ETL processes
  • You have already worked in Cloud-based environments (Azure, AWS, GCP...), automated processes for large-scale data models, model development, validation, and implementation.
  • You are an open-minded communicator, who do not hesitate to dig by yourself into the existing set-up, not fearing to ask questions and challenge the business stakeholders.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, information systems, business administration or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
  • 2 - 5 years of relevant experience
  • Knowledge of DevOps concepts, Cloud computing
  • Strong knowledge of Python, SQL and Excel.
  • Good Data modeling skills
  • Knowledge of database management
  • Good communication skills and able to adapt to different interlocutor
  • Attention to detail and organized
  • Fluent in English and Dutch or French

We offer:‚ÄØ

  • A challenging and varied role in a growing company‚ÄØ
  • Opportunity to work with the latest technologies‚ÄØ
  • Competitive salary and benefits‚ÄØ
  • Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through trainings and certifications
  • Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group

4280906612,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-consultant-in-data-science-at-sia-4280906612?position=51&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=1LpKGdC6p9GjzNRh7M8gxw%3D%3D,Senior Consultant in Data science,Sia,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We‚Äôre optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.

As a Senior consultant in Data Science, you will be involved in transformation projects at our clients. You will execute project assignments in modelling and digital transformation (business/IT analysis and partial coding) environments with a good deal of business perspectives:
Machine learning, AI and statistics: developing predictive models of decision making (supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, econometrics, forecasting, quantitative diagnosis,...)
Operational research : assistance in the design and implementation of constraint optimization solutions and simulation models
Big Data : Algorithmic knowledge for large and unstructured data processing
You will get the opportunity to actively contribute to Sia‚Äôs internal activities:
Development and reinforcement of our offer, by understanding and interpreting data science innovation and challenges
Business development, by contributing to need definition and participating in our commercial initiatives
As fast as possible, you will take up team leadership roles and connect with colleagues of all levels.
Equipped with the entrepreneurial fibre, you are ready to cooperate in a fast growing company.
An international company that gives importance to diversity, inclusion, employee well-being and corporate social responsibilities actions.
A great working atmosphere with friendly and professional colleagues where innovation and entrepreneurship are encouraged
A personal development plan with a regular follow-up as well training opportunities to develop yourself
A competitive salary with great advantages, like mobility budget, hospital insurance, performance -related bonus,...
University Master Civil Engineer (applied mathematics, IT or similar)
2 to 6 years‚Äô experience as a consultant
Outstanding team player with great interpersonal and communication skills
Strong interest in data science and related sectors such as Energy and Finance
Analytical mind, exploring options and able to synthesize into conclusions
Dynamic, result oriented, rigorous and committed
Prepared to participate in temporary assignments abroad
We are unable to provide a work permit for this position
Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We‚Äôre optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.



Job Description

As a Senior consultant in Data Science, you will be involved in transformation projects at our clients. You will execute project assignments in modelling and digital transformation (business/IT analysis and partial coding) environments with a good deal of business perspectives:

  • Machine learning, AI and statistics: developing predictive models of decision making (supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, econometrics, forecasting, quantitative diagnosis,...)
  • Operational research : assistance in the design and implementation of constraint optimization solutions and simulation models
  • Big Data : Algorithmic knowledge for large and unstructured data processing

You will get the opportunity to actively contribute to Sia‚Äôs internal activities:

  • Development and reinforcement of our offer, by understanding and interpreting data science innovation and challenges
  • Business development, by contributing to need definition and participating in our commercial initiatives

As fast as possible, you will take up team leadership roles and connect with colleagues of all levels.

Equipped with the entrepreneurial fibre, you are ready to cooperate in a fast growing company.



In return, you can expect:

  • An international company that gives importance to diversity, inclusion, employee well-being and corporate social responsibilities actions.
  • A great working atmosphere with friendly and professional colleagues where innovation and entrepreneurship are encouraged
  • A personal development plan with a regular follow-up as well training opportunities to develop yourself
  • A competitive salary with great advantages, like mobility budget, hospital insurance, performance -related bonus,...

Qualifications

  • University Master Civil Engineer (applied mathematics, IT or similar)
  • 2 to 6 years‚Äô experience as a consultant
  • Outstanding team player with great interpersonal and communication skills
  • Strong interest in data science and related sectors such as Energy and Finance
  • Analytical mind, exploring options and able to synthesize into conclusions
  • Dynamic, result oriented, rigorous and committed
  • Trilingual: French, Dutch and English
  • Prepared to participate in temporary assignments abroad

Additional Information

We are unable to provide a work permit for this position

Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

4285334237,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-consultant-data-expert-operational-excellence-at-resultance-4285334237?position=55&pageNum=0&refId=w5%2BORsf5zcmMUAQ4HDcTYg%3D%3D&trackingId=4jhVehUKkbJHzMqLZS6x3w%3D%3D,Senior Consultant Data Expert - Operational Excellence,Resultance,"Ottignies, Walloon Region, Belgium","WHAT DO TRANSFORMATION CONSULTANTS SPECIALIZED IN DATA REPORTING & VISUALIZATION DO @ RESULTANCE?

Our Senior Consultants are multi-faceted experts with strong analytical capabilities and a deep understanding of business operations. As specialists in Data Reporting & Visualization, they turn complex data into meaningful insights, enabling organizations to make data-driven decisions and optimize their performance. With expertise in data analysis data visualization tools like Power BI, they design and implement cutting-edge reporting solutions that enhance productivity and streamline decision-making.
EXCITING, RIGHT? :) AND MORE PRECISELY, THEY HELP ORGANIZATIONS LEVERAGE DATA TO DRIVE TRANSFORMATION THROUGH OPERATIONAL EXCELLENCE.
Collecting, analyzing, and transforming raw data into actionable insights => ANALYZE & INTERPRET
Designing and optimizing SQL queries to ensure efficient data extraction and processing => QUERY & OPTIMIZE
Creating compelling dashboards and visualizations with Power BI => VISUALIZE & ENGAGE
Identifying trends, patterns, and key performance indicators to drive strategic decisions => DISCOVER & STRATEGIZE
Presenting insights in a clear, compelling, and actionable way => SHOWCASE
Supporting teams in adopting data-driven methodologies to achieve sustainable results => COACH
Mentoring junior consultants and fostering a culture of analytical excellence => INSPIRE
Ensuring data accuracy, governance, and continuous improvement in reporting frameworks => IMPROVE & EVOLVE
Becoming a trusted advisor and go-to expert for data-driven transformation => BUILD TRUST
OK, AND HOW CAN YOU GET THERE?
You have a Master's degree in a relevant field such as Economics, Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science, Finance, or Business Analytics.
You speak both English and French! (Bonus points if you speak German too :)
Data analysis and business intelligence to drive operational excellence
SQL development for querying, processing, and optimizing large datasets
Power BI (or similar tools like Tableau) to create advanced dashboards and reports
Interpreting complex data and presenting insights in a clear, impactful way
Managing projects from inception to execution, ensuring data solutions drive real business value
Leading teams and collaborating with stakeholders to foster a data-driven culture

Je documenteert dataprocessen en draagt bij aan de continue verbetering ervan.
Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het onderhouden en uitvoeren van de geautomatiseerde processen die onze (Power BI) boordtabellen voeden en zorgt dat deze tools soepel en betrouwbaar werken.
Je onderhoudt SharePoint-sites die dienen als interne communicatieplatformen en visualisatietools voor boordtabellen.
Je hebt een bewezen ervaring in een functie als data-analist of data-engineer.

Je hebt een goed inzicht in de dataplatformen van de bank en een sterke kennis en praktische ervaring met datatools zoals: het Microsoft Power Platform: Power BI (gegevensmodellering, DAX, ontwikkeling van boordtabellen), Power Automate (workflowautomatisering), PowerApps (basic app-ontwikkeling en -ondersteuning)

column1: Ervaring met Python voor datatransformatie en -analyse is een sterke troef.
Je hebt een grondig inzicht in de principes voor de governance, kwaliteit en beveiliging van gegevens.
Je kunt het Engels mondeling en schriftelijk als werktaal gebruiken. Je beheerst minstens √©√©n landstaal (Nederlands of Frans) en hebt een praktische kennis van de andere.
Je hebt sterke probleemoplossende vaardigheden en oog voor detail.
Je bent in staat om autonoom te werken, prioriteiten te beheren en deadlines te respecteren.
Je hebt uitstekende organisatorische vaardigheden en kunt gelijktijdig aan verschillende onderwerpen werken.
Je draagt proactief en enthousiast bij als teamspeler met een professionele, resultaatgerichte en klantgerichte aanpak.
Je bent ondernemend en zoekt voortdurend naar verbetering.
Een contract van onbepaalde duur met een aantrekkelijk salarispakket.

Naast je loon en voordelen (maaltijdcheques, verzekeringen, vakantie) bieden wij flexibele loonopties, Zo kun je een deel van je salaris omzetten in gepersonaliseerde voordelen (telefoongebruik, IT-apparatuur, vervoer enz.).

Als bedrijf implementeren we concrete en duurzame oplossingen om onze ecologische voetafdruk te verkleinen. Zo besparen we op papier en hulpbronnen, recycleren we ons afval, moedigen we het gebruik van groen vervoer aan, werken we in gebouwen die zijn ontworpen en worden beheerd om onze impact te beperken enz.
We bieden een breed scala aan trainingen, workshops en webinars waaruit je kunt kiezen, afhankelijk van je beschikbaarheid, interesses en doelstellingen.

Bij BNP Paribas Fortis omringen we ons met getalenteerde mensen, ongeacht hun geslacht of genderidentiteit, leeftijd, afkomst, seksuele geaardheid, handicap enz. En om iedereen gelijke kansen te geven, los van hun persoonlijke of familiale verplichtingen, staan al onze voltijdse vacatures ook open voor kandidaten die 80% of 90% willen werken.

Als de functie gecategoriseerd is als bankdienstverlener (cfr. Wet van 22 april 2019 betreffende de invoering van een bankierseed en een tuchtrechtelijke regeling), moet je ons ook een 'attest van ontbreken van beroepsverbod' van de FSMA bezorgen waarin bevestigd wordt dat je niet beroepsmatig gediskwalificeerd bent.
Ben je klaar om deze kans te grijpen?
We maken een eerste selectie op basis van je cv en motivatiebrief. Je hoort van ons als jouw profiel aansluit bij de vacature.
Als deze vacature niet overeenkomt met jouw verwachtingen of profiel, deel ze dan gerust met anderen.

We're looking for an experienced and independent Data Architect or Data Modeler to execute a Proof of Concept (POC) project. This POC will focus on evaluating a schema change to a star or snowflake design for a specific data mart within our existing data warehouse. Beyond the POC, you'll also be expected to provide guidance for a future, broader migration of the entire data warehouse.
Perform the Proof of Concept (POC) for changing a specific data mart in our Data Warehouse to a star or snowflake schema.
Analyse the current data mart structure and identify requirements for the new schema design.
Design and develop star/snowflake scheme models suitable for the chosen data mart‚Äôs needs.
Implement the proposed schema design for the POC, including date modelling and data loading.
Define and execute test cases to evaluate the performance, scalability, and usability of the new schema for the data mart.
Provide architectural guidance and recommendations for a potential future migration of the entire data warehouse to a star/snowflake schema.
Document the POC process, findings, recommendations, and best practices.
Present POC results and recommendations to stakeholders.
Collaborate with existing data teams to ensure alignment and knowledge transfer.
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience in data warehousing, data modelling, and database design.
Proven experience designing and implementing star schema and/or snowflake schema in a data warehouse environment.
Strong understanding of dimensional modelling concepts, fact tables, and dimension tables.
Experience with data integration processes and tools.
Proficiency in SQL for complex data querying and manipulation.
Experience with a major cloud platform (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
Ability to work independently, manage a project end-to-end, and deliver clear results

Data Modeler

(4 months Project)


We're looking for an experienced and independent Data Architect or Data Modeler to execute a Proof of Concept (POC) project. This POC will focus on evaluating a schema change to a star or snowflake design for a specific data mart within our existing data warehouse. Beyond the POC, you'll also be expected to provide guidance for a future, broader migration of the entire data warehouse.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Perform the Proof of Concept (POC) for changing a specific data mart in our Data Warehouse to a star or snowflake schema.
  • Analyse the current data mart structure and identify requirements for the new schema design.
  • Design and develop star/snowflake scheme models suitable for the chosen data mart‚Äôs needs.
  • Implement the proposed schema design for the POC, including date modelling and data loading.
  • Define and execute test cases to evaluate the performance, scalability, and usability of the new schema for the data mart.
  • Provide architectural guidance and recommendations for a potential future migration of the entire data warehouse to a star/snowflake schema.
  • Document the POC process, findings, recommendations, and best practices.
  • Present POC results and recommendations to stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with existing data teams to ensure alignment and knowledge transfer.


Qualification &
column2:
Skills:


  • ‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience in data warehousing, data modelling, and database design.
  • Proven experience designing and implementing star schema and/or snowflake schema in a data warehouse environment.
  • Strong understanding of dimensional modelling concepts, fact tables, and dimension tables.
  • Experience with data integration processes and tools.
  • Proficiency in SQL for complex data querying and manipulation.
  • Experience with a major cloud platform (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
  • Ability to work independently, manage a project end-to-end, and deliver clear results

Business Elements is the Reply Group company specialized in Microsoft D365 and Power Platform and data&AI technologies. Business Elements helps customers accelerate business innovation by transforming data into high business value and by leading them in the digital business transformation. Our success is rooted in our thriving expert community that challenges our individual members as well as our customers, resulting in delivery of the best solution every time.

You'll become a product specialist, addressing CRM issues and customer concerns. With strong problem-solving skills, you'll navigate complex IT solutions and integration, bringing expertise and creativity to system design and prototype development.

  • Research customer issues that may be non-standard to offer solutions
  • Support design of conceptual architecture and technical solutions
  • Ensure project quality meets standards through critical metric identification and testing plan
  • Identify process gaps and work cross-functionally to formulate improvement plans

Following tasks will be performed by external service provider:
‚Ä¢ Creation and maintenance of Enterprise Data Warehouses (EDW) and complex Business Intelligence Solutions (Data Lakes / Data Lakehouses).
‚Ä¢ Designing architectures both on the cloud and on premises (whether hosting or cloud on-premises) or combination of both (hybrid).
‚Ä¢ Design a modern scalable data platform to replace a large legacy data system in a phased approach.
‚Ä¢ Align architectural decisions with data governance policies and the department‚Äôs vision on cloudification.
‚Ä¢ Design of data quality, audit and health monitoring processes.
‚Ä¢ Define best practices, standards, rules, policies, review processes. Ensure regulatory compliance.
‚Ä¢ Provide guidance and mentorship to data analysts, data engineers.
‚Ä¢ Facilitate change management by guiding colleagues and users through the migration process.
‚Ä¢ Document and maintain data architecture and data assets in detail.
‚Ä¢ Assistance with deployment and configuration of the system.
‚Ä¢ Participation in meetings with other project teams.
Master‚Äôs degree in a related field.
Following skills and knowledge are required for the performance of the above listed tasks:
‚Ä¢ Experience in migrating legacy data systems to a modern data platform.
‚Ä¢ Excellent knowledge of designing scalable and flexible modern data architectures.
‚Ä¢ Excellent knowledge of business intelligence reporting tools.
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of cloud data architecture principles.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of database systems, both relational (PostgreSQL, Oracle) and non-relational (Elasticsearch, MongoDB).
‚Ä¢ Experience with ETL/ELT processes, API integration, data ingestion and transformation tools (dbt, Spark, Talend, Fabric, SAP DS).
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in data pipeline orchestration tools (Airflow, Dagster).
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of data governance frameworks and tools (DataHub, Open Metadata, Atlas, Collibra), data quality management, data security, access control and regulatory compliance.
‚Ä¢ Experience with DevOps practices and tools related to data pipelines, including CI/CD for data infrastructure.
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills to articulate data architecture concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders.

• The consultant must be living in Belgium or willing to relocate.
  • Fluent English required.

‚Ä¢ Provide guidance and mentorship to data analysts, data engineers.

‚Ä¢ Document and maintain data architecture and data assets in detail.

‚Ä¢ Elaboration of test programs.

‚Ä¢ Assistance with deployment and configuration of the system.

‚Ä¢ Participation in meetings with other project teams.
column6: LEVEL OF EDUCATION
column7: Master‚Äôs degree in a related field.
column8: KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS
column9: Following skills and knowledge are required for the performance of the above listed tasks:
column10:
‚Ä¢ Experience in migrating legacy data systems to a modern data platform.

‚Ä¢ Excellent knowledge of designing scalable and flexible modern data architectures.

‚Ä¢ Excellent knowledge of business intelligence reporting tools.

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of cloud data architecture principles.

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of database systems, both relational (PostgreSQL, Oracle) and non-relational (Elasticsearch, MongoDB).

‚Ä¢ Experience with ETL/ELT processes, API integration, data ingestion and transformation tools (dbt, Spark, Talend, Fabric, SAP DS).

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in data pipeline orchestration tools (Airflow, Dagster).

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of data governance frameworks and tools (DataHub, Open Metadata, Atlas, Collibra), data quality management, data security, access control and regulatory compliance.

‚Ä¢ Experience with DevOps practices and tools related to data pipelines, including CI/CD for data infrastructure.

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills to articulate data architecture concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of modelling tools.

4280259986,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-energy-at-clearsource-4280259986?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=P6Ckt8k3KCW34p8w1Gb13A%3D%3D&trackingId=bIbVKUf0MUso4xnQqNK4gQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst Energy,ClearSource,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Freelance Data Analyst Energy
Hybrid Brussels, start asap, long term
Our client is looking for a Data Advisor with an Agile Mindset Service

Side-by-side with other Contingent Workers and internal staff, you will play a part in building a sustainable, green and reliable energy infrastructure that stimulates economic growth and reduces our ecological footprint.

Our client is moving towards Data-centricity, i.e. Data becomes a masterpiece in its strategy execution, and a Data-driven company. Our mission consists in facilitating and driving the entire organisation to leverage data as an enabler to achieve its targets:
Unlock transversal Data fit for purpose

One key role of a Data Advisor is to close the gap between Business and Data. Together with subject matter experts, you define and design solid foundations for the Data in terms of Metadata, Responsibilities and Discoverability to leverage the Data Platform.
As part of a product team, you will move rocks to improve Data Management practices and to ease them.
You contribute to improving the Data Governance methodology by providing feedback from the field.
You work with a Business Purpose, while breathing Data, Organisation & People, Processes, and Technology.
You understand and analyse the Business needs.
You are looking for solutions that can quickly bring benefits and keep an eye on more-long terms solutions to ensure sustainability on mid-terms.
You leverage advising and training (i.e. Data Owners, Data Stewards, Business and IT teams) by on-the-job coaching.

You continuously review and ensure transversality of the Business Glossary that defines the common and universal language within client, by formalising the Business definitions of data and their purpose.
You manage expectations from, and intensely collaborate and align with, multi-disciplinary stakeholders, departments and product teams.
You excel at bringing people with various backgrounds together to converge.
You are the ambassador of One Team for the Customer.
What you will NOT be doing
You shall not act from an Ivory Tower.
You shall not define Data Governance methodology but will influence its evolution by providing retrospective feedback from the field.
You don‚Äôt make decisions for the Business but rather advise them with careful logic or showing your reasoning.
You don‚Äôt manage the data community, nor engineering, nor development teams.
You don‚Äôt define the details of the solutions architecture, nor the technical architecture, nor will you implement technical solutions.
You are able to speak, read and write fluently English and French or Dutch.
You can demonstrate proven experience with similar projects, missions or employments, with an experience of minimum 4 years with:
Data Classification, Data Privacy, Data Security, CIA Measures ‚Äì Optional
If this sound like you, please send me your CV, day rate and availability to gregor@clearsource.eu

Freelance Data Analyst Energy

Hybrid Brussels, start asap, long term


Context

Our client is looking for a Data Advisor with an Agile Mindset Service

Side-by-side with other Contingent Workers and internal staff, you will play a part in building a sustainable, green and reliable energy infrastructure that stimulates economic growth and reduces our ecological footprint.


Service description

Our client is moving towards Data-centricity, i.e. Data becomes a masterpiece in its strategy execution, and a Data-driven company. Our mission consists in facilitating and driving the entire organisation to leverage data as an enabler to achieve its targets:

  1. Creating business value through Data
  2. Think Data intuitively
  3. Unlock transversal Data fit for purpose

One key role of a Data Advisor is to close the gap between Business and Data. Together with subject matter experts, you define and design solid foundations for the Data in terms of Metadata, Responsibilities and Discoverability to leverage the Data Platform.

As part of a product team, you will move rocks to improve Data Management practices and to ease them.


What you will be doing

  • You contribute to improving the Data Governance methodology by providing feedback from the field.
  • You work with a Business Purpose, while breathing Data, Organisation &
column2:
People, Processes, and Technology.
  • You understand and analyse the Business needs.
  • You are looking for solutions that can quickly bring benefits and keep an eye on more-long terms solutions to ensure sustainability on mid-terms.
  • You leverage advising and training (i.e. Data Owners, Data Stewards, Business and IT teams) by on-the-job coaching.
  • You continuously review and ensure transversality of the Business Glossary that defines the common and universal language within client, by formalising the Business definitions of data and their purpose.
  • You manage expectations from, and intensely collaborate and align with, multi-disciplinary stakeholders, departments and product teams.
  • You excel at bringing people with various backgrounds together to converge.
  • You are the ambassador of One Team for the Customer.
  • You always generate business value.


    • What you will NOT be doing

    • You shall not act from an Ivory Tower.
    • You shall not define Data Governance methodology but will influence its evolution by providing retrospective feedback from the field.
    • You don‚Äôt make decisions for the Business but rather advise them with careful logic or showing your reasoning.
    • You don‚Äôt manage the data community, nor engineering, nor development teams.
    • You don‚Äôt define the details of the solutions architecture, nor the technical architecture, nor will you implement technical solutions.
    • You don‚Äôt develop systems.


    Requirements

    • You are able to speak, read and write fluently English and French or Dutch.


    Technical Skills (required)

    You can demonstrate proven experience with similar projects, missions or employments, with an experience of minimum 4 years with:

    • Data Governance ‚Äì Mandatory
    • Data Quality Management ‚Äì Mandatory
    • Metadata Management ‚Äì Mandatory
    • Master Data Management ‚Äì Mandatory
    • Data Classification, Data Privacy, Data Security, CIA Measures ‚Äì Optional
    • Business Intelligence &
column3:
Analytics ‚Äì Optional
  • Big data ‚Äì Optional
  • Data Modeling ‚Äì Optional
  • Data Integration &
column4:
API ‚Äì Optional


If this sound like you, please send me your CV, day rate and availability to gregor@clearsource.eu

4280020052,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/job-system-engineer-brussels-at-dkv-belgium-4280020052?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=P6Ckt8k3KCW34p8w1Gb13A%3D%3D&trackingId=xzXdOxctWapz%2BwNYBTNuQQ%3D%3D,Job | System engineer | Brussels,DKV Belgium,"Uccle, Brussels Region, Belgium","Looking for a new challenge in IT? Look no further, we have just the job for you.

DKV Belgium, a loyal partner in insurance, but there‚Äôs more that meets the eye ‚Äîwe‚Äôre a dynamic team of around 500 engaged colleagues driving digital transformation. As part of the international Munich Re Group, we proudly lead private health insurance in Belgium, supporting our clients during good and difficult times. You will arrive in an environment where everybody is able to be who they are, where you can get the most of yourself day in day out, with the support of your colleagues.
Together, we put our values success, diversity, collegiality, and development into practice every day to strengthen the trust of our two million clients.
Sounds like a plan? Continue reading!
What The Key Tasks Will Look Like

As a System Engineer, you are the backbone of IT operations. You‚Äôll ensure seamless service delivery, provide expert support to users, and proactively maintain high system availability. Your role spans managing and optimizing infrastructure, leading technical projects, safeguarding system security, and ensuring business continuity. You‚Äôll also oversee production releases, maintain clear documentation, and administer databases‚Äîall while being a trusted escalation point and a key player in daily operational readiness

You guarantee the availability of the systems and networks, and the continuity of the associated IT equipment so the end users can always do their work professionally. More concretely, your tasks will be the following:
You are the first line of defense when network or system issues arise. Your responsibility will be to:
Provide expert support to users, analyze their questions, and recommend effective solutions.
Guide and inform users to ensure smooth and confident system usage.
Proactively identify and resolve issues to maintain optimal system availability.
Act as the escalation point for the service desk, ensuring swift and effective resolution of complex problems.
You will take charge of the network and system infrastructure, ensuring it runs smoothly and evolves with the organization‚Äôs needs. In this role, you will:
Manage daily operations, maintenance, and monitoring of infrastructure.
Evaluate, adapt, and document systems to support continuous improvement.
Implement updates, patches, and enhancements provided by vendors.
Analyze usage and requests to ensure the infrastructure is properly sized and scalable.
Your role will be pivotal in driving infrastructure projects and maintaining business resilience. You will:
Collaborate on and implement new infrastructure and services.
Lead initiatives to introduce and evaluate new systems and networks.
Ensure robust security across systems and networks, including firewalls and OS-level protections.
Plan and execute the Disaster Recovery Plan (DRP) to guarantee business continuity.
Participate in on-call and shift rotations to ensure coverage and readiness, including daily ""Start Of Day"" checks.
You will ensure that systems are well-documented, releases are smooth, and databases are well-managed. Your responsibilities include:
Executing production releases in strict alignment with organizational processes and approvals.
Maintaining clear, up-to-date documentation of infrastructure configurations in collaboration with the system architect.
Administering databases across production, testing, and development environments.
Bachelor or Master degree in Computer Science or equivalent by experience.
Some years of experience as System Engineer are recommended.
strong focus on MS Azure with experience of Terraform
Symantec Enterprise Vault and Endpoint Protection
VoIP Mitel products, softphone, xPhone Fax
Knowledge of Linux (Red Hat or other distribution)
Knowledge of AS400, SQL, Dell ECS is an asset.
Affinity with containers, Kubernetes, networking, security.
You‚Äôre a quick and eager learner, ready to dive into new challenges and technologies.
You communicate with confidence and clarity, especially in spoken interactions.
You know how to ask the right questions to get to the heart of any issue.
Your analytical mindset and active listening skills help you understand complex situations and find smart solutions.
At DKV we offer you a varied job with growth opportunities (thanks to trainings, coaching, growth projects and internal mobility) and all this at a prime location in the heart of Brussels.
Besides a competitive gross salary, we offer an extensive standard package of extra-legal benefits such as:
insurance package (hospitalization, ambulatory insurance, guaranteed income insurance, pension plan)
a year-end premium, collective company premium

Moreover, you can count on an attractive leave scheme (up to 31 days), flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home up to three days a week. This way of hybrid working guarantees you a good balance between work and your private life.

We are an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs. If you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can make any reasonable adjustments needed to support you through your recruitment journey.

Moreover, you can count on an attractive leave scheme (up to 31 days), flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home up to three days a week. This way of hybrid working guarantees you a good balance between work and your private life.

4282222046,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/deputy-director-council-secretariat-at-nato-4282222046?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=P6Ckt8k3KCW34p8w1Gb13A%3D%3D&trackingId=%2BG%2FMMiBx0uaUcauYsOs2Bw%3D%3D,"Deputy Director, Council Secretariat",NATO,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Primary Location

The publication of this call for interest is organised as a fast track competition open to candidates who already hold a valid NATO personnel security clearance or a valid personnel security clearance (PSC) at the appropriate level issued by the candidate‚Äôs parent National Security Authority (NSA) / Designated Security Authority (DSA) or anyother competent security authority: this may include NATO International Civilians, temporary staff, consultants, contractors, interns, Voluntary National Contributions (VNCs) and members of Allied National administrations.

NATO‚Äôs Council Secretariat bears overall responsibility for the end-to-end enablement of Alliance consultation and decision-making processes ‚Äì from planning and organisation to their effective and efficient implementation. It thereby provides organisational support and advice to the NATO Secretary General and the North Atlantic Council as well as to individual Allies and Partners. The Secretariat is structured in three sections: (i) Council, Committee and Conference Services
column2: (ii) Protocol and Events
column3: and (iii) Linguistic Services. The Secretariat also leads the NATO Summit and Ministerial Task Force. It is further responsible for all Protocol issues involving the Secretary General, the Deputy Secretary General and the Council.

column1: The incumbent serves as key advisor on management issues and Deputy to the Director of the Council Secretariat, assuming related management and coordination tasks in their absence. They assist the Director in the overall leadership, direction and management of the Secretariat, promoting operational excellence and the implementation of sound and inclusive management principles. They thereby help ensure the effective and efficient accomplishment of the Council Secretariat¬¥s mission, priorities and objectives, in line with overall Alliance objectives. They identify, plan and implement initiatives and business processes aimed at improving efficiency and proficiency across all sections.

They are responsible to the Director for overseeing the efficient management of the Secretariat¬¥s resources, including budgetary and human resources as well as information and communication technology. They will thereby put a premium on innovation and early adoption of technology, in support of enhanced business processes, working methods and IKM, and lead on related change management. Within their area of responsibility, they will represent the Director in relevant corporate initiatives and projects. They will also be in charge of ensuring that the Secretariat responds to all administrative and due diligence requirements in terms of reporting and auditing in a timely manner. They will oversee and organise the work of the Council Secretariat¬¥s Front Office and act as their line manager.

The publication of this call for interest is organised as a fast track competition open to candidates who already hold a valid NATO personnel security clearance or a valid personnel security clearance (PSC) at the appropriate level issued by the candidate‚Äôs parent National Security Authority (NSA) / Designated Security Authority (DSA) or anyother competent security authority: this may include NATO International Civilians, temporary staff, consultants, contractors, interns, Voluntary National Contributions (VNCs) and members of Allied National administrations.

  • SUMMARY


NATO‚Äôs Council Secretariat bears overall responsibility for the end-to-end enablement of Alliance consultation and decision-making processes ‚Äì from planning and organisation to their effective and efficient implementation. It thereby provides organisational support and advice to the NATO Secretary General and the North Atlantic Council as well as to individual Allies and Partners. The Secretariat is structured in three sections: (i) Council, Committee and Conference Services
column2: (ii) Protocol and Events
column3:
and (iii) Linguistic Services. The Secretariat also leads the NATO Summit and Ministerial Task Force. It is further responsible for all Protocol issues involving the Secretary General, the Deputy Secretary General and the Council.

The incumbent serves as key advisor on management issues and Deputy to the Director of the Council Secretariat, assuming related management and coordination tasks in their absence. They assist the Director in the overall leadership, direction and management of the Secretariat, promoting operational excellence and the implementation of sound and inclusive management principles. They thereby help ensure the effective and efficient accomplishment of the Council Secretariat¬¥s mission, priorities and objectives, in line with overall Alliance objectives. They identify, plan and implement initiatives and business processes aimed at improving efficiency and proficiency across all sections.

They are responsible to the Director for overseeing the efficient management of the Secretariat¬¥s resources, including budgetary and human resources as well as information and communication technology. They will thereby put a premium on innovation and early adoption of technology, in support of enhanced business processes, working methods and IKM, and lead on related change management. Within their area of responsibility, they will represent the Director in relevant corporate initiatives and projects. They will also be in charge of ensuring that the Secretariat responds to all administrative and due diligence requirements in terms of reporting and auditing in a timely manner. They will oversee and organise the work of the Council Secretariat¬¥s Front Office and act as their line manager.

Our client is looking to hire a Business Intelligence Engineer to join a specialized team developing a national-scale application to monitor and detect fraudulent companies. Building on an established proof of concept, the project now has a solid architecture, integrated data sources, and initial dashboards in place. The goal is to deliver actionable insights to end users while ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.

You‚Äôll work closely with a data engineer, Python developer, and BI architect to deliver high-quality, user-friendly data solutions that empower non-technical users and other development teams.

What You‚Äôll Do

  • Deliver relevant data from the data warehouse to end-user interfaces (Power BI dashboards, custom-built applications).
  • Collaborate with the team to define product requirements and maximize value for end users.
  • Build and improve reports and dashboards, including complex calculations and data structures.
  • Automate data delivery and refresh processes.
  • Ensure solutions are maintainable, structured, and adaptable for local configuration (templates, parameters).
  • Make data solutions intuitive for non-technical users.
  • Use APIs to deliver data to applications or other teams.
  • Explore opportunities for new use cases with existing data sources.

What are we looking for?

Confirmed experience with:

  • Power BI ‚Äì dashboard/report development and optimization.
  • Relational databases (Postgres) ‚Äì querying, modeling, performance tuning.
  • APIs ‚Äì integration and data delivery.
  • JavaScript (Vue.js preferred) ‚Äì building or enhancing front-end applications.
  • dbt ‚Äì data transformation in the warehouse.
  • GIT ‚Äì version control and collaborative workflows.
  • Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable visualizations.
  • Experience in BI projects involving legal and compliance constraints is a plus

Langauges

English: Active working proficiency.

Dutch: Passive knowledge.

French: Passive knowledge.

What do we offer?

Location: Brussels (on-site)

Contract: Freelance or Perm

Are you looking for a new opportunity in a fast moving & dynamic environment within a great company such as Danone? Do you get energized by finding the perfect next career step for our (future) colleagues?
Well, then you may just have found your dream job! Hungry to apply? Don‚Äôt hesitate and submit your application today so we can get in touch.

Are you at the beginning of your finance career? Would you like to kick it off within an international FMCG company with opportunities to grow further? Here is your chance! Join us as Operations Controller (V.I.E) in Belgium and learn a multicultural environment.

We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented‚ÄØJunior Financial Analyst‚ÄØto join our dynamic Finance operations team supporting the‚ÄØPlant-Based and First Diet categories. Based in‚ÄØBrussels, you will play a key role in supporting financial planning, analysis, and reporting activities, helping to drive operational efficiency and cost transparency across the factory.
Assist in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports
Support the budgeting and forecasting processes by gathering data, analyzing trends, and preparing financial models
Perform variance analysis between actuals, forecasts, and budgets, and provide insights to management
Collaborate with various departments to collect and validate financial data
Maintain and improve financial dashboards and reporting tools
Help ensure compliance with internal controls and financial policies
Participate in ad hoc financial analysis and projects as needed
To be able to achieve the above, you have a relevant master‚Äôs Degree (business management, finance or engineering).

You speak English and have good communication skills with the power to collaborate efficiently with all functions, at all levels both internally and externally. We believe our ideal candidate also needs to be rigorous, independent and autonomous, have an analytical and critical mindset.
Finance degree, Accounting, Economics, or a related field
