Speaks English, French & Dutch is a plus
Are you eligible for a V.I.E?
V.I.E is a type of contract linked to Business France (French public organism) allowing Europeans to work internationally for a designated company. This is a 6 to 24 months contract.
You must be aged 18 to 28. You must have completed national service obligation.
You must be a citizen of the European Economic Area.
You must have never worked in the country in which you wish to do your V.I.E.
You have never done a V.I.E before.
What are the contractual advantages of the V.I.E ?
There are no taxes and charges on salary, as a V.I.E your social security is covered by April international.
You will be granted with 2,5 days off per month.
Your gratification is fixed according to the Business France grid.
The cost of your back-and-forth flight or train tickets is covered.

Danone‚Äôs mission is bringing health through food to as many people as possible and we want to invite people to join the movement for a healthier world. We recognize the power people have to impact the world through their daily choices. Healthy food needs a healthy planet, and this is what our new signature One Planet One Health embodies.

In the heart of our dairy factory of Belgium (Rotselaar), you will work closely with diverse stakeholders, such as financial (operations, industrial and material controllers) and operations departments (activity, planning, master data and project managers) as well as other European countries (purchasing, marketing and transfer price controllers and EU Operation finance teams). This international environment is a great opportunity to start your career in finance.
But more importantly ‚Äì growth opportunities for next steps in finance environment or towards a next role in other departments closely related to this function.

An amazing office within a coworking community (Escaut) featuring a bar for after-work drinks, a ping-pong table, table football and darts. Our cozy seating areas with comfortable sofas provide you a great place to work together or unwind.

We zijn een Belgische pionier in Data & AI, al meer dan 35 jaar. Als trotse partner van zowel SAS als Microsoft (Data & AI Solutions Partner) en specialist in Data Governance bouwen we dagelijks mee aan de groei van data-gedreven organisaties.

Wat ons √©cht onderscheidt, zijn onze mensen. Bij LACO geloven we in mensen. In connectie. In de kracht van data. Met meer dan 120 consultants begeleiden we bedrijven uit zowel de publieke als private sector in het slim inzetten van data. We geloven in lange termijn relaties met klanten √©n collega‚Äôs en werken in een business domein dat de wind in de zeilen heeft.
Je wordt een sleutelfiguur in het realiseren van end-to-end data-oplossingen:
Je analyseert de businessbehoeften en vertaalt ze naar datagedreven oplossingen.
Je verzamelt, verwerkt en optimaliseert data uit verschillende bronnen.
Je bouwt visueel sterke en functionele dashboards in Power BI die bedrijven √©cht vooruithelpen.
Je werkt nauw samen met stakeholders en collega‚Äôs uit verschillende disciplines.
Je lost data-uitdagingen op en zet complexe datasets om in heldere inzichten.
Je blijft up-to-date met de nieuwste features binnen Power BI & Microsoft Fabric.
Je hebt een bachelor of master in (toegepaste) informatica of een gelijkaardig domein.
Minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Power BI Developer of vergelijkbaar.
Je denkt analytisch, werkt oplossingsgericht en bent een teamspeler.
Je beheerst SQL, DAX en Power BI tot in de puntjes.
Je bent vertrouwd met datamodellering (Kimball, Dimensional Modeling, Data Vault).
Je weet hoe je complexe data omzet naar heldere visualisaties.
Ervaring hebt met Azure Synapse, Data Factory of Databricks.
Comfortabel bent met verschillende soorten datastorage.
Zowel in het Nederlands als Engels vlot communiceert.
Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met o.a. 32 vakantiedagen, bedrijfswagen, ‚Ä¶
Een persoonlijke opleidings- en groeitraject (met focus op certificeringen).
Flexibiliteit: of je nu als werknemer of freelancer werkt ‚Äî wij staan open voor beide.
Uitdagende projecten in een moderne Microsoft-omgeving.
Een warme bedrijfscultuur waar ook ruimte is voor fun: skitrips, familiedagen, sportactiviteiten, spelavonden ‚Ä¶
üì© Interesse of benieuwd naar meer info?
Solliciteer direct of stuur een berichtje ‚Äì ook als je gewoon vrijblijvend wil kennismaken.

Support our Commercial Finance Lead in building our regional data & analytics capabilities
Enable common Western Europe product hierarchy and product mix analysis standardization (60%)
Map local product hierarchies to WEBU hierarchy
Enable pricing strategy across Western Europe (20%)
Analyze Items by price ranges & gaps vs competition
Enable Franchisee data sharing (Sales Growth, brand Metrics, Operations metrics 20%)
Test Franchisee user accesses / Test brand & ops metrics
Power BI knowledge is a plus
Ability to connect with cross functional teams

From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin‚Äô good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can‚Äôt share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.

We‚Äôre part of Yum! Brands, Inc.‚Äîcollaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central & Eastern Europe and France. With more than 30 official languages in 150 different franchises, connecting with us is easier than ever. If you really want to do the math, we‚Äôve also got 2,200 restaurants in 40 countries. Either way, we keep it original.

For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow‚Äôs technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you‚Äôve ever tasted. We exist to feed people‚Äôs potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.

We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. At our Pan Europe Academy, we develop leadership and train all levels of restaurant and corporate employees. From Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to Individual Development Plans, we build meaningful careers that have real impact.
The bottom line? We bring it. Curious? We hope so.
Bring your spark, your spice and your original story. At KFC Pan Europe, we‚Äôre grounded in winning, celebrating, recognizing, welcoming and belonging. We've got a big table. You have a seat at it.

Support our Commercial Finance Lead in building our regional data &

  • Map local product hierarchies to WEBU hierarchy

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.
Data Processing and ETL Development ‚Äì Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
Analysis and Insights ‚Äì Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
Collaboration ‚Äì Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
Automation ‚Äì Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
Documentation and Reporting ‚Äì Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
Customer Support ‚Äì Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.
Technical Proficiency ‚Äì Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
Statistical and Analytical Skills ‚Äì Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
Data Engineering Exposure ‚Äì Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
GIS (Preferred but Not Required) ‚Äì Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
Communication ‚Äì Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Problem-Solving ‚Äì Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.
Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

Senior Data Analyst

Job Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Job Term: Full-Time

The Opportunity

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.



Roles and Responsibilities

  • Data Processing and ETL Development ‚Äì Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
  • Analysis and Insights ‚Äì Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
  • Collaboration ‚Äì Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
  • Automation ‚Äì Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
  • Documentation and Reporting ‚Äì Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
  • Customer Support ‚Äì Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.



Skills and Abilities

  • Technical Proficiency ‚Äì Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
  • Statistical and Analytical Skills ‚Äì Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
  • Data Engineering Exposure ‚Äì Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
  • GIS (Preferred but Not Required) ‚Äì Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
  • Communication ‚Äì Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Problem-Solving ‚Äì Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.

Qualifications

  • Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
  • Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
  • Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
  • Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
  • Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

‚óè Drive Data Equivalency: Design and execution of study migration checks to formally assess and ensure data and output equivalency between legacy platforms (HPC and MS Azure) and the novel data analysis environment (AWS based).

‚óè Validation & Quality Assurance: Meticulously check data for completeness and correctness post-migration, troubleshooting and resolving any discrepancies to maintain the highest standards of data quality.

‚óè Script Migration & Adaptation: Assist study team‚Äôs adaptation of existing Python scripts from legacy systems to the new AWS workspace, ensuring they are optimized for performance and reliability.

‚óè User Onboarding & Support: Develop and deliver comprehensive onboarding materials, documentation, and training sessions to empower the team. Provide ongoing expert support to facilitate a smooth adoption of the new platform.
‚óè Cloud Environment Management: Assist in the creation and configuration of cloud workspaces and analytical environments tailored to the needs of specific studies and analysis tasks.
‚óè Independent Problem Solving: Proactively identify potential issues, bottlenecks, or risks in the migration process and independently develop and implement effective solutions.

‚óè Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate closely with study stakeholders to align on migration priorities, provide progress updates, and ensure the new platform capabilities meet their research needs.

You are a detail-oriented and self-reliant individual with a strong sense of ownership. You thrive in a collaborative environment where your technical expertise can directly empower your peers and advance scientific goals. You are adept at working effectively in a hybrid and multi-cultural team environment.
‚óè University degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Bioinformatics, or a related quantitative field.
‚óè 3+ years of professional experience in a data analysis role, with a proven track record of working with sensor data.
‚óè Demonstrated, hands-on experience in performing data equivalency analysis and system-to-system data migration projects.
‚óè Strong proficiency in Python and its core data science libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, SciPy).
‚óè Solid understanding of and practical experience with cloud computing environments, preferably AWS.
‚óè Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently to troubleshoot complex technical and data-related issues.
‚óè Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to explain complex concepts to a diverse audience.
‚óè Experience with the R programming language.
‚óè Familiarity with working in a regulated (e.g., GxP) environment and handling clinical study data.
‚óè Experience in creating technical documentation, training materials, or user guides.

4274205626,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/intern-cocoa-sustainability-data-analyst-100%25-at-lindt-spr%C3%BCngli-4274205626?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=SrGxWWZCnAj0qQUwcWUcZg%3D%3D,Intern Cocoa Sustainability Data Analyst (100%),Lindt & Spr√ºngli,"Kilchberg, Zurich, Switzerland","You are passionate about data and sustainability, like project work and have good experience and knowledge working with big data sets, analytics, coding and statistics, but want to learn more about corporate sustainability and the world of cocoa? Then you may be interested in doing an one year internship at Lindt & Spr√ºngli in the Cocoa Sustainability Team.

Lindt & Spr√ºngli has been enchanting the world with chocolate for 180 years. The long-established Swiss company with its roots in Zurich is a global leader in the premium chocolate product sector. Lindt & Spr√ºngli produces quality chocolates today at its 12 factories in Europe and the USA. Its products are sold by 38 subsidiaries and branch offices in around 560 of its own stores as well as via a network of more than 100 independent distributors around the globe. In addition, Lindt & Spr√ºngli runs around 560 own shops. With around15,000 employees, the Lindt & Spr√ºngli Group reported sales of CHF 5.47 billion in 2024.

Our commitment to contributing to a more sustainable tomorrow is a key element driving the company‚Äôs actions and ambitions. For the responsible sourcing of its most important raw material cocoa, the company launched its own program in 2008: the Lindt & Spr√ºngli Farming Program.

Working at Lindt & Spr√ºngli headquarters offers flexible work set up with two days of home office per week. You will be working at our corporate offices in the beautiful Home of Chocolate building next to Lake Zurich in Kilchberg. You will have the opportunity to work in an enthusiastic small team and a welcoming work environment where you will be able to network and meet peers, including during our organized social events.

Reporting to the ‚ÄúMonitoring, Evaluation and Learning Lead‚Äù for Cocoa Sustainability and working together with a multi-disciplinary team of cocoa and sustainability experts, you will be a member of the Cocoa Sustainability Team at Lindt & Spr√ºngli's headquarters in Kilchberg. Amidst a changing regulatory environment, increasing sustainability requirements, and the need for data insights to guide decisions, you will have the opportunity to support sustainability work and gain experience at the heart of an internationally active, listed company and its premium chocolate brands. By supporting the dynamic cocoa team by analyzing monitoring and evaluation data from 7 cocoa sourcing regions to help steer decisions and by helping review carbon footprint data, you will gain hands-on and sought-after experience in the world of cocoa sustainability.
Maintain, quality check and further develop the Farming Program data bases
Support to review supplier reported raw datasets including geospatial data
Design and help roll out dashboards to display results for global Key Performance Indicators as well as thematic or origin specific KPIs
Run advanced statistical analysis on large data sets and present results for learning and continuous improvement purposes
Prepare forms and datasets for data collection
Compile and present reporting data for the annual sustainability statement
Support other external reporting tasks (benchmarking, surveys, membership reporting, etc)
Support to desktop review process for deforestation risk assessments
Support other tasks required by the cocoa team
Master‚Äôs degree graduate in science or engineering
Proficient knowledge and experience working with large datasets, advanced statistics, coding languages (python, R or similar) and creating dashboards (power BI)
Up to date knowledge of AI with experience of it‚Äôs application in data science
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Teams)
Experience with study design, data collection, analysis and presentation of results
Working knowledge of GIS and use of QGIS
Fluency in English required. Knowledge or additional languages of German or French a plus
First professional experience in corporate sustainability or related area preferred
An affinity for sustainability matters and desire to create positive change
Organized and ability to work independently, but as a strong team player
High standards of quality and organization

4275395130,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-%E2%80%93-bi-visualization-specialist-at-epam-systems-4275395130?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=IfSOA%2F%2BBhyDZHwMimhjt%2Bw%3D%3D,Data Analyst ‚Äì BI & Visualization Specialist,EPAM Systems,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","EPAM is looking for a Data Analyst to support the data analytics team of a prestigious client in the luxury sector.
Based in our Geneva office in a hybrid setup, this is your chance to make a meaningful impact in a forward-thinking environment.
Would you like to be a part of this ambitious and innovative project? We look forward to receiving your application.
Develop data products across one or more business domains, in alignment with team objectives
Continuously enhance these products to ensure a seamless user experience and maintain data accuracy and consistency with source systems
Define and validate data ingestion workflows for the company‚Äôs data warehouse and data lakes, ensuring reliability and alignment with business needs
Drive adoption of self-service BI tools by engaging the user community through effective communication, training sessions and ongoing support
Contribute to the design and upkeep of reporting solutions, with a strong focus on developing impactful data visualizations using Tableau
Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience with the Tableau suite, including Desktop, Server and Prep
Demonstrated advanced expertise in Tableau Desktop, particularly in environments integrating SAP BW and Snowflake as data sources
Excellent skills in data visualization, with a keen ability to translate complex data into clear, impactful insights
Strong knowledge of data modeling and data source development within BW data warehouses and/or Snowflake environments
Solid understanding of data processing techniques (extraction, transformation and loading), with hands-on experience using tools like Control-M and Dataiku
Strong interpersonal and time management skills, with the ability to effectively prioritize and deliver enhancements and new data products in a timely manner
Global business travel medical and accident insurance
Learning and development opportunities including in-house training and coaching, professional certifications, over 22,000 courses on LinkedIn Learning Solutions and much more
*All benefits and perks are subject to certain eligibility requirements
Please note that any offers will be subject to appropriate background checks
We do not accept CVs from recruiting or staffing agencies
For this position, we are able to consider applications from the following:
- Third-country nationals based in Switzerland with an appropriate work permit
- Displaced people from Ukraine who are currently in Switzerland and hold, or have already applied for, S permits

EPAM is looking for a Data Analyst to support the data analytics team of a prestigious client in the luxury sector.

Based in our Geneva office in a hybrid setup, this is your chance to make a meaningful impact in a forward-thinking environment.

Would you like to be a part of this ambitious and innovative project? We look forward to receiving your application.

Responsibilities


  • Develop data products across one or more business domains, in alignment with team objectives
  • Continuously enhance these products to ensure a seamless user experience and maintain data accuracy and consistency with source systems
  • Provide‚ÄØLevel 3 support‚ÄØfor these products
  • Define and validate data ingestion workflows for the company‚Äôs data warehouse and data lakes, ensuring reliability and alignment with business needs
  • Drive adoption of self-service BI tools by engaging the user community through effective communication, training sessions and ongoing support
  • Contribute to the design and upkeep of reporting solutions, with a strong focus on developing impactful data visualizations using Tableau


Requirements


  • Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience with the Tableau suite, including Desktop, Server and Prep
  • Demonstrated advanced expertise in Tableau Desktop, particularly in environments integrating SAP BW and Snowflake as data sources
  • Excellent skills in data visualization, with a keen ability to translate complex data into clear, impactful insights
  • Strong knowledge of data modeling and data source development within BW data warehouses and/or Snowflake environments
  • Solid understanding of data processing techniques (extraction, transformation and loading), with hands-on experience using tools like Control-M and Dataiku
  • Strong interpersonal and time management skills, with the ability to effectively prioritize and deliver enhancements and new data products in a timely manner
  • Fluent in French


We offer


  • 5 weeks of vacation
  • EPAM Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Extended pension plan
  • Daily sickness allowance insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Global business travel medical and accident insurance
  • Learning and development opportunities including in-house training and coaching, professional certifications, over 22,000 courses on LinkedIn Learning Solutions and much more
  • *All benefits and perks are subject to certain eligibility requirements
  • Please note that any offers will be subject to appropriate background checks
  • We do not accept CVs from recruiting or staffing agencies
  • For this position, we are able to consider applications from the following:
  • - Swiss nationals
  • - EU/EFTA nationals
  • - Third-country nationals based in Switzerland with an appropriate work permit
  • - Displaced people from Ukraine who are currently in Switzerland and hold, or have already applied for, S permits

4283021611,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-insights-analyst-intern-at-chanel-4283021611?position=7&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=UHilSHJw7rSbZFcSe%2ByIxA%3D%3D,Business insights analyst Intern,CHANEL,"Gen√®ve, Geneva, Switzerland","About Us:

CHANEL is a dynamic and innovative player in the travel retail industry, committed to delivering exceptional experiences for our global customers. As part of our continued growth, we are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Business Insights Analyst Intern to join our Global Travel Retail Team. This role presents an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our business through insightful data analysis and reporting.

As a Business Insights Analyst Intern with the Global Travel Retail Team at CHANEL, you will have a versatile role that contributes to both analytical tasks and the strategic communication of findings. You will be responsible for synthesizing business intelligence data, producing monthly reports, and providing actionable insights to drive strategic decision-making. You will play an important role in enhancing our existing data models, ensuring accuracy, and presenting information in a clear and concise manner. The ideal candidate is proficient in Excel and PowerPoint, possesses strong analytical skills, and is a collaborative team player.
Cultivate and maintain strong partnerships with travel retail data providers.
Ensure the integrity and reliability of data sources, fostering trust and transparency.
Review and validate data for accuracy, consistency, and completeness.
Diligently review data to extract meaningful insights and trends.
Act as a problem solver, proactively identifying areas for improvement and recommending data-driven changes to enhance CHANEL's global presence.
Stay abreast of industry trends and incorporate relevant insights into reports.
Communicate insights to our Travel Retail Teams, keeping CHANEL at the forefront of the industry.
Contribute to CHANEL's Monthly Reports, providing clarity and context to analyse data on the travel retail industry.
Curate industry articles to create monthly newsletter adapted to be shared with different teams.
Present information in a clear and concise manner with a keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity.
Utilize Excel, PowerPoint, and other tools to present data in a visually compelling and easy-to-understand format.
Ensure timely updates of the Power BI platform with the latest data for real-time insights.
Contribute to the improvement and expansion of existing data models.
Assist the Junior Business Intelligence Manager and the Strategic Projects & Insights Director in daily operations.
Work collaboratively with cross-functional team members to achieve common goals and objectives.
Work closely with CHANEL's Global Insight team to help to conduct surveys within airports worldwide.
Responsively address Ad hoc analysis requests and questions from CHANEL colleagues.
Ensure timely and accurate information is provided to guide decision-making.
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field. (e.g., Business Analytics, Marketing, Data Science).
Proven experience in data analysis or similar role, preferably in the travel retail and/or luxury industry.
Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI. Experience with Power Query is a plus.
Detail-oriented with the ability to simplify complex information.
Keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity, ensuring precision and visual harmony in all aspects of the role.
Proficient in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
An internship agreement is mandatory for this position and must meet the following conditions:
The internship must be part of your study program.
The internship must be required for the completion of your degree.
The internship must be validated by the award of academic credits.
Working days: 5 days a week, Monday to Friday
Join CHANEL's Global Travel Retail Team and contribute to shaping the future of travel retail through insightful data analysis and strategic collaboration !

Qim info is an IT services company based in Switzerland for more than 15 years.

Our agencies in Geneva, Lausanne, Basel and Zurich in Switzerland as well as Annecy in France, together already counts 473 consultants and we are always looking for new talents to join our growing and ambitious company.
At the end of 2021, Qim info obtained the Happy at Work¬Æ label !
And ranks 3rd in the ICTJournal ranking in 2022.

We are looking for a Data Analytics & Data Management Specialist to design and optimize SAP Analytics Cloud and Datasphere solutions, enabling advanced reporting, planning, and data integration across business processes.
Design and customize analytics applications using SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) for both reporting and planning purposes.
Develop scalable and efficient data models and business layers in SAP Datasphere, integrating data from SAP and non-SAP sources.
Configure and maintain spaces, data flows, consumption models, and semantic views within Datasphere.
Ensure data models are optimized for performance, scalability, integrity, and availability.
Build and enhance interactive dashboards, analytical stories, and self-service visualizations in SAC.
Improve and stabilize existing SAC Planning implementations, including FTE planning, budgeting, data actions, and predictive functions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and integrate SAC and Datasphere into end-to-end business processes.
Provide Level 2 and Level 3 technical support and guidance to internal teams and stakeholders.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a scientific field with a focus on data analysis and architecture, or equivalent professional experience.
Strong expertise in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) and SAP Datasphere.
Solid experience in data management, ETL processes, and data warehousing.
In-depth knowledge of SAC Planning processes, especially FTE planning and budgeting.
Proficiency in JavaScript or similar scripting languages.
Familiarity with non-SAP BI tools is a plus.
Demonstrated autonomy, proactivity, and a hands-on approach with a strong focus on delivery and problem-solving.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and across hierarchical levels.
Languages: Fluent in French and English

Based in Fribourg, our client supports other business units by providing them with technical and logistical equipment essential to their activities.

As part of an organizational transformation, our client is looking to strengthen its team by recruiting a product data management and administrative support associate. This person will play a key role in processing and monitoring product information, in coordination with the technical and IT teams.
‚Ä¢ Create, update, and maintain master data in the ERP (SAP), including items, inventory, suppliers, bills of materials, and locations.
‚Ä¢ Oversee the quality, consistency, and integrity of data throughout its lifecycle.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the Logistics, Maintenance, Production, and Plantation teams to ensure reliable information (locations, thresholds, reorder levels, units of measure, etc.).
‚Ä¢ Identify and correct naming, translation, coding, and duplicate entries in the existing database (approximately 60,000 items).
‚Ä¢ Participate in the redesign of the NIR (New Item Request) tool in collaboration with the IT and business teams, and in the definition of new procedures.
‚Ä¢ Define and document data management procedures in accordance with internal rules.
‚Ä¢ Define reporting and quality control tools (dashboards, audits, KPIs).
‚Ä¢ Work in pairs to monitor item statuses (obsolete, non-renewable, etc.) and ensure business continuity.
‚Ä¢ Provide support and coordination on data migration projects (SAGE), particularly during the mapping, cleaning, and inventory reliability phases.
‚Ä¢ Actively participate in improving Supply Chain processes by providing a reliable database for planning, purchasing, and operational decisions.
‚Ä¢ Train and raise awareness among internal users on best data management practices, particularly through the new NIR tool.
Education: Bachelor's degree in industrial management, data management, industrial IT, supply chain, CFC or equivalent training.
Experience: Minimum 3 years in an industrial environment with extensive exposure to inventory management and ERP issues.
Proficiency in ERP systems (SAP) and a good understanding of industrial processes are must-haves (procurement, production, maintenance).
Native French and English (C1 level required).
Knowledge of Power BI or other visualization tools is an asset
Commitment to quality and continuous improvement
Ability to work in a multidisciplinary team (production, logistics, IT).
Team spirit and a sense of teamwork.
Please send your CV and supporting documents in English.

About us:


Based in Fribourg, our client supports other business units by providing them with technical and logistical equipment essential to their activities.


As part of an organizational transformation, our client is looking to strengthen its team by recruiting a product data management and administrative support associate. This person will play a key role in processing and monitoring product information, in coordination with the technical and IT teams.


Your responsibilities:


‚Ä¢ Create, update, and maintain master data in the ERP (SAP), including items, inventory, suppliers, bills of materials, and locations.

‚Ä¢ Oversee the quality, consistency, and integrity of data throughout its lifecycle.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the Logistics, Maintenance, Production, and Plantation teams to ensure reliable information (locations, thresholds, reorder levels, units of measure, etc.).

‚Ä¢ Identify and correct naming, translation, coding, and duplicate entries in the existing database (approximately 60,000 items).

‚Ä¢ Participate in the redesign of the NIR (New Item Request) tool in collaboration with the IT and business teams, and in the definition of new procedures.

‚Ä¢ Define and document data management procedures in accordance with internal rules.

‚Ä¢ Define reporting and quality control tools (dashboards, audits, KPIs).

‚Ä¢ Work in pairs to monitor item statuses (obsolete, non-renewable, etc.) and ensure business continuity.

‚Ä¢ Provide support and coordination on data migration projects (SAGE), particularly during the mapping, cleaning, and inventory reliability phases.

‚Ä¢ Actively participate in improving Supply Chain processes by providing a reliable database for planning, purchasing, and operational decisions.

‚Ä¢ Train and raise awareness among internal users on best data management practices, particularly through the new NIR tool.


Your Profile:


Education: Bachelor's degree in industrial management, data management, industrial IT, supply chain, CFC or equivalent training.

Experience: Minimum 3 years in an industrial environment with extensive exposure to inventory management and ERP issues.


Skills and Knowledge:

Proficiency in ERP systems (SAP) and a good understanding of industrial processes are must-haves (procurement, production, maintenance).

Database knowledge a must (SQL)

Advanced Excel

Native French and English (C1 level required).

Knowledge of Power BI or other visualization tools is an asset


Soft Skills:

Administrative rigor and analytical mind

Commitment to quality and continuous improvement

Ability to work in a multidisciplinary team (production, logistics, IT).

Initiative and autonomy

Team spirit and a sense of teamwork.

Strength and resilience


Please send your CV and supporting documents in English.

4273270995,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-insights-intern-m-f-x-d-6-months-100%25-at-swiss-re-4273270995?position=12&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=BWDr2kLxQchHdrdD4e92Dg%3D%3D,"Data & Insights Intern (m/f/x/d, 6 months, 100%)",Swiss Re,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Are you passionate about transforming complex financial data into meaningful insights? Join our dynamic Life & Health Reinsurance Finance team where you'll develop valuable skills in data analysis, financial reporting, and business intelligence while making a real impact on global business decisions!

As a Data & Insights Intern, you'll be at the heart of our data-driven decision-making process, providing crucial transparency into our global Life & Health business operations through sophisticated data analysis and visualization.
Analyze IFRS data and contribute to building robust data pipelines that transform raw information into actionable insights
Develop deep understanding of Life & Health business operations and IFRS reporting methodologies affecting income statements and balance sheets
Process and interpret performance measures and technical aspects of risk selection under IFRS reporting frameworks
Transform complex data from multiple sources into compelling visual narratives that support executive decision-making
Create standardized visualizations that effectively communicate key data stories and business messages to senior leadership
Collaborate cross-functionally with Regional Finance and Actuarial teams across multiple countries
The position is located in Zurich and the start date would be September 15, 2025.

Within Reinsurance Finance, our Data & Insights team is responsible for comprehensive financial data analysis and the continuous enhancement of information-sharing tools for Life & Health Reinsurance worldwide. We leverage our extensive data resources and company network to provide senior management with critical insights into business performance, guiding them toward accurate and impactful decisions. Our team serves as a CFO function for both the Head of Life & Health Products and the Head of Life & Health Business Management. We maintain close collaboration with pricing and actuarial teams globally to ensure the highest quality of financial information and insights.

You're an analytical thinker with a passion for translating numbers into meaningful stories. You thrive in collaborative environments and are eager to apply your technical skills to real-world business challenges. Your curiosity drives you to explore new technologies and methodologies that can enhance data processing and visualization.
We Are Looking For Candidates Who Meet These Requirements
Completed bachelor or master degree in statistics, economics, finance, business administration, or natural sciences
Strong analytical skills with the ability to critically evaluate numbers and draw relevant conclusions
Proficient in MS Excel and programming languages such as PySpark, Python, R, or similar tools
Basic understanding of financial statements, particularly IFRS17 principles
Excellent communication skills with fluency in written and spoken English
These Are Additional Nice To Haves
Experience with cloud technology for developing data pipelines
Knowledge of data visualization tools and techniques
Previous internship experience in finance, data analysis, or related fields
We are looking forward to your application, including CV and cover letter!
The base salary range for this position will be shared with you during the interview process.

Swiss Re is one of the world‚Äôs leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. We cover both Property & Casualty and Life & Health. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.

Kontoor Brands, Inc. (KTB) is the parent company of Wrangler¬Æ, Lee¬Æ and Rock & Republic¬Æ, with owned manufacturing facilities in Mexico. Kontoor also owns and operates over 140 retail stores across the globe. Our global company employs more than 13,000 people in 65 countries, with world headquarters in Greensboro, North Carolina, and regional headquarters in Geneva and Hong Kong.

Join Kontoor Brands, home to iconic denim brands Wrangler¬Æ and Lee¬Æ. We design high-quality apparel that empowers self-expression. Be part of our global community of 17,000+ employees, fostering collaboration and innovation. Grow with us in our Geneva office and shape the future!

Reporting into the EMEA Merchandising Director, the Merchandising Data Analyst collects, processes, analyzes and interprets retail, wholesale and product data to support Merchandising decisions. The Analyst works closely with Merchandising and Planning Team to optimize product assortment, pricing strategies and buying decisions. The key responsibilities include generating reports, identifying trends and providing actionable insights.
Your Responsibilities As Our Merchandising Data Analyst
Collect data from multiple sources and combine it into consolidated reports that are easy to analyze.
Design and generate reports related to sell-through, total business performance, bestsellers, regional performance, and market trends.
Highlight any significant changes or deviations in performance and interpret potential impacts on product and retail strategy.
Work closely with product, retail, and merchandising teams to understand data needs, share insights, and provide recommendations for future strategies.
Track key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure merchandising and product strategies are on track.
Provide additional analysis and custom reports as requested by senior leadership or specific teams to help with decision-making.
A Bachelor‚Äôs degree and 3‚Äì5 years of experience in retail or merchandising analytics.
A strong understanding of product performance, retail dynamics, and merchandising strategy.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office, with solid experience in SQL, Power BI, or similar data tools.
Fluency in English, both written and verbal
column2: additional European languages are a plus.

4282245649,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-analyst-at-nicoll-curtin-4282245649?position=17&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=TRS7oZ7hw8b87EDskFZjvw%3D%3D,Quantitative Analyst,Nicoll Curtin,"Zurich, Switzerland","Are you an experienced Model Validation Specialist?
Do you enjoy working on Independent Model Validation within Model Risk Management?
Then the role of Model Validation Specialist might be a good fit for you!
Our client, operating in the Financial Services industry, is looking for an expert to support them in the space of Independent Model Validation for regulatory compliance.
As a Model Validation Specialist, you will provide expertise in the domain of US withholding tax regulation (Section 871(m)), equity derivatives modelling, and quantitative analysis.

Setting: As part of the team, you will be focused on delivering the highest quality validation work, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards, and producing clear, well-structured validation reports.
Focus: Independent validation of a model developed to determine the US withholding tax status of financial equity-linked instruments in line with Section 871(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.

Background: To succeed in this role, you will need prior experience in withholding tax regulations (US), equity derivatives product knowledge (including Greeks), and strong quantitative modelling skills.
Duration: This is an initial contract from 25.08.2025 to 31.10.2025 with the possibility of extension.
For more information on this Model Validation Specialist opportunity or any other similar roles I am currently working on, please send your CV to:

Are you an experienced Model Validation Specialist?


Do you enjoy working on Independent Model Validation within Model Risk Management?


Then the role of Model Validation Specialist might be a good fit for you!


Our client, operating in the Financial Services industry, is looking for an expert to support them in the space of Independent Model Validation for regulatory compliance.


As a Model Validation Specialist, you will provide expertise in the domain of US withholding tax regulation (Section 871(m)), equity derivatives modelling, and quantitative analysis.


Setting: As part of the team, you will be focused on delivering the highest quality validation work, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards, and producing clear, well-structured validation reports.


Focus: Independent validation of a model developed to determine the US withholding tax status of financial equity-linked instruments in line with Section 871(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.


Background: To succeed in this role, you will need prior experience in withholding tax regulations (US), equity derivatives product knowledge (including Greeks), and strong quantitative modelling skills.


Duration: This is an initial contract from 25.08.2025 to 31.10.2025 with the possibility of extension.


Workload: 80%


Location: Zurich.


For more information on this Model Validation Specialist opportunity or any other similar roles I am currently working on, please send your CV to:

4274327282,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/consultant-data-analysis-zurich-at-ey-4274327282?position=19&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=TALuVWI7g7OJ5BNUiSe%2BMA%3D%3D,Consultant Data Analysis - Zurich,EY,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders.
In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

The timely and relevant financial information provided by EY's Assurance teams is essential to global economic health and sustainable growth. Our work helps to restore and maintain public confidence in the world‚Äôs capital markets and ensure that the fundamentals are in place for businesses to move forward. Start your career in a practice rich in opportunity - the scale and scope of our clients‚Äô businesses add to the wealth of experience that a career in Assurance EY offers you.

The ADD Team within Assurance practice supports the audit all over Switzerland in data extraction and transformation for further analytics in order to build trust and to ensure clarity, transparency in the Digital Audit of the future.

As a DID Consultant, you will collaborate with our EY clients, senior data analysts, and auditors to enable a data-driven approach. You will oversee the end-to-end data delivery process, from gathering client data to preparing the necessary data analytics solutions for audit procedures.
Support the creation and delivery of key analytical solutions for Assurance teams.
Work with a robust set of tools and infrastructure to cleanse, store, and manipulate data, following industry standards for data security and privacy.
Apply problem-solving skills to address unexpected technical or operational challenges, including communication with Assurance teams and clients across Switzerland.
Conduct business validation and QA testing of audit analytics content and solutions.

You will join a dynamic, international, and multicultural environment, benefiting from a structured learning path focused on data science, accounting, and auditing. In addition to formal training, you will receive intensive on-the-job learning and coaching.
To qualify for the role you must have
A Master degree (or equivalent) in Business Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.
Solid experience with SQL, Python, Alteryx, or similar tools used for data extraction, transformation, and manipulation.
Ability to work independently, manage pressure effectively, and meet deadlines.
Excellent oral and written communication skills

Do you have challenging plans? Stick to them and realize your goals with us! Design your career with EY in a culture that promotes diversity and education. In an environment that constantly opens new doors through knowledge sharing, flexibility and recognition. We offer you to join our highly motivated team.

You will be working and learning in a highly dynamic and cross-functional team - being able to boost your learning curve through the combination of intensive teamwork, challenging projects and being part of the network of one of the world‚Äôs leading professional services firms.
We are looking forward to receiving your application.
Take the next step and apply for this position online.

EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders.

In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

The timely and relevant financial information provided by EY's Assurance teams is essential to global economic health and sustainable growth. Our work helps to restore and maintain public confidence in the world‚Äôs capital markets and ensure that the fundamentals are in place for businesses to move forward. Start your career in a practice rich in opportunity - the scale and scope of our clients‚Äô businesses add to the wealth of experience that a career in Assurance EY offers you.

The ADD Team within Assurance practice supports the audit all over Switzerland in data extraction and transformation for further analytics in order to build trust and to ensure clarity, transparency in the Digital Audit of the future.

As a DID Consultant, you will collaborate with our EY clients, senior data analysts, and auditors to enable a data-driven approach. You will oversee the end-to-end data delivery process, from gathering client data to preparing the necessary data analytics solutions for audit procedures.

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Support the creation and delivery of key analytical solutions for Assurance teams.
  • Work with a robust set of tools and infrastructure to cleanse, store, and manipulate data, following industry standards for data security and privacy.
  • Apply problem-solving skills to address unexpected technical or operational challenges, including communication with Assurance teams and clients across Switzerland.
  • Conduct business validation and QA testing of audit analytics content and solutions.

You will join a dynamic, international, and multicultural environment, benefiting from a structured learning path focused on data science, accounting, and auditing. In addition to formal training, you will receive intensive on-the-job learning and coaching.

To qualify for the role you must have

  • A Master degree (or equivalent) in Business Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • Solid experience with SQL, Python, Alteryx, or similar tools used for data extraction, transformation, and manipulation.
  • Ability to work independently, manage pressure effectively, and meet deadlines.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Proficiency in German and English.

More opportunities for your development

Do you have challenging plans? Stick to them and realize your goals with us! Design your career with EY in a culture that promotes diversity and education. In an environment that constantly opens new doors through knowledge sharing, flexibility and recognition. We offer you to join our highly motivated team.

You will be working and learning in a highly dynamic and cross-functional team - being able to boost your learning curve through the combination of intensive teamwork, challenging projects and being part of the network of one of the world‚Äôs leading professional services firms.

We are looking forward to receiving your application.

Take the next step and apply for this position online.

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika‚Äôs around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Sika is expanding rapidly, and our data requirements are growing just as fast. To meet these needs, we are shaping a global strategy for how Sika manages and leverages analytical data, and we are building a state-of-the-art cloud-based data analytics platform.

Join our Central Data & Analytics Team as a Data Engineer in Z√ºrich, where you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing innovative solutions for data engineering and analytics. In this position, you will directly influence the architecture and execution of our new global data analytics approach, helping to set the standard for how Sika utilizes data to drive business value.
What to expect in your first 6 Months
Get to know the existing data architecture, technology stack, and key data sources (e.g., SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others).
Deepen your understanding of our data mesh concept and its implementation.
Build relationships with our team, data domain specialists, and stakeholders.
Begin making initial platform improvements and laying the groundwork for scalable ETL/ELT pipelines
Design, build, and maintain production-grade ETL/ELT pipelines to load and transform data from enterprise systems (SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others) into structured formats.
Implement data transformation processes using tools like Azure Databricks, dbt and Azure Data Factory, ensuring alignment with business logic and analytics needs.
Establish automated data quality checks, consistency monitoring, and validation frameworks to ensure reliable data availability.
Collaborate with domain specialists to deliver data products for analytics and AI use cases.
Fine-tune pipelines and data models for performance (query optimization, partitioning) and cost-efficiency (autoscaling, storage tiering).
Develop reusable templates and documentation to enable domain teams to build their own ETL/ELT pipelines in alignment with global standards.
Contribute to strategic decisions about platform evolution, including evaluation of new tools and architectural patterns.
A degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, Data Science, or equivalent professional experience
column2: Relevant certifications on Data Engineering are a plus.

column1: Several years of experience in Data Engineering or relevant role.
Familiarity with domain-oriented data management approaches, such as Data Mesh.
Experience with Azure services such as Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Storage Account, Key Vault.
Coding experience with languages such as SQL, Python, PySpark, dbt
Experience working with code versioning tools such as Azure DevOps or GitHub.
Experienced with DevOps principles such as CI/CD pipelines and release processes

column2: proficiency in additional languages is a plus.

Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika‚Äôs around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

Sika is expanding rapidly, and our data requirements are growing just as fast. To meet these needs, we are shaping a global strategy for how Sika manages and leverages analytical data, and we are building a state-of-the-art cloud-based data analytics platform.

Join our Central Data &
column2:
Analytics Team as a Data Engineer in Z√ºrich, where you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing innovative solutions for data engineering and analytics. In this position, you will directly influence the architecture and execution of our new global data analytics approach, helping to set the standard for how Sika utilizes data to drive business value.

Month 1-2

What to expect in your first 6 Months

  • Get to know the existing data architecture, technology stack, and key data sources (e.g., SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others).
  • Deepen your understanding of our data mesh concept and its implementation.
  • Build relationships with our team, data domain specialists, and stakeholders.
  • Begin making initial platform improvements and laying the groundwork for scalable ETL/ELT pipelines

Month 3-4

  • Design, build, and maintain production-grade ETL/ELT pipelines to load and transform data from enterprise systems (SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others) into structured formats.
  • Implement data transformation processes using tools like Azure Databricks, dbt and Azure Data Factory, ensuring alignment with business logic and analytics needs.
  • Establish automated data quality checks, consistency monitoring, and validation frameworks to ensure reliable data availability.

Month 5-onwards

  • Collaborate with domain specialists to deliver data products for analytics and AI use cases.
  • Fine-tune pipelines and data models for performance (query optimization, partitioning) and cost-efficiency (autoscaling, storage tiering).
  • Develop reusable templates and documentation to enable domain teams to build their own ETL/ELT pipelines in alignment with global standards.
  • Contribute to strategic decisions about platform evolution, including evaluation of new tools and architectural patterns.

Qualifications

  • A degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, Data Science, or equivalent professional experience
column3:
Relevant certifications on Data Engineering are a plus.
  • Several years of experience in Data Engineering or relevant role.
  • Familiarity with domain-oriented data management approaches, such as Data Mesh.
  • Experience with Azure services such as Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Storage Account, Key Vault.
  • Coding experience with languages such as SQL, Python, PySpark, dbt
  • Experience working with code versioning tools such as Azure DevOps or GitHub.
  • Experienced with DevOps principles such as CI/CD pipelines and release processes
  • Fluency in English
column4:
proficiency in additional languages is a plus.

Additional Information

Within 30 years, ALTEN has become leader in both outsourced Engineering and IT Enterprise Services. ALTEN, composed of 54,000 employees (88% engineers), carries out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of 6,500 clients, the most prestigious companies in all sectors of industry, services and telecommunications. We work with key actors in the Aeronautics & Space, Defense & Naval, Security, Automotive, Rail, Energy, Life Sciences, Finance, Retail, Telecommunications and Services sectors.

Since 2005, with 450 current employees, ALTEN Switzerland is a reference partner in providing Engineering services to 100 world leading companies. ALTEN Switzerland‚Äôs activities cover all the main strategical areas of the Swiss market in Life Sciences, Engineering & IT Services.

Join ALTEN Switzerland as a Palantir Specialist and take on the challenge of designing, configuring and managing advanced data solutions using Palantir Foundry for a key client in the financial sector.
Configure and maintain Palantir platforms to meet evolving business needs

Strong skills in data engineering and data analysis
Familiarity with AI and machine learning is preferred

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance

Erfahrung mit Cloud-Technologien, idealerweise in mehr als einer Plattform (Azure, AWS, GCP, Cloudera) und sowohl On-Prem- als auch Cloud-Umgebungen
Starke analytische F√§higkeiten, Probleml√∂sungskompetenz und eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe

Bereitschaft, vor Ort beim Kunden zu arbeiten
Sehr gute Deutsch- (C2) und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Franz√∂sisch von Vorteil

4269393519,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-consultant-artificial-intelligence-data-data-management-data-platforms-focus-at-deloitte-4269393519?position=30&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=MkOL1hq4g1IBEcX3PZftkA%3D%3D,Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus),Deloitte,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Job Description
Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.
For this role, we are currently offering start dates from August 2025.
How You Can Make An Impact
Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.

Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.
Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.
Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.

column2: fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.

column1: First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data ‚Äì how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .
We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on ‚Äúapply now‚Äù to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.
If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch

We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria

4283963382,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/intern-applied-data-science-machine-learning-80-100%25-9-12-months-at-swissgrid-ag-4283963382?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=2a4DZZAvDWXMubi%2BCpWBsA%3D%3D,Intern Applied Data Science & Machine Learning (80-100%) - 9-12 Months,Swissgrid AG,"Aarau, Aargau, Switzerland","Electricity flows with us. On behalf of Switzerland and in cooperation with international partners, we do our utmost every day to develop the best solutions for the Swiss electricity grid.

Are you passionate about solving real-world problems with data and innovation? Curious about how data science powers the energy transition? Join our forward-thinking and collaborative Development & Optimization team as an intern, where your work will have a tangible impact on shaping the future of electrical grid operations.
Intern Applied Data Science & Machine Learning (80-100%) - 9-12 Months - 1389
Participate in the power supply in Switzerland

You‚Äôll dive into challenging and meaningful data science projects in a dynamic, cross-functional environment. You‚Äôll work with cutting-edge cloud technologies and a modern tech stack, experience agile teamwork, and gain hands-on exposure to Switzerland‚Äôs transmission system operation ‚Äì all while learning from and contributing to an interdisciplinary, supportive, and passionate team.
Get ready to roll up your sleeves and explore challenges like:
Building forecasting models that solve real-world problems in the energy sector with a focus on scalability, robustness, and real-world application.
Building data pipelines that efficiently handle large-scale, time-series data to support reliable and scalable model development and deployment.
Exploring and analyzing data to uncover valuable insights, engineer suitable features, and improve forecasting accuracy.
Experimenting with different techniques to optimize performance - from hyperparameter tuning to innovative algorithmic approaches.
Implementing your models into Swissgrid‚Äôs important operational workflows, ensuring they run reliably, securely, and efficiently at scale.
Monitoring the deployed models to track performance and handle model drift.‚ÄØ
Documenting your work clearly and consistently so others can understand, track, and build on your progress - because great science is shared science.
Collaborating across teams, engaging with stakeholders for feedback, alignment, and continuous improvement, and ensuring your work ties directly into broader business needs.
This Is How You Make The Difference‚ÄØ
We are looking for someone who has a strong analytical mindset to develop innovative data science solutions - not someone who checks every box. But here‚Äôs what will help you thrive:
You are studying (or recently finished) a Master‚Äôs or PhD in a relevant field like Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, or similar.

You have strong Python skills and have hands-on experience with MLOps tools (Scikit-learn, PyTorch, MLflow), Apache Spark, and data analytics and infrastructure platforms such as Databricks and Azure.
You are familiar with time-series data analysis and predictive models.‚ÄØ
You have a solid knowledge of Git and GitHub, such as resolving merge conflicts, and collaborating via pull requests.
Knowledge of transmission grid operations and electricity market is a plus.

Above all, we value curiosity, a strong drive to learn, and a problem-solving mindset over prior experience and educational background. If you're eager to tackle complex data science challenges and grow in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply ‚Äì even if you don‚Äôt meet every requirement.‚ÄØüöÄ
A comprehensive look behind the scenes of the electricity industry and an understanding of its challenges, as well as in-depth insights into the development of the grid of the future
Varied and exciting tasks within a company unique to SwitzerlandFlexible working hours as part of a motivated team
25‚Äì30 days of holiday, as well as company holiday between Christmas and New Year
A state-of-the-art work environment in the immediate vicinity of Aarau railway station
After completion of the internship, opportunities for continuing to work for the company can be discussed if desired

Swissgrid is revolutionizing the energy sector through cutting-edge automation and machine learning solutions. Our team Development & Optimization serves as the critical bridge between backoffice functions and real-time system operations, developing innovative forecast models and automation tools that directly support grid operators in their 24/7 mission. Additionally, our team is responsible for the development and operation of the Swiss ancillary services platform, which is essential for maintaining grid stability.‚ÄØ

You‚Äôll dive into challenging and meaningful data science projects in a dynamic, cross-functional environment. You‚Äôll work with cutting-edge cloud technologies and a modern tech stack, experience agile teamwork, and gain hands-on exposure to Switzerland‚Äôs transmission system operation ‚Äì all while learning from and contributing to an interdisciplinary, supportive, and passionate team.

Get ready to roll up your sleeves and explore challenges like:

  • Building forecasting models that solve real-world problems in the energy sector with a focus on scalability, robustness, and real-world application.
  • Building data pipelines that efficiently handle large-scale, time-series data to support reliable and scalable model development and deployment.
  • Exploring and analyzing data to uncover valuable insights, engineer suitable features, and improve forecasting accuracy.
  • Experimenting with different techniques to optimize performance - from hyperparameter tuning to innovative algorithmic approaches.
  • Implementing your models into Swissgrid‚Äôs important operational workflows, ensuring they run reliably, securely, and efficiently at scale.
  • Monitoring the deployed models to track performance and handle model drift.‚ÄØ
  • Documenting your work clearly and consistently so others can understand, track, and build on your progress - because great science is shared science.
  • Collaborating across teams, engaging with stakeholders for feedback, alignment, and continuous improvement, and ensuring your work ties directly into broader business needs.

This Is How You Make The Difference‚ÄØ

We are looking for someone who has a strong analytical mindset to develop innovative data science solutions - not someone who checks every box. But here‚Äôs what will help you thrive:

  • You are studying (or recently finished) a Master‚Äôs or PhD in a relevant field like Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, or similar.
  • You have strong Python skills and have hands-on experience with MLOps tools (Scikit-learn, PyTorch, MLflow), Apache Spark, and data analytics and infrastructure platforms such as Databricks and Azure.
  • You are familiar with time-series data analysis and predictive models.‚ÄØ
  • You have a solid knowledge of Git and GitHub, such as resolving merge conflicts, and collaborating via pull requests.
  • Knowledge of transmission grid operations and electricity market is a plus.
  • You communicate fluently in English.

Above all, we value curiosity, a strong drive to learn, and a problem-solving mindset over prior experience and educational background. If you're eager to tackle complex data science challenges and grow in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply ‚Äì even if you don‚Äôt meet every requirement.‚ÄØüöÄ

What We Offer

  • A comprehensive look behind the scenes of the electricity industry and an understanding of its challenges, as well as in-depth insights into the development of the grid of the future
  • Varied and exciting tasks within a company unique to SwitzerlandFlexible working hours as part of a motivated team
  • 25‚Äì30 days of holiday, as well as company holiday between Christmas and New Year
  • A state-of-the-art work environment in the immediate vicinity of Aarau railway station
  • After completion of the internship, opportunities for continuing to work for the company can be discussed if desired
