4283348640,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-database-engineer-intern-at-m365connect-4283348640?position=34&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=R8c%2FDZi8IF4IVDXt7AUKTA%3D%3D,Junior Database Engineer Intern,M365Connect,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Company Overview

Join our team as a Junior Database Engineer Intern and gain hands-on experience with modern database design, PostgreSQL administration, and enterprise data synchronization. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to learn professional database management while working on a real-world recruitment platform integration.

As a Junior Database Engineer Intern, you will assist in maintaining and improving our Manatal database synchronization system. You'll work closely with senior engineers to learn best practices in database design, performance optimization, and professional documentation.
Assist in monitoring database performance and creating performance reports
Learn PostgreSQL database administration and optimization techniques
Help document database schemas and relationships using professional ERD tools
Support data validation and quality assurance processes
Assist in writing SQL queries for reporting and analysis
Learn Docker basics and container management
Contribute to technical documentation and data dictionaries
Explore modern database platforms like Supabase
Participate in database design reviews and team meetings
Currently pursuing or recently completed degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field
Strong academic performance in database or data structures courses
Understanding of relational database concepts and SQL basics
Familiarity with at least one programming language (Python, JavaScript, or similar)
Basic understanding of data structures and algorithms
Good written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently and in a team
Previous internship or project experience with databases
Familiarity with PostgreSQL or other SQL databases
Experience with any ERD or database design tools
Basic knowledge of Docker or containerization
Familiarity with modern database platforms (Supabase, PlanetScale, etc.)
Professional ERD tools and documentation standards
PostgreSQL advanced features and performance tuning
Modern database platforms and cloud services
Duration: 3-6 months (with possibility of extension or full-time conversion)
Certificate of completion and recommendation letter for successful interns

Company Overview

Join our team as a Junior Database Engineer Intern and gain hands-on experience with modern database design, PostgreSQL administration, and enterprise data synchronization. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to learn professional database management while working on a real-world recruitment platform integration.

Position Summary

As a Junior Database Engineer Intern, you will assist in maintaining and improving our Manatal database synchronization system. You'll work closely with senior engineers to learn best practices in database design, performance optimization, and professional documentation.

Learning Opportunities &
column2:
Responsibilities

  • Assist in monitoring database performance and creating performance reports
  • Learn PostgreSQL database administration and optimization techniques
  • Help document database schemas and relationships using professional ERD tools
  • Support data validation and quality assurance processes
  • Participate in troubleshooting data inconsistencies
  • Assist in writing SQL queries for reporting and analysis
  • Learn Docker basics and container management
  • Contribute to technical documentation and data dictionaries
  • Explore modern database platforms like Supabase
  • Participate in database design reviews and team meetings


Required Basic Skills

  • Educational Background:
    • Currently pursuing or recently completed degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field
    • Strong academic performance in database or data structures courses
  • Technical Foundation:
    • Understanding of relational database concepts and SQL basics
    • Familiarity with at least one programming language (Python, JavaScript, or similar)
    • Basic understanding of data structures and algorithms
    • Comfortable with command-line interfaces
    • Strong analytical mindset
  • Soft Skills:
    • Excellent attention to detail
    • Strong problem-solving abilities
    • Good written and verbal communication skills
    • Ability to work independently and in a team
    • Eagerness to learn new technologies


Good to Have Skills

  • Previous internship or project experience with databases
  • Familiarity with PostgreSQL or other SQL databases
  • Experience with any ERD or database design tools
  • Basic knowledge of Docker or containerization
  • Understanding of JSON data format
  • Exposure to Linux/Unix environments
  • GitHub experience for version control
  • Familiarity with modern database platforms (Supabase, PlanetScale, etc.)
  • Basic understanding of API concepts


What You'll Learn

  • Enterprise-level database design and optimization
  • Professional ERD tools and documentation standards
  • PostgreSQL advanced features and performance tuning
  • Modern database platforms and cloud services
  • Docker and containerization for databases
  • Real-world data synchronization challenges
  • Professional development practices


Internship Details

  • Duration: 3-6 months (with possibility of extension or full-time conversion)
  • Flexible hours (minimum 20 hours/week)
  • Remote work available
  • Mentorship from senior database engineers
  • Hands-on experience with production systems
  • Certificate of completion and recommendation letter for successful interns

4281490667,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4281490667?position=39&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=keg1V%2FcBgwqwWJkZSHreDA%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Nidwalden, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Qualifications

4281491598,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4281491598?position=43&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=D5vab1qy9IQWVMHZjfZm5A%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Berne, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4269393511,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-consultant-artificial-intelligence-data-data-management-data-platforms-focus-at-deloitte-4269393511?position=45&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=qYNSytcYm7XUNUgdCQCe%2Bw%3D%3D,Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus),Deloitte,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","Job Description
Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.
For this role, we are currently offering start dates from August 2025.
How You Can Make An Impact
Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.

Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.
Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.
Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.

column2: fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.

column1: First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data ‚Äì how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .
We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on ‚Äúapply now‚Äù to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.
If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch

We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria

4276113426,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-analyst-all-at-bkw-ag-4276113426?position=47&pageNum=0&refId=iEL4om%2Fg5%2FAiJk7JhBVNOw%3D%3D&trackingId=ri49Ck3XUszrPHbHqahP9A%3D%3D,Quantitative Analyst (all),BKW AG,"Bern, Berne, Switzerland","BKW offers forward-looking total solutions in the areas of energy, buildings and infrastructure - internationally and in partnership. With around 12,000 employees, we build modern grids, generate renewable energy and realise energy-efficient buildings. We are looking for passionate people to join us in making a contribution to the society and environment of tomorrow. Become part of the BKW network and join us in creating living spaces worth living in!

Join our risk management team and play a key role in ensuring market data integrity and advancing risk metrics in energy trading. As a self-motivated professional with strong analytical skills, you will contribute to the continuous development of our risk management strategies.
Ensure the integrity of market data and maintain external data interfaces and contracts
Enhance market risk metrics for commodities, FX, and interest rate markets
Conduct stress tests on trading portfolios and monitor risk limits, escalating breaches when necessary
Oversee and improve risk reporting processes to support decision-making
Work closely with trading units to analyze market developments and assess risks
Contribute to operational risk management by handling event reporting and training new employees
Master's or PhD degree in a quantitative discipline
column2: CFA or FRM is a plus

column1: Experience in risk management, energy trading, or banking
Knowledge of financial mathematics and market risk assessment
Experience in energy markets or trading with programming skills (Matlab, SQL, .NET, Python)
Analytical and systematic thinking with a practical affinity for reporting and databases
We are not interested in enquiries from recruitment agencies.

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika‚Äôs around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Intern to join our team in Zurich and support our digital transformation initiatives using Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI). This role offers a great opportunity to gain hands-on experience in low-code/no-code development, business process automation, and data visualization while contributing to real-world projects in a collaborative environment.
Support the team in maintaining and improving existing Power Platform solutions
Test and document developed solutions to ensure functionality and maintainability
Collaborate with stakeholders and assist in the design, development, and deployment of Power Platform solutions
Participate in team meetings and contribute ideas for process improvements
Stay updated on the latest Power Platform features and best practices
Enrolled in a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs program in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Informatics, or a related field
Basic knowledge of Microsoft Power Platform components (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI)
Familiarity with Microsoft 365 ecosystem (e.g., SharePoint, Teams, Excel) is a plus
Logical thinking and a structured approach to problem-solving
Strong communication skills and ability to work in multi-cultural team environment
Willingness to learn and take initiative on assigned tasks
For further information on this position please contact Stefan Schotte (schotte.stefan@ch.sika.com) or apply online through our career portal.

Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika‚Äôs around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Intern to join our team in Zurich and support our digital transformation initiatives using Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI). This role offers a great opportunity to gain hands-on experience in low-code/no-code development, business process automation, and data visualization while contributing to real-world projects in a collaborative environment.

Responsibilities

  • Support the team in maintaining and improving existing Power Platform solutions
  • Test and document developed solutions to ensure functionality and maintainability
  • Collaborate with stakeholders and assist in the design, development, and deployment of Power Platform solutions
  • Participate in team meetings and contribute ideas for process improvements
  • Stay updated on the latest Power Platform features and best practices

Qualifications

  • Enrolled in a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs program in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Informatics, or a related field
  • Basic knowledge of Microsoft Power Platform components (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI)
  • Familiarity with Microsoft 365 ecosystem (e.g., SharePoint, Teams, Excel) is a plus
  • Logical thinking and a structured approach to problem-solving
  • Strong communication skills and ability to work in multi-cultural team environment
  • Willingness to learn and take initiative on assigned tasks

Additional Information

For further information on this position please contact Stefan Schotte (schotte.stefan@ch.sika.com) or apply online through our career portal.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

4284002687,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/freelancer-%E2%80%93-junior-senior-data-engineer-sql-at-kpmg-switzerland-4284002687?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=d0QSaS4%2FgZyOCKcvyh%2Fjgw%3D%3D&trackingId=jP5LNR94gvSVujCAphcMYg%3D%3D,Freelancer ‚Äì (Junior/Senior) Data Engineer / SQL,KPMG Switzerland,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","
Do you have a background in computer science, software engineering, programming, data or other IT related field? We are looking for the brightest minds to join our pool of freelancer.
Start date: On Demand (as soon as possible)
Work with our release management team to ensure high quality of software deployments
Manage environments and deploy complex data transformation scripts (SQL / Oracle)
Analyse and resolve issues and support front-to-back troubleshooting activities.
This is what makes you successful
Good understanding of release management processes
Good knowledge of SQL, data models / database concepts
Java expertise and basic UNIX/LINUX knowledge is a plus
Strong ethical behaviors and high integrity, which align with KPMG's vision and aspirations
Flexibility with regards to early, late or weekend work is a plus (part time possible)
Discover KPMG ‚Äì Become part of our team

Our Financial Services team advises clients on strategic initiatives and has a strong track record with regards to the transformation of financial institution's business, operating models and sustainability journeys. As of today, the FS department is helping financial institutions of all sizes on their challenging journey and covers business, sustainability, technical and regulatory aspects. We follow a multidisciplinary approach and collaborate with the KPMG network to serve our clients globally.

With 300 different auditing and advisory service opportunities, our people can choose the career path that suits them best. Through our competencies in business transformation as well as ESG consulting, we support our clients in today's biggest challenges. We are a purpose-led and values driven company where your insight can create opportunities for you and contribute to a better future. Do work that matters, supported by a community that values difference and cares about you. Gain learning that'll last you a lifetime and be recognized for the impact you make. Find opportunity everywhere with KPMG.

The position of Deskside Technician ‚Äì End User Computing performs troubleshooting, repair, and preventative maintenance of end user computing equipment and peripheral equipment at corporate locations.

The candidate works on assignments of a diverse scope where analysis of data and hardware requires evaluation of identifiable factors. The candidate exercises judgment with supervision within the generally defined practices and policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions and acts as a liaison between customers, departments, and within the organization to lead problem resolution.
Essential duties for the position include, but are not limited to the following:
‚Ä¢ Provide onsite support to Authorized Users with operational and technical support and to meet specified SLAs
‚Ä¢ Resolve incidents and problems associated with EUC equipment
‚Ä¢ Perform reactive troubleshooting to effectively identify potential incidents or problems, and attempt to eliminate them to occur in the future
‚Ä¢ Support Authorized Users in connecting or attempting to connect to corporate network and assist in the coordination and completion of accessing LAN, print, and file services

‚Ä¢ Provide network printers and scanner network connectivity, including providing network support for device configuration, for IP addressing, and direct TCP/IP output
‚Ä¢ Provide warranty and break/fix support for networked printers and scanners
‚Ä¢ Configure and support end users on mobile computing platforms

‚Ä¢ Provide on-site hardware support for general troubleshooting and problems for end user computing technologies

‚Ä¢ Monitoring and maintaining systems that run Windows 7/10

*JOB DESCRIPTION

The position of Deskside Technician ‚Äì End User Computing performs troubleshooting, repair, and preventative maintenance of end user computing equipment and peripheral equipment at corporate locations.

The candidate works on assignments of a diverse scope where analysis of data and hardware requires evaluation of identifiable factors. The candidate exercises judgment with supervision within the generally defined practices and policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions and acts as a liaison between customers, departments, and within the organization to lead problem resolution.

Essential duties for the position include, but are not limited to the following:

‚Ä¢ Provide onsite support to Authorized Users with operational and technical support and to meet specified SLAs

‚Ä¢ Resolve incidents and problems associated with EUC equipment

‚Ä¢ Perform reactive troubleshooting to effectively identify potential incidents or problems, and attempt to eliminate them to occur in the future

‚Ä¢ Support Authorized Users in connecting or attempting to connect to corporate network and assist in the coordination and completion of accessing LAN, print, and file services

and accessing appropriate LAN segments

‚Ä¢ Install, upgrade and repair EUC equipment (desktops, laptops, monitors, and associated peripherals)

‚Ä¢ Provide software break/fix services and replacement of non-warranty assets for end users

‚Ä¢ Provide network printers and scanner network connectivity, including providing network support for device configuration, for IP addressing, and direct TCP/IP output

‚Ä¢ Provide warranty and break/fix support for networked printers and scanners

‚Ä¢ Configure and support end users on mobile computing platforms

‚Ä¢ Provide VIP support for equipment including desktop devices, mobile devices, display screens, video systems, docking stations, communication devices, direct attached printers, local printers, scanners, wireless networking, etc

‚Ä¢ Create, change and remove printer configurations and queues based on requests and in accordance with SLAs

‚Ä¢ Provide on-site hardware support for general troubleshooting and problems for end user computing technologies

‚Ä¢ Provide regular, accurate, and timely feedback regarding customer requirements which shall include supervising assignments and maintaining timely communication with sales, operations, and branch office personnel.

‚Ä¢ Utilize problem management database and systems to track and report on customer calls and requests.

‚Ä¢ Communicate technical information to technical and non-technical team and customers.

‚Ä¢ Deskside support services as required.

*JOB REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS

Experience:

‚Ä¢ Requires 3 to 5 years of related work experience

‚Ä¢ Sound knowledge of imaging tools (Ghost, MDT)

‚Ä¢ Sound knowledge of data backup and recovery tools (USMT)

‚Ä¢ Installing, upgrading, and migrating to Windows 7/10

‚Ä¢ Deploying Windows 7/10 in large enterprises

‚Ä¢ Configuring hardware and applications

‚Ä¢ Configuring network connectivity

‚Ä¢ Configuring access to resources

‚Ä¢ Configuring mobile computing

‚Ä¢ Monitoring and maintaining systems that run Windows 7/10

‚Ä¢ Configuring backup and recovery options

Job Type: Full-time

As part of our continued growth, we are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our cross-commodity desk, focused on algorithmic trading, at our headquarters in Lugano.

The nature of the role will require you to work both as part of a closely knit team and individually. You will benefit from hands-on mentorship and close collaboration with analysts on your trading desk and across other desks within the firm.

We offer a full-time permanent position with a competitive salary. You will also be eligible for our benefits and wellness programmes. Individual growth and development support is provided by the Duferco Academy.
Developing analytical/statistical tools for the generation and analysis of trading strategies and new signal extraction from market and fundamental data
Working on data collection and classification using the internal database
Working closely with the quant team with a focus on strategy generation
Working on generating trading strategies on futures markets
Strong statistical and/or quantitative background with a MS degree on science-related fields (Statistics, Applied Statistics, Data Science)
Strong result-driven mindset with a scientific and methodical approach
Curiosity and exploratory approach to reviewing white papers, market analyses, and research reports‚Äîeager to experiment with and validate new quantitative methods
Motivated, team player, and with an enthusiastic attitude.
The candidate will ideally have 2/3 years job experience

If you feel this opportunity represents the right step for you and you are confident of bringing value to the team, please send your updated CV together with a cover letter to: hr.algo.cross.commodity@dxt.com

Quant Analyst ‚ÄìCross-commodity Desk


As part of our continued growth, we are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our cross-commodity desk, focused on algorithmic trading, at our headquarters in Lugano.

The nature of the role will require you to work both as part of a closely knit team and individually. You will benefit from hands-on mentorship and close collaboration with analysts on your trading desk and across other desks within the firm.

We offer a full-time permanent position with a competitive salary. You will also be eligible for our benefits and wellness programmes. Individual growth and development support is provided by the Duferco Academy.

Tasks:

  • Developing analytical/statistical tools for the generation and analysis of trading strategies and new signal extraction from market and fundamental data
  • Working on data collection and classification using the internal database
  • Working closely with the quant team with a focus on strategy generation
  • Working on generating trading strategies on futures markets

Requirements:

  • Strong statistical and/or quantitative background with a MS degree on science-related fields (Statistics, Applied Statistics, Data Science)
  • Strong result-driven mindset with a scientific and methodical approach
  • Curiosity and exploratory approach to reviewing white papers, market analyses, and research reports‚Äîeager to experiment with and validate new quantitative methods
  • Motivated, team player, and with an enthusiastic attitude.
  • The candidate will ideally have 2/3 years job experience


If you feel this opportunity represents the right step for you and you are confident of bringing value to the team, please send your updated CV together with a cover letter to: hr.algo.cross.commodity@dxt.com

    Lettera di motivazione? Ci rinunciamo. Piuttosto, siamo contenti di ricevere le tue risposte alle nostre brevi domande relative al posto di lavoro, che troverai nel tool di candidatura online.

    Hai domande?

    Per domande su questo posto Diana Carbognin, sar√† lieta di esserti d'aiuto

    Per questa posizione non possiamo tenere in considerazione candidature tramite agenzie di collocamento.

    Il nostro processo di candidatura

    Conoscete il nostro processo di candidatura e ricevete le risposte alle domande che i candidati ci pongono spesso. Se avete bisogno di supporto durante il processo di candidatura, contattateci. I nostri colleghi del Recruiting saranno lieti di aiutarvi.

    Vantaggi

    Salute

    • Management della salute proprio di AXA
    • Massaggi
    • Diversi corsi sportivi e di rilassamento
    • Seminari di Health Management
    • Sale di riposo

    Mobilit√†

    • Rimborso di abbonamento met√†-prezzo, AG (proporzionalmente)
    • Acquisto di assegni Reka a prezzo agevolato
    • Ribassi per acquisto, leasing o noleggio auto

    Lavoro e famiglia

    • 22 settimane di congedo interamente retribuito
    • 8 settimane di congedo interamente retribuito per l'altro genitore
    • Assegni familiari aziendali
    • Orari di riunione per le famiglie
    • Coaching genitoriale gratuito per i dipendenti

    Ulteriori vantaggi

    • 5000 Swipoints all‚Äôanno (del valore di CHF 500.-) da utilizzare sul sito swibeco.ch
    • AXA Shareplan
    • Vitto agevolato con Lunchcard o presso i ristoranti per il personale
    • Ribassi su acquisti, eventi, offerte per il tempo libero

    Assicurativi

    • Ribasso fino al 30% sui prodotti di AXA
    • Assicurazione privata per infortuni professionali e non professionali

    Flessibilit√† e libert√†

    • Diversi modelli per l‚Äôorganizzazione flessibile dell‚Äôorario di lavoro (AXA Flexwork)
    • Almeno 5 settimane di vacanza
    • 2 settimane di vacanza in regalo ogni 5 anni
    • Acquisto flessibile di vacanze fino a max 10 giorni
    • 3 giorni da dedicare all‚Äôapprendimento personale

    Cassa pensione

    • Prestazioni della cassa pensione e contributi del datore di lavoro ben oltre il minimo di legge
    • Libera scelta del piano di risparmio
    • Flessibilit√† in caso di pensionamento

    Su AXA

    Ogni storia di successo inizia con la fiducia in se stessi.

    Noi di AXA ci vediamo come tuo partner che sta al tuo fianco e crede in te. Per questo motivo siamo esigenti nei tuoi confronti, spronandoti e mostrandoti proattivamente le opportunit√† per il tuo futuro. Ti incoraggiamo e ti offriamo maggiori libert√† affinch√© tu possa coniugare al meglio ci√≤ che pi√π ti sta a cuore. Congiuntamente al tuo impegno e al tuo personale contributo plasmeremo una partnership con ottime credenziali per il futuro. Per te, per noi e per i nostri clienti. E tutto ci√≤ non soltanto per un effimero momento, bens√¨ sul lungo periodo.

    Scrivi ora con noi la tua personale storia di successo. Know You Can.

    Smart Working

    Noi di AXA puntiamo su fiducia, flessibilit√† e lavoro di squadra. Il nostro nuovo modello di lavoro ¬´Smart Working¬ª √® incentrato sul tuo contributo agli obiettivi aziendali e non sul luogo dove lo presti.

    Diversity &
column5:
Inclusion

La diversit√†, le pari opportunit√† e l'inclusione sono fondamentali per noi in AXA. La nostra cultura aziendale promuove il rispetto e l'apertura, affinch√© ogni persona da noi possa esprimere appieno il proprio potenziale.

I nostri riconoscimenti

Il nostro obiettivo √® offrire ai collaboratori attuali e futuri il migliore ambiente di lavoro possibile. Per saperne di pi√π sui riconoscimenti ricevuti da AXA.

Kaizen Gaming, the team powering Betano, is one of the biggest GameTech companies in the world, operating in 19 markets. We always aim to leverage cutting-edge technology, providing the best experience to our millions of customers who trust us for their entertainment.
We are a diverse team of more than 2.700 Kaizeners, from 40+ nationalities spreading across 3 continents.
Our #oneteam is proud to be among the Best Workplaces in Europe and certified Great Place to Work across our offices. Here, there‚Äôll be no average day for you. Ready to Press Play on Potential?
We are looking for an outstanding Data Analyst to join our fast-growing BI & Analytics team and contribute to the expansion of our Kaizen Gaming functions during an exciting scale-up data journey.
As a Data Analyst you will:
Build strong relationships with stakeholders, proactively providing data analyses and insights to the function
Interpret KPIs with a clear understanding on results vs. expected targets
Communicate insights and recommendations effectively to stakeholders enabling them to make better-informed business decisions
Continuously assess and refine existing metrics and KPIs and work closely with the rest of Business Intelligence (BI) to develop new ones that drive business growth
Work closely with the rest of BI team to ensure alignment, adopt best practices in data visualization, and facilitate seamless information flow from the hub to the spoke and vice versa
Contribute to fostering a strong data-driven culture across the organization
Design and develop data intelligence solutions, including analysis, reporting and dashboards of key metrics and KPIs.
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Operations Research, or similar
Experience in a reporting, statistical or quantitative role‚Äîexperience in the gaming industry would be considered a plus
Analytical mindset and detail-oriented with ability to focus and prioritize workload
Exceptional data storytelling skills and the ability to articulate technical information to a non-technical audience
Strategic thinker with the ability to collaborate and engage with senior stakeholders
High drive, can-do attitude, proactive, and adaptable to changing business demands
Advanced proficiency in SQL, as well as strong skills in MS-Excel and Google Sheets (pivot tables, v-lookups)
Working experience with Microsoft Power BI would be considered a plus (or other dashboarding tools such as Tableau)
Working experience with Python would also be considered a plus (especially Pandas, Numpy, and other relevant libraries for data analysis)

At Kaizen Gaming, we value innovation, collaboration and continuous improvement. If you're passionate about leveraging data to drive business success and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we'd love to hear from you.

About CloudWalk:

We are not just another fintech unicorn. We are a pack of dreamers, makers, and tech enthusiasts building the future of payments. With millions of happy customers and a hunger for innovation, we're now expanding our neural network - literally and metaphorically.

About The Job

The Risk Team is responsible for building the defense layer that keeps CloudWalk, its merchants, and users safe. We keep our ecosystem healthy by tracking down malicious activity and maintaining regulatory compliance, while providing the best user experience.

What You'll Be Doing:

  • Create and operate fraud prevention processes, which involves daily analyses, KPIs control, automation opportunities, and customer satisfaction.
  • We expect you to raise our operation standards and come up with new ideas for improvements, implementing new controls and business rules, alongside an excellent team of analysts and engineers.

What You Need To Succeed:

  • Great SQL knowledge
column2: • Programming skills
column3: • Excellent Portuguese communication
column4: • Advanced English communication
column5: • Great analytical skills
column6: • Great problem solving skills
column7: • Fast learning
column8:
The Future We See:

At CloudWalk, we envision a future where AI empowers every field to reach new heights:

  • People teams leveraging AI to transform talent acquisition and employee development.
  • Marketing professionals creating data-driven, AI-powered campaign strategies.
  • Customer Success teams enhancing client experiences with intelligent solutions.
  • Risk analysts combining human expertise with AI to navigate complexities.
  • Designers collaborating with AI to push creative boundaries.

Join us at CloudWalk, where we‚Äôre not just engineering solutions
column9:
we‚Äôre building a smarter, AI-driven future for payments‚Äîtogether.

The role of the Data Analyst requires the maintenance and integration of both static and dynamic data related to equity securities listed on global stock exchanges and of related Entities, including all possible corporate actions and the types of dividends distributed.

This role calls for accuracy and a solid understanding of all types of equity or capital-participation financial instruments. Additionally, knowledge of national and international taxation related to the financial securities under analysis is required. The analyst is also responsible for managing the entity database, ensuring proper codification and the corporate group structure. A proactive attitude towards client interaction, strong problem-solving skills and teamwork abilities are also essential for this role.
Track all life cycle events of financial instruments (such as dividends, corporate actions, etc.) for the full set of securities listed on designated stock exchanges.
Collect company and security data requested by clients, ensure complete coverage of corporate groups, and monitor Initial Public Offerings (IPOs)
Acquire financial data for issuers and securities from relevant markets
Manage both ordinary and extraordinary corporate actions involving issuers.
Interact occasionally with companies (e.g., investor relations) to acquire and update corporate information
Deliver client support via the help desk, assisting with the content monitored and implemented within internal systems
Analyze, monitor, and maintain specific tax-related content concerning the securities under review
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in an economic field
Experience in the financial services industry would be an asset
Strong collaboration skills - ability to navigate cross functional teams to deliver on shared objectives
Must have the ability to develop strong relationships with colleagues at all levels of the organization
Understanding of how data is stored and flows through systems and databases
Proficiency in English and Italian (spoken and written)
Experience in querying and retrieving data from structured databases (e.g. SQL) and in using programming languages such as Python

Job Description

Job Purpose

The role of the Data Analyst requires the maintenance and integration of both static and dynamic data related to equity securities listed on global stock exchanges and of related Entities, including all possible corporate actions and the types of dividends distributed.

This role calls for accuracy and a solid understanding of all types of equity or capital-participation financial instruments. Additionally, knowledge of national and international taxation related to the financial securities under analysis is required. The analyst is also responsible for managing the entity database, ensuring proper codification and the corporate group structure. A proactive attitude towards client interaction, strong problem-solving skills and teamwork abilities are also essential for this role.

Responsibilities

  • Track all life cycle events of financial instruments (such as dividends, corporate actions, etc.) for the full set of securities listed on designated stock exchanges.
  • Collect company and security data requested by clients, ensure complete coverage of corporate groups, and monitor Initial Public Offerings (IPOs)
  • Acquire financial data for issuers and securities from relevant markets
  • Manage both ordinary and extraordinary corporate actions involving issuers.
  • Interact occasionally with companies (e.g., investor relations) to acquire and update corporate information
  • Deliver client support via the help desk, assisting with the content monitored and implemented within internal systems
  • Analyze, monitor, and maintain specific tax-related content concerning the securities under review

Knowledge And Experience

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in an economic field
  • Experience in the financial services industry would be an asset
  • Strong collaboration skills - ability to navigate cross functional teams to deliver on shared objectives
  • Must have the ability to develop strong relationships with colleagues at all levels of the organization
  • Understanding of how data is stored and flows through systems and databases
  • Proficiency in English and Italian (spoken and written)
  • Experience in querying and retrieving data from structured databases (e.g. SQL) and in using programming languages such as Python

Are you an automotive fan and have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements? MSXI has the job for you!
MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Business Data Analyst to join our team in Rome.

As part of our team, you will support the data management and analysis processes as well as the development and deployment of our Data and AI literacy program. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes. Your key tasks will be:
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide insights into Lean program performance and business operations
Document processes, findings, and recommendations clearly and effectively for both technical and non-technical audiences

We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Business Data Analyst has a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field, as well as:
3+ years experience as a Business Analyst, with background in data analytics and AI
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
Entry level knowledge of SQL, ETL processes, and data modeling
Experience with BI tools and data visualization platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Experience of planning complex schedules of activities
If you‚Äôre ready to make an impact and contribute to our company‚Äôs success, apply now!

At MSX, our employees are the force behind our success. We are dedicated to empowering and encouraging our people and offer flexible working methods to suit all. We are a Disability Confident Committed organisation who takes pride in our diverse workforce.
In Joining MSX, You Can Enjoy

    Job Description

    Business Data Analyst

    40 hours per week, Monday-Friday

    Rome, hybrid

    Are you an automotive fan and have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements? MSXI has the job for you!

    MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Business Data Analyst to join our team in Rome.

    The Role

    Responsibilities

    As part of our team, you will support the data management and analysis processes as well as the development and deployment of our Data and AI literacy program. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes. Your key tasks will be:

    • Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide insights into Lean program performance and business operations
    • Provide data-driven recommendations to stakeholder
    • Document processes, findings, and recommendations clearly and effectively for both technical and non-technical audiences

    Qualifications

    About you

    About

    We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Business Data Analyst has a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field, as well as:

    • 3+ years experience as a Business Analyst, with background in data analytics and AI
    • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
    • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
    • Entry level knowledge of SQL, ETL processes, and data modeling
    • Experience with BI tools and data visualization platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
    • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
    • Experience of planning complex schedules of activities
    • Fluent level of English

    If you‚Äôre ready to make an impact and contribute to our company‚Äôs success, apply now!

    • 40 hours per week

    You can learn more about MSX International on our website: www.msxi.com

As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parit√† di genere. KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†
At KPMG - no secrets with big data
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to pursue a profession that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, the company and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.
Specifically, you will join our Lighthouse team.
Lighthouse is the KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of data & analytics solutions.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise,with access to shared knowledge from our centres of excellence Your experience in IT, mathematics and statistics along with your corporate expertise will allow you to design and implement predictive analytical solutions, integrating different factors and presenting them in a professional manner. In a business- and technological innovation-orientated environment, your work will embrace data science, data engineering and information visualisation.
Specifically, you will be tasked with:
Analyzing, designing, and implementing reporting and monitoring dashboards
Analyzing business processes and designing analytical models to support them
Implementing analytical solutions, go-live support, and application maintenance.
Come As You Are - Your skills and characteristics
This is the perfect opportunity for you if:
You have a degree in economics, mathematics, mathematical engineering, statistics, computer engineering, management engineering, or computer science.
You have developed knowledge in the field of data and databases (entity/relationship data models, DBMS).
You have developed an interest in the field of Business Intelligence/Data & Analytics.
You have developed the ability to combine business skills with IT skills, including data modeling
You have a good command of English, preferably with experience studying and/or working abroad
You have knowledge of at least one of the following databases (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and have developed skills in SQL
column2: knowledge of programming languages is an advantage.

In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse. Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse di Roma.
La Lighthouse √® il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalit√† e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti di Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing e molto altro! Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacit√† di interpretare e gestire i dati.
Integrazione dei dati: capire quali fonti di dati sono importanti e come devono essere trattate al fine di potenziare nuovi strumenti e metodologie Data Driven
Modellazione: sviluppo di nuovi modelli di Machine Learning ad hoc per soddisfare le richieste e i requisiti aziendali
Piattaforme di analisi avanzate: Sviluppo di pipeline ML complete, dall'ingestione dei dati alle applicazioni frontend.

Incontri ed eventi orientati al business: concentrandosi fortemente sulla condivisione con gli utenti aziendali dei dettagli del progetto, si costruisce la fiducia nello strumento e nella metodologia utilizzata per svilupparlo
Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche
Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:
Possiedi una Laurea in Data Science, Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Statistica o altra ritenuta attinente
Hai una buona conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione come Python e SAS
Hai competenze nella comprensione del ciclo di vita dei modelli: preparazione dei dati dell'ultimo miglio, sviluppo di modelli di intelligenza artificiale e distribuzione in un'infrastruttura cloud
Hai una buona conoscenza di: Data Warehouse, estrazione, manipolazione e preparazione dei dati
Hai competenze di base di Data Visualization, con soluzioni Enterprise (es. PowerBI) o soluzioni open-source come ggplot o plotly
Hai competenze di base con le principali piattaforme cloud (Azure, AWS)
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero
Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG
Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory provides consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitization, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.
Specifically, you will join the Lighthouse Team in Rome.
Lighthouse is KPMG Advisory's center of excellence offering Data & Analytics solutions in the market.

Joining the team, you will develop innovative solutions drawing on our global expertise. You will combine computer science, mathematics, statistics and business to create predictive analytics, presenting and communicating them with professionalism and expertise. You will work in a technology innovation-oriented environment, dealing with Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing and more! We have received international recognition for our ability to interpret and manage data.
Specifically, you will be involved in:
Data Integration: understanding which data sources are important and how they should be treated in order to enhance new Data Driven tools and methodologies
Modeling: developing new Machine Learning models ad hoc to meet business demands and requirements
Advanced Analytics Platforms: Development of complete ML pipelines from data ingestion to frontend applications.
Business-oriented meetings and events: Strong focus on sharing project details with business users builds confidence in the tool and the methodology used to develop it
Come As You Are - Your Skills And Characteristics.
This opportunity is perfect for you if:
You hold a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, Statistics or other deemed relevant
You have a good understanding of major programming languages such as Python and SAS
You have skills in understanding the model lifecycle: last mile data preparation, artificial intelligence model development and deployment in a cloud infrastructure
You have a good understanding of: Data Warehouse, data extraction, manipulation and preparation
You have basic skills in Data Visualization, with Enterprise solutions (e.g., PowerBI) or open-source solutions such as ggplot or plotly
You have basic skills with major cloud platforms (Azure, AWS)
You have a good command of the English language, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad
Your Future With Us - What you will find at KPMG.
An inclusive, equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity
A stimulating and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork
Hybrid work mode to promote a healthy work-life balance
Advanced training and development programs to stay current
Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being
Together for Better - Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for each individuality, continuous deepening, transparency, commitment to the community, integrity: these are KPMG's Values that give rise to an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, enabling our professionals to reach their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarized all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) No. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù) as amended. For more information, please see KPMG's privacy policy.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. guarantees equal opportunities.

  • International mindset and innovative projects
  • Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being

Together for Better - Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for each individuality, continuous deepening, transparency, commitment to the community, integrity: these are KPMG's Values that give rise to an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, enabling our professionals to reach their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarized all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) No. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù) as amended. For more information, please see KPMG's privacy policy.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. guarantees equal opportunities.

Reporting KYC: Gather data needed for AML KYC purposes from different business sources and prepare monthly reports detailing KYC information, ensuring weekly updates to reflect current review status in monthly committees

Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualit√† su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.

Crediamo nel valore dell‚Äôeccellenza, che √® la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.

4271497647,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analytics-insight-internship-at-procter-gamble-4271497647?position=17&pageNum=0&refId=1IDCiCogBxg4jyLBGYZvBA%3D%3D&trackingId=IA1IIvtJassY63se0fAeNQ%3D%3D,Analytics & Insight Internship,Procter & Gamble,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Job Location

Do you have a passion to influence business strategy, product design, commercial vision and the media landscape? An ambition to drive the change through deep consumer understanding and advanced analytics is also what we are looking for!
If so, then this role is perfect for you!

In Analytics & Insights (A&I), we use our boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it and how we can we influence them through immersive exploration and big data analytics. We uncover unexpected insights and innovate the way P&G runs business.
A career in A&I will build your ability to influence and think strategically, across a breadth of experiences on multiple P&G business.
As An Intern In Analytics And Insights, You Will
Act as a business strategy consultant, guiding decisions of P&G Top management in several business domains (consumer, customer, digital etc.)
Be part of a multi-functional business team, working closely with Marketing, Finance, Sales, R&D and others, constantly exploring new opportunities for business growth
Combine analytical expertise and deep consumer understanding, to anticipate opportunities and answer critical business questions

Grow your skills continuously, improving your mastery in big data analytics, as well as immersive in-depth researches. You will have the opportunity to explore new ways to learn and to connect with internal and external guides worldwide.
Responsibilities as of Day 1 ‚Äì You will be given specific projects and responsibilities working on real and live business challenges, just like a true P&Ger
Continuous coaching ‚Äì You will work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager
Dynamic and respectful work environment ‚Äì Employees are at the core, we value every individual and encourage initiatives, promoting work/life balance
Compensation & Benefits: you will receive a competitive internship salary as well as other benefits whilst you are with us.
Just apply online via clicking the button below
Attach any documents you consider relevant: motivation letter, recommendations, certificates etc.
Master students or recent graduates with strong analytical skills and Integrative thinking
Proven leadership and teamwork skills, with a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù approach and an unusual skew to innovate
Boundless curiosity and the passion to generate results
Data Analytics background represents a plus
Have creativity, innovation, initiative and follow-through with your goals, along with strong written and verbal communication skills
Are fluent in Italian and have an excellent ability to communicate in English
Are available for a minimum of 3 months, preferably 6 months internship.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate against individuals based on race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, veteran status, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.
At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.
Our mission of Diversity and Inclusion is: ‚ÄúEveryone valued. Everyone included. Everyone performing at their peak‚Äù.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Do you want to pursue a profession that is truly meaningful and impactful? Specifically, you will join our Lighthouse team.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise,with access to shared knowledge from our centres of excellence Your experience in IT, mathematics and statistics along with your corporate expertise will allow you to design and implement predictive analytical solutions, integrating different factors and presenting them in a professional manner. In a business- and technological innovation-orientated environment, your work will embrace data science, data engineering and information visualisation.

you have a degree in economics, mathematics, mathematical engineering, statistics, computer engineering, management and production engineering or computer science

you have developed aninterest in Data Visualization/Business Intelligence
you are proficient in English, preferably with study/work experience abroad
you have knowledge of at least one of the following databases (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and have developed skills in SQL

Do you want to pursue a profession that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, the company and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.
Lighthouse is the KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of data & analytics solutions.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise. You will combine IT, mathematics, statistics and business knowledge to create predictive analyses, which you will present and communicate in a professional and skilful manner. You will work in a technology-driven environment, focusing on the development of end-to-end Artificial Intelligence solutions, with particular emphasis on the application of Large Language Models and AI Agents. We have received international recognition for our ability to interpret and analyze data.
Specifically, within a structured team, you will deal with:
Analyzing business cases and translating them into Artificial Intelligence solutions
Designing the solution from both technical and technological perspectives
Designing and implementing the solution with a focus on Artificial Intelligence techniques
Validating the implemented solution with business experts
Analyzing, designing, and implementing monitoring tools for the developed solutions
Supporting the launch and managing the maintenance of the applications.
Come As You Are - Your skills and characteristics
This opportunity is perfect for you if:
You hold a degree in Economics, Mathematics, Mathematical Engineering, Statistics, Computer Engineering, Management Engineering, or Computer Science
You have developed the ability to combine business knowledge with IT skills, including basic modeling and data exploration
You are familiar with programming languages used in data analysis, particularly Python
You have skills in statistics and machine learning models
You have a basic understanding of major Artificial Intelligence solutions
You have a good command of the English language, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad.

An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork.
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programmes to stay current.
Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being.
Together for Better ‚Äì Our values and commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect every individual, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community and integrity. These are the KPMG values that create an environment that encourages the sharing of ideas and knowledge, so our professionals can achieve their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarised all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG‚Äôs privacy policy.

progettare e sviluppare modelli, analisi ed algoritmi avvalendosi della data science, funzionali ad un approccio Data Driven al governo dei processi aziendali dell‚Äôambito System Operator

individuare, sviluppare e manutenere gli use-case, gli algoritmi e i modelli di intelligenza artificiale a supporto delle analisi dei dati per il perseguimento degli obiettivi aziendali nell‚Äôambito del System Operator

DXC Technology is looking for Analytics Business Analyst to join Analytics DXC Offering.

DXC Analytics is focused on providing customers innovative solutions and high added value, in the following areas: Analytics Solutions and Services, Big Data Platforms, Information Governance, Business Intelligence & Data Management, Artificial Intelligence and IoT Analytics.

Prioritizes the workload ensuring on time and on budget deliverables
Consolidated - at least 5 years - professional experience on BI/DWH projects
Strong Experience on Data Modeling and on Advanced SQL
Attitude to modelling and understanding of the data and the client‚Äôs business
Nice to have: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in one of the following areas: Computer Science, Computer engineering, Mathematical Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Knowledge of Public Sector.

Being part of an highly-qualified team of 200 professionals with solid experience on Analytics Solutions and Services, Big Data Platforms, Information Governance, Business Intelligence & Data Management, Artificial Intelligence and IoT Analytics

From the first day, you will face with a reality that operates in more than 70 countries and formed through on the job training, technical training and soft skills, working inside a meritocratic reward system.

Thanks for taking the time to review our job, if you think it is a match to your experience and interests please apply today with CV in English - we are eager to learn more about you! If you know a friend who may be a fit for the job please refer them.
Location: Rome (RM) with remote work possibility

At DXC Technology, we believe strong connections and community are key to our success. Our work model prioritizes in-person collaboration while offering flexibility to support wellbeing, productivity, individual work styles, and life circumstances. We‚Äôre committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive.

SQL (Redshift), Tableau, Superset, Airflow, Git, Excel, PowerPoint, HubSpot, Amplitude, Looker Studio and possibly Python/R if you're ready to explore more advanced analysis.

Willing to be relocated in Rome

Because here, you‚Äôre not just a number-cruncher , you‚Äôre a partner in making healthcare better.

At MioDottore, your data tells a story, and that story helps people live healthier lives.

We‚Äôll count on you to:

  • Turn data into insight: Identify patterns, trends, and business opportunities through reporting and storytelling.

SQL (Redshift), Tableau, Superset, Airflow, Git, Excel, PowerPoint, HubSpot, Amplitude, Looker Studio and possibly Python/R if you're ready to explore more advanced analysis.




What We‚Äôre Looking For

  • You're detail-oriented, but also love seeing the big picture.
  • You enjoy talking to people and helping them turn ‚ÄúI think‚Äù into ‚ÄúI know‚Äù.
  • You‚Äôre fluent in English and Italian. You like working in an international, collaborative environment.
  • Willing to be relocated in Rome


Extra brownie points if you‚Äôve dabbled with Python or R, have worked with CRMs like HubSpot or Salesforce, or have experience with tools like Amplitude or Segment. But don‚Äôt worry ‚Äì none of these are must-haves.



Why Join Us?

Because here, you‚Äôre not just a number-cruncher , you‚Äôre a partner in making healthcare better.

  • üß† Real impact: Your insights will help thousands of doctors and millions of patients.
